Introduction.TITLE: Introduction to Catalysis
Introduction.DESCRIPTION: Introduces the important aspects of catalytic reactions.

Crystal Structures.TITLE: Crystal Plane Miller Indices
Crystal Structures.DESCRIPTION: Explains the Miller indices notation used to label planes in a crystal structure.

Crystal Structures.TITLE: Miller-Bravais Indices: Hexagonal Structure
Crystal Structures.DESCRIPTION: Determines the four-parameter Miller-Bravais indices for an hexagonal unit cell.

Crystal Structures.TITLE: Tetrahedral and Octahedral Sites
Crystal Structures.DESCRIPTION: Describes the locations of tetrahedral and octahedral sites in a face-centered cubic (FCC) crystal structure.

Selectivity and Equilibrium.TITLE: Catalytic Selectivity and Equilibrium
Selectivity and Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: An overview of the benefit of catalysts in both reaction selectivity and equilibrium.

Selectivity and Equilibrium.TITLE: Heterogeneous Chemical Equilibrium
Selectivity and Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Given the Gibbs free energy at two temperatures, determine the maximum temperature for a heterogeneous reaction to occur.

Selectivity and Equilibrium.TITLE: Kinetics and Thermodynamics
Selectivity and Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Discusses the differences between reaction kinetics and thermodynamics and describes how thermodynamics is important in kinetics and reactor design.

Selectivity and Equilibrium.TITLE: Parallel Reactions and Selectivity
Selectivity and Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Describes the effects of concentration, temperature, and reactor type on selectivity for parallel reactions.

Selectivity and Equilibrium.TITLE: Perturb Heterogeneous Equilibrium (Interactive)
Selectivity and Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: MCQ: When a solid is added to a system that is in chemical equilibrium, what happens to the equilibrium partial pressures? Interactive screencast.

Selectivity and Equilibrium.TITLE: Series Reactions and Selectivity
Selectivity and Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Describes the effect of reaction time on selectivity for a series reaction.

Selectivity and Equilibrium.TITLE: Which Reaction Reaches Equilibrium First? (Interactive)
Selectivity and Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: MCQ: Given the equilibrium constants for two reactions, what can be concluded about which reaction reaches equilibrium first or which has a higher equilibrium conversion? Interactive screencast.

Reaction Kinetics.TITLE: Apparent Activation Energy
Reaction Kinetics.DESCRIPTION: Explains how the apparent activation energy for a catalytic reaction depends on the surface reaction activation energy and the heats of adsorption of reactants.

Reaction Kinetics.TITLE: Description of the Reaction Coordinate
Reaction Kinetics.DESCRIPTION: Explains the energy versus reaction coordinate diagram. Relates the activation energies for the forward and reverse reactions of an exothermic reaction to the equilibrium constant dependence on temperature.

Reaction Kinetics.TITLE: Eley-Rideal Surface Reaction
Reaction Kinetics.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to derive a rate expression for an Eley-Rideal surface reaction.

Reaction Kinetics.TITLE: Langmuir-Hinshelwood Kinetics
Reaction Kinetics.DESCRIPTION: For a surface reaction, use proposed mechanisms to verify the model as Langmuir Hinshelwood kinetics.

Reaction Kinetics.TITLE: Steady-State Approximation
Reaction Kinetics.DESCRIPTION: Using rate constant information for a two step reaction, use steady-state approximations to determine an overall rate expression for the product formation.

Reaction Kinetics.TITLE: Steady-State Approximation Part 2
Reaction Kinetics.DESCRIPTION: Applies the steady-state approximation to a sequence of elementary steps to obtain a rate expression.

Reaction Kinetics.TITLE: Steady-State Approximation vs. Rate Determining Step
Reaction Kinetics.DESCRIPTION: Compares the rate expression obtained from the steady-state approximation (part 1) to the expression from the rate-determining step assumption.

Adsorption/Desorption.TITLE: Adsorption Introduction
Adsorption/Desorption.DESCRIPTION: Explains the concept of adsorption and derives the Langmuir isotherm.

Adsorption/Desorption.TITLE: Heat of Adsorption Calculation
Adsorption/Desorption.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the heat of adsorption from adsorption measurements at low coverages.

Adsorption/Desorption.TITLE: Langmuir Isotherm: Dissociative Adsorption
Adsorption/Desorption.DESCRIPTION: Derives the Langmuir isotherm for dissociative adsorption of hydrogen on a Pt catalyst.

Adsorption/Desorption.TITLE: Langmuir Isotherms for Binary Mixture (Simulation)
Adsorption/Desorption.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the amounts adsorbed on a surface for a binary gas mixture using an interactive Mathematica simulation. The adsorption is modeled using extended Langmuir isotherms.

Adsorption/Desorption.TITLE: Temperature-Programmed Desorption
Adsorption/Desorption.DESCRIPTION: Explains temperature-programmed desorption (TPD) and solves the equations for first-order desorption.

Adsorption/Desorption.TITLE: Temperature-Programmed Desorption (Simulation)
Adsorption/Desorption.DESCRIPTION: Describes how to use an interactive simulation that models temperature-programmed desorption. The simulation is located at: http://demonstrations.wolfram.com/TemperatureProgrammedDesorption/

Mass Transfer/Diffusion.TITLE: Diffusion and Reaction in a Cylindrical Porous Catalyst
Mass Transfer/Diffusion.DESCRIPTION: Given a concentration gradient in a porous cylindrical catalyst pellet, determine the amount reacting within the cylinder.

Mass Transfer/Diffusion.TITLE: Effectiveness Factor for a Spherical Catalyst
Mass Transfer/Diffusion.DESCRIPTION: Calculates how the total rate of reaction increases in a porous catalyst sphere (whose effectiveness factor is less than one) when the diameter increases.

Mass Transfer/Diffusion.TITLE: Effectiveness Factor for Single Catalyst Pore
Mass Transfer/Diffusion.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the concentration gradient and the effectiveness factor for a catalyst pore with catalyst on the walls by carrying out a differential material balance.

Mass Transfer/Diffusion.TITLE: Mass Transfer in a Catalyst Sphere
Mass Transfer/Diffusion.DESCRIPTION: Uses a shell balance to determine the rate of product formed with respect to time for a spherical catalyst.

Introduction.TITLE: Density of an Element
Introduction.DESCRIPTION: Given the density of rhodium and its crystal structure, calculate it atomic radius.

Introduction.TITLE: Density of Iron
Introduction.DESCRIPTION: Given the edge length of a cube for iron in the body-centered cubic structure, determine its density.

Introduction.TITLE: Final Concentration Using Unit Conversions
Introduction.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to find a final concentration using an initial solution by using unit conversions.

Introduction.TITLE: Unit Conversion
Introduction.DESCRIPTION: Use units conversion to determine mass, given density and volume, where the volume units are different from the volume units in density.

Atoms, Molecules and Ions.TITLE: Isotope Composition
Atoms, Molecules and Ions.DESCRIPTION: Given atomic masses of 3 isotopes of silicon, the percent of one isotope in the mixture and the average atomic mass, determine the percent of one of the other isotopes in the mixture.

Atoms, Molecules and Ions.TITLE: Isotopic Abundance
Atoms, Molecules and Ions.DESCRIPTION: Give the atomic mass of an element and the masses of its two isotopes, calculate the relative abundances of the two isotopes.

Atoms, Molecules and Ions.TITLE: Lattice Energy
Atoms, Molecules and Ions.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the lattice energy for a salt using a Bohr-Haber cycle to determine the enthalpy change to form the gas from gas phase ions.

Atoms, Molecules and Ions.TITLE: Molecular Mass
Atoms, Molecules and Ions.DESCRIPTION: Given a chemical formula, calculate its molecular mass.

Atoms, Molecules and Ions.TITLE: Number of Protons Neutrons Electrons
Atoms, Molecules and Ions.DESCRIPTION: Determine the number of protons, neutrons, and electrons in an anionic compound.

Atoms, Molecules and Ions.TITLE: Which Molecule is not Polar?
Atoms, Molecules and Ions.DESCRIPTION: Given five molecules, determine which is not polar by drawing the Lewis structure and  determining the molecular structure.

Electronic Structure of Atoms.TITLE: Assigning Oxidation States
Electronic Structure of Atoms.DESCRIPTION: Presents the rules used to assign oxidation numbers to atoms with examples. Discusses the difference between oxidation number and formal charge.

Electronic Structure of Atoms.TITLE: Chemical Formula and Structure
Electronic Structure of Atoms.DESCRIPTION: Determine the chemical formula for a binary compound, given a diagram of its crystal structure.

Electronic Structure of Atoms.TITLE: Determining Favored Resonance Structures
Electronic Structure of Atoms.DESCRIPTION: Determines the favored resonance structure by using the octet rule and formal charges.

Electronic Structure of Atoms.TITLE: Empirical Formula from Mass Percentages
Electronic Structure of Atoms.DESCRIPTION: Determines the empirical formula of a known compound using given mass percentages.

Electronic Structure of Atoms.TITLE: Formal Charge
Electronic Structure of Atoms.DESCRIPTION: Determine the formal charge on the best Lewis structure of NO+.

Electronic Structure of Atoms.TITLE: Lewis Dot Structure Examples
Electronic Structure of Atoms.DESCRIPTION: Gives a couple of examples of doing Lewis dot structures of simple compounds.

Electronic Structure of Atoms.TITLE: Lewis Dot Structures: Molecular Geometry
Electronic Structure of Atoms.DESCRIPTION: Gives examples of Lewis dot structures for water and ammonia to show how they result in bent and pyramidal structures.

Electronic Structure of Atoms.TITLE: Lewis Dot Structures: Octet Rule
Electronic Structure of Atoms.DESCRIPTION: Determine which molecule does not satisfy the octet rule in the Lewis structure.

Electronic Structure of Atoms.TITLE: Lewis Dot Structures: Triple Bond
Electronic Structure of Atoms.DESCRIPTION: Determine which of these five molecules has a triple bond by drawing Lewis structures.

Electronic Structure of Atoms.TITLE: Molecular Geometry
Electronic Structure of Atoms.DESCRIPTION: Determine the geometry of TeF5- using the periodic table and Lewis structures.

Electronic Structure of Atoms.TITLE: Molecular Shape (VSEPR)
Electronic Structure of Atoms.DESCRIPTION: Using the valence shell electron pair repulsion (VSEPR) model, determine the structure of AsCl3.

Gases.TITLE: Amount of Gas Product Formed
Gases.DESCRIPTION: Determines the volume of the gas-phase product given the masses of two reactants and using the ideal gas law. Identifies the limiting reactant.

Gases.TITLE: Gas Density
Gases.DESCRIPTION: Use the ideal gas law and the molecular weights of 5 molecules to determine which molecule has the highest mass density

Gases.TITLE: Gas-Phase Equilibrium
Gases.DESCRIPTION: Given the equilibrium constants for a gas-phase reaction and the number of moles of two of the components involved in reaction, determine the number of moles of the third component.

Gases.TITLE: Ideal Gas Law Example
Gases.DESCRIPTION: Calculate the volume of a gas that expands to a lower pressure at constant temperature using the ideal gas law.

Gases.TITLE: Ideal Gas Properties
Gases.DESCRIPTION: Apply the ideal gas law twice to a system in which initial conditions are given, additional gas is added and the temperature changed.

Gases.TITLE: Identify Gas Using Ideal Gas Law
Gases.DESCRIPTION: A gas is identified by measuring its pressure, temperature, and volume and its weight and using the ideal gas law.

Gases.TITLE: Molar Mass of a Gas
Gases.DESCRIPTION: Given the density of a gas at a certain temperature and pressure, calculate its molar mass using the ideal gas law.

Gases.TITLE: Partial Pressures
Gases.DESCRIPTION: The partial pressures of a binary gas mixture are calculated, given the number of grams of each molecule in the mixture.

Gases.TITLE: Ranking Vapor Pressures
Gases.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to conceptually determine the vapor pressure of various molecules based on their bond strengths.

Solids, Liquids, and Phase Changes.TITLE: Boiling Point from Heat of Vaporization
Solids, Liquids, and Phase Changes.DESCRIPTION: Given the heat of vaporization of water and its boiling point at 1 bar, determine its boiling point at 1.5 bar using the Clausius-Clapeyron equation.

Solids, Liquids, and Phase Changes.TITLE: Boiling Point from PVT Diagram
Solids, Liquids, and Phase Changes.DESCRIPTION: Determine the normal boiling point using a PVT diagram for an unknown molecule.

Solids, Liquids, and Phase Changes.TITLE: Heat of Vaporization from Vapor Pressure
Solids, Liquids, and Phase Changes.DESCRIPTION: Use the vapor pressures at two temperatures and the Clasius-Clapeyron equation to determine the heat of vaporization.

Solids, Liquids, and Phase Changes.TITLE: Phase Behavior on a PV Diagram (Simulation)
Solids, Liquids, and Phase Changes.DESCRIPTION: Describes how to use the interactive simulation that represents the pressure-volume behavior for water. The simulation is located at: http://demonstrations.wolfram.com/PhaseBehaviorOnAPressureVolumeDiagram/

Solids, Liquids, and Phase Changes.TITLE: Which Phase is Stable?
Solids, Liquids, and Phase Changes.DESCRIPTION: Determine the temperature where phase transition occurs and which phase is stable at higher temperatures, given enthalpy change and entropy change for the phase change of solid tin.

Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Osmotic Pressures
Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Calculate the osmotic pressure given the number of grams of sucrose dissolved in water.

Chemical Kinetics.TITLE: Activation Energy Example
Chemical Kinetics.DESCRIPTION: Given the activation energy for an uncatalyzed reaction, the activation energy for the catalyzed reaction is calculated.

Chemical Kinetics.TITLE: Determining Favorability of Reactions
Chemical Kinetics.DESCRIPTION: Shows how to determine favorability of reactions with respect to energy using various examples.

Chemical Kinetics.TITLE: First Order Kinetics Calculations
Chemical Kinetics.DESCRIPTION: Utilizes the first order reaction equation to determine time-dependent concentration problems.

Chemical Kinetics.TITLE: Fractional Conversion (Interactive)
Chemical Kinetics.DESCRIPTION: Multiple choice question: Examine how fractional conversion relates between species in a reaction.

Chemical Kinetics.TITLE: Kinetics: Reaction Time
Chemical Kinetics.DESCRIPTION: Calculate the time it takes to reach the final concentration for a second-order reaction, given the rate constant and the initial and final concentrations.

Chemical Kinetics.TITLE: Kinetics: Reaction Time 2
Chemical Kinetics.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the time to reach a final concentration, given the initial concentration of reactant and the rate constant for a first-order reaction.

Chemical Kinetics.TITLE: Limiting Reagent (Interactive)
Chemical Kinetics.DESCRIPTION: Multiple choice question: Determine amount of product formed based on conversion of limiting reactant.

Chemical Kinetics.TITLE: Non-Spontaneous Reaction
Chemical Kinetics.DESCRIPTION: Given that the entropy change for a non-spontaneous reaction is negative, what can be said about the signs of the changes in enthalpy and Gibbs free energy?

Chemical Kinetics.TITLE: Pressure Change with Reaction
Chemical Kinetics.DESCRIPTION: The final pressure is calculated for a reaction taking place in a fixed volume container. The amount of reactant that reacts is given and the number of moles of gas increases

Chemical Kinetics.TITLE: Rate Constant for a Reversible Reaction
Chemical Kinetics.DESCRIPTION: Determines the reverse rate constant given the equilibrium constant and the forward rate constant for an elementary reaction.

Chemical Kinetics.TITLE: Rate of First Order Reaction
Chemical Kinetics.DESCRIPTION: Given the amount of reactant A reacting in 100 s for a first-order reaction, determine the number of molecules remaining at 300 s.

Chemical Kinetics.TITLE: Rates of Reaction
Chemical Kinetics.DESCRIPTION: Determine how the rate of reaction for a reactant relates to the rate of reaction for a product.

Chemical Kinetics.TITLE: Reaction Mechanism
Chemical Kinetics.DESCRIPTION: Determine the expected order of reaction given a reaction mechanism for a chemical reaction.

Chemical Kinetics.TITLE: Reaction Order from Initial Rate Data
Chemical Kinetics.DESCRIPTION: Given initial rate data, determine the order of the reaction for one of the reactants.

Chemical Kinetics.TITLE: Reaction Rate Law
Chemical Kinetics.DESCRIPTION: Determines the reaction rate law from initial rate data for a liquid-phase reaction.

Chemical Kinetics.TITLE: Temperature Dependence on Rate Constant
Chemical Kinetics.DESCRIPTION: Given the rate constant at one temperature and the activation energy for a reaction, determine the temperature where the rate constant has a higher value.

Chemical Equilibrium.TITLE: Calculating the Percent Yield of a Reaction
Chemical Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the percent yield in order to determine the amount of theoretical reagents needed in a reaction.

Chemical Equilibrium.TITLE: Chemical equilibrium and LeChatelier's principle
Chemical Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Uses an interactive Mathematica simulation to demonstrate the behavior for gas-phase equilibrium for ammmonia formation from nitrogen and hydrogen. Demonstrates the behavior as change temperature or pressure or as add H2, H2, or NH3.

Chemical Equilibrium.TITLE: Equilibrium Concentrations
Chemical Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the equilibrium concentrations for an isomerization reaction given the starting concentrations of reactants and products.

Chemical Equilibrium.TITLE: Equilibrium Constant from Concentration
Chemical Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the equilibrium constant given information about the initial number of moles of reactant and the equilibrium concentration of product.

Chemical Equilibrium.TITLE: Equilibrium Constant from Concentration 2
Chemical Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the value of the equilibrium constant (Kc) from concentration as a function of time for a reaction that goes to equilibrium.

Chemical Equilibrium.TITLE: Finding the Reaction Equilibrium Using le Chatlier's Principle
Chemical Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use Le Chatlier's principle to determine the equilibrium of a reaction at various conditions.

Chemical Equilibrium.TITLE: LeChatelier's principle does not always work
Chemical Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Presents an example where LeChatelier's principle predicts the wrong direction for the equilibrium shift. The reaction is N2 + 3 H2 --> NH3  The number of moles at equilibrium are calculated using an interactive Mathematica simulation.

Stoichiometry.TITLE: Calculate Amount of Reactant Needed
Stoichiometry.DESCRIPTION: Calculate the amount of CO needed to react with a given mass of Fe2O3

Stoichiometry.TITLE: Calculate Concentration
Stoichiometry.DESCRIPTION: Calculate the final volume when dilute a solution of NaOH, given the initial volume and molar concentration and final molar concentration.

Stoichiometry.TITLE: Calculate Mass of Product Formed
Stoichiometry.DESCRIPTION: Given the masses of two reactants, determine how many grams of one of  the products form and identify the reactant in excess.

Stoichiometry.TITLE: Create Diluted Solution
Stoichiometry.DESCRIPTION: How much water must to added to a HCL solution to create a solution with lower molarity?

Stoichiometry.TITLE: Empirical Formula from Combustion Analysis
Stoichiometry.DESCRIPTION: Given the mass of CO2 and H2O formed, and the initial mass of an unknown compound, determine its empirical formula.

Stoichiometry.TITLE: Empirical Formula from Combustion Analysis 2
Stoichiometry.DESCRIPTION: Given the mass of CO2 and H2O formed, and the initial mass of an unknown compound, determine its empirical formula.

Stoichiometry.TITLE: Mass Composition from Molar Composition
Stoichiometry.DESCRIPTION: Given the masses of two reactants, determine how many grams of one of  the products form and identify the reactant in excess.

Stoichiometry.TITLE: Reaction Stoichiometry (Interactive)
Stoichiometry.DESCRIPTION: MCQ: Determine amount of a product formed based on reactant information.

Stoichiometry.TITLE: Using the Ideal Gas Law to Determine the Limiting Reagent
Stoichiometry.DESCRIPTION: Uses the ideal gas law to determine the limiting reactant to find the final pressure of a system.

Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.TITLE: Acid Dissociation Constant
Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the acid dissociation constant given the pH for a starting concentration of formic acid.

Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.TITLE: Balance Redox Reaction: Acidic Solution
Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.DESCRIPTION: Balance an oxidation/reduction reaction in acidic solution using the half-reaction method

Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.TITLE: Balance Redox Reaction: Acidic Solution 2
Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.DESCRIPTION: Balance an oxidation/reduction reaction in acidic solution using the half-reaction method. For this reaction, iodine is both oxidized and reduced.

Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.TITLE: Balance Redox Reaction: Basic Solution
Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.DESCRIPTION: Balance an oxidation/reduction reaction in basic solution using the half-reaction method.

Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.TITLE: Bronsted-Lowry Acids
Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.DESCRIPTION: Shows how to determine the Bronsted-Lowry acid and its conjugate base in a reaction.

Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.TITLE: Hydrogen Ion and Hydroxide Ion Concentrations
Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the hydroxide ion concentration and the pH given the hydrogen ion concentration.

Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.TITLE: Molar Solubility of a Salt
Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.DESCRIPTION: Determines the solubility of a salt in the presence of NaCl in solution, using the solubility product constant.

Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.TITLE: Oxidation Number
Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.DESCRIPTION: Determine the oxidation number of an element in an ion.

Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.TITLE: Oxidation Number 2
Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.DESCRIPTION: Determine the oxidation number of an element in an ion.

Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.TITLE: Oxidizing and Reducing Agents
Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.DESCRIPTION: Identify which species is the oxidizing agent and which is the reducing agent

Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.TITLE: pH of a Strong Electrolyte
Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the pH of a Ba(OH)2 solution.

Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.TITLE: pH of a Weak Acid
Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the pH of an acetic acid solution given the acid ionization constant.

Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.TITLE: pH of Buffer Solution
Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the pH of a buffer solution when a salt and an ammonia solution are added to water to make a 1-liter solution.

Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.TITLE: pH of Dilute Solution
Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.DESCRIPTION: Calculate the pH of a HCl solution after the solution is diluted by adding water.

Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.TITLE: pH of NH3 Solution
Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the pH when an ammonium salt solution and a NH3 solution are mixed.

Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.TITLE: Precipitation Reaction (Spectator Ions)
Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.DESCRIPTION: Given two compounds that dissolve in water and form a solid precipitate, identify the spectator ions.

Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.TITLE: Titrate Base with Acid
Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.DESCRIPTION: Calculate the volume of H2SO4 needed to titrate a given volume of NaOH solution

Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.TITLE: Titration
Reactions in Aqueous Solutions.DESCRIPTION: Calculate the volume of acid needed to titrate a given volume of base.

Thermochemistry.TITLE: Bond Dissociation Energy Example
Thermochemistry.DESCRIPTION: Calculate the unknown bond dissociation energy given the heat of reaction and bond dissociation energies.

Thermochemistry.TITLE: Changes in Enthalpy and Internal Energy
Thermochemistry.DESCRIPTION: Use the first law and the definition of enthalpy to calculate the change in internal energy and the change in enthalpy, given heat is added to a system and the volume change occurs at constant pressure.

Thermochemistry.TITLE: Enthalpies of Formation
Thermochemistry.DESCRIPTION: Uses enthalpies of formation to determine the heat of reaction.

Thermochemistry.TITLE: Enthalpy and internal energy changes
Thermochemistry.DESCRIPTION: Determine for which reactions the change in internal energy is greater than the change in enthalpy.

Thermochemistry.TITLE: Heat Absorbed During a Reaction
Thermochemistry.DESCRIPTION: Calculate the amount of heat added to a system in which 45 g of carbon reacts in an endothermic reaction.

Thermochemistry.TITLE: Heat and Work for an Exothermic Reaction
Thermochemistry.DESCRIPTION: Determine the signs of heat and work when an  exothermic, gas-phase reaction takes place in a constant pressure piston/cylinder arrangement.

Thermochemistry.TITLE: Heat From Latent and Sensible Heat
Thermochemistry.DESCRIPTION: Explains the difference between latent and sensible heat and demonstrates how to calculate the total heat required to convert steam to ice at specified temperatures.

Thermochemistry.TITLE: Heat of Reaction Example
Thermochemistry.DESCRIPTION: When Li solid is added to water, the temperature increases. Determine the heat of this reaction

Thermochemistry.TITLE: Heat of Reaction from a Calorimeter
Thermochemistry.DESCRIPTION: Calculate the heat of reaction for the acid-base reaction given the temperature change measured in a calorimeter when an acid and a base are mixed.

Thermochemistry.TITLE: Heat of Reaction from Bond Dissociation Energy
Thermochemistry.DESCRIPTION: Use the bond dissociation energies to calculate the heat of reaction for the oxidaiton of H2 to make H2O2

Thermochemistry.TITLE: Heat of Reaction: Hess' Law

Thermochemistry.TITLE: Heat of Reaction: Hess' Law 2
Thermochemistry.DESCRIPTION: Given heats of reaction for several reactions, use Hess's law to calculate the heat of reaction for another reaction.

Thermochemistry.TITLE: Signs of Gibbs Energy, Enthalpy, and Entropy
Thermochemistry.DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use Gibbs Free Energy, Enthalpy, and Entropy to understand an endothermic reaction.

Thermochemistry.TITLE: Thermodynamic Variables
Thermochemistry.DESCRIPTION: Determine the signs of delta G, delta H, and delta S when a gas spontaneously forms a solid.

Physical Chemistry.TITLE: Derivation of the Free Particle Equation in One Direction
Physical Chemistry.DESCRIPTION: Derives the Schrodinger wave equation for a free particle in the x-direction.

Physical Chemistry.TITLE: Relationship Between Arrhenius Activation Energy and Transition State Theory (Eyring Equation)
Physical Chemistry.DESCRIPTION: Introduces how activation energy can be computed from enthalpy change of the transition state.

Physical Chemistry.TITLE: Thermodynamic Interpretation of Transition State Theory: The Eyring Equation
Physical Chemistry.DESCRIPTION: Introduces how rate constants can be calculated from thermodynamic properties of transition states.

Physical Chemistry.TITLE: Three Intermolecular Potential Models (Simulation)
Physical Chemistry.DESCRIPTION: Describes how to use an interactive simulation that shows intermolecular potentials versus distance for two molecules (A and B) and a potential for their interaction (A-B). The simulation is located at: http://demonstrations.wolfram.com/ThreeIntermolecularPotentialModels/

Basics.TITLE: An Alternate to Excel's VLOOKUP For Searches in Tables
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Combines the INDEX and MATCH function in Excel to look up values in a table.

Basics.TITLE: An Introduction to Excel's Built-in Functions

Basics.TITLE: Data Tables in Excel

Basics.TITLE: Data Tables in Excel: Two Dependent Variables
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to use data tables in Excel 2010 when two variables are changing.

Basics.TITLE: Dynamic Naming of Arrays in Excel
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Shows how to dynamically name arrays in Excel using the lookup function and the offset function.

Basics.TITLE: Entering an Equation into Excel
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to input an equation into Excel 2010 using an engineering example.

Basics.TITLE: Excel Case Study: Cantilever Beam Part 1 - Spreadsheet Setup

Basics.TITLE: Excel Case Study: Cantilever Beam Part 3 - One-Way Data Table
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Set of 4 screencasts that demonstrate how to perform a case study on a cantilever beam. This screencasts shows how to perform a one-way case study by creating a Data Table in Excel.

Basics.TITLE: Excel Case Study: Cantilever Beam Part 4 - Two-Way Data Table
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Set of 4 screencasts that demonstrate how to perform a case study on a cantilever beam. This screencasts shows how to perform a two-way case study by creating a Data Table in Excel.

Basics.TITLE: Excel Case Study: Circular Calculation
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use circular calculations to perform a two-way case study using the Colebrook equation.

Basics.TITLE: Excel Goal Seek Example

Basics.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to use goal seek in Excel 2010.

Basics.TITLE: Excel Solver Introduction
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Describes how to use the solver function in Excel 2010.

Basics.TITLE: Excel Syntax and Order of Operations
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Explains the order of operations in an excel formula and goes through several examples of converting algebraic formulas into Excel syntax.

Basics.TITLE: Formatting in Excel
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Presents some simple formatting tips for Excel 2010.

Basics.TITLE: Formatting Numbers in Excel
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates several ways to format numbers in Excel 2010.

Basics.TITLE: Golden Section Search Method
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Describes how the Golden Search Method works and then describes how to set it up in Microsoft Excel.

Basics.TITLE: Importing Data into Excel
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to import data into Excel 2010.

Basics.TITLE: Introduction to Excel-1
Basics.DESCRIPTION: An introduction to using Excel 2010; part 1 of a series in which formatting and manipulating of cells is explained.

Basics.TITLE: Introduction to Excel-2
Basics.DESCRIPTION: An introduction to using Excel 2010; part 2 of a series in which the file menu is explained.

Basics.TITLE: Introduction to Excel-3
Basics.DESCRIPTION: An introduction to using Excel 2010; part 3 of a series in which the use of tabs in the ribbon are explained.

Basics.TITLE: Iterative Solutions/Excel
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to solve an equation using an iterative approach in Excel 2010.

Basics.TITLE: Linear Regression in Excel
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the regression tool in Excel for a simple linear regression.

Basics.TITLE: Lookup Functions in Excel Part 1: VLOOKUP
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use VLOOKUP to look through a table to find various values.

Basics.TITLE: Lookup Functions in Excel Part 2: MATCH, OFFSET, and INDEX Functions
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Explains the different excel functions MATCH, OFFSET, and INDEX and goes through an example that utilizes all the of the functions.

Basics.TITLE: Referencing Cells in Excel

Basics.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the Solver tool to solve optimization problems in Excel.

Plots.TITLE: 3D Plots in Excel

Plots.TITLE: Bar Graphs in Excel
Plots.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to make a bar graph using Excel 2010.

Buoyancy/Floatation.TITLE: Addition of a Fluid to a Submerged Object (Interactive)

Buoyancy/Floatation.TITLE: What is Buoyancy?
Buoyancy/Floatation.DESCRIPTION: Introduces the concept of buoyancy and gives several examples.

Pressure Variation in a Fluid.TITLE: Derive Equation for a Fluid at Rest

Viscous Flow in Pipes.DESCRIPTION: Determine volumetric flow and velocity for oil flowing in a pipe and use the Reynolds number to verify laminar flow properties.

Viscous Flow in Pipes.TITLE: Where is the Shear Stress Greatest? (Interactive)
Viscous Flow in Pipes.DESCRIPTION: Given a velocity profile, where is the shear stress greatest? Interactive screencast.

Flow Around Objects.TITLE: Blasius Solution for the y-Component of Velocity
Flow Around Objects.DESCRIPTION: Uses the Blasius solutions to develop an expression for the y-component of velocity at the edge of a boundary layer.

Flow Around Objects.TITLE: Boundary Layer Example Problem
Flow Around Objects.DESCRIPTION: Example problem that demonstrates the use of boundary layers and boundary layer thickness as well as flow regime (laminar or turbulent) to define the entry length section.

Flow Around Objects.TITLE: Boundary Layers
Flow Around Objects.DESCRIPTION: An introduction to the boundary layer for internal and external flow and how to determine the entry length of the flow and the boundary layer thickness.

Flow Around Objects.TITLE: Direction of Lift Force (Interactive)
Flow Around Objects.DESCRIPTION: MCQ: Based on flow around an object, what is the direction of the lift force? Interactive screencast.

Flow Around Objects.TITLE: Drag Force on an Irregular Object
Flow Around Objects.DESCRIPTION: The drag force is used to calculate the amount of gas it takes for three trucks with different shapes to travel a certain distance.

Flow Around Objects.TITLE: Lift and Drag on Aircraft
Flow Around Objects.DESCRIPTION: An example problem on using lift and drag on an aircraft to find power.

Flow Around Objects.TITLE: Pressure Drag
Flow Around Objects.DESCRIPTION: Pressure drag is defined and an example is used to demonstrate its principles.

Flow Around Objects.TITLE: Shear Stress at a Wall: Blasius Solutions
Flow Around Objects.DESCRIPTION: Uses the Blasius solutions to find the shear stress at a wall as a function of plate length.

Flow Around Objects.TITLE: y-Component of Velocity at a Boundary Layer
Flow Around Objects.DESCRIPTION: Shows how to find the y-component of velocity at the edge of a boundary layer at any point along the length of a flat plate.

Fluid Kinematics.TITLE: Acceleration along a Streamline
Fluid Kinematics.DESCRIPTION: Determine local, convective and acceleration at specific points given velocities and linear relationship.

Fluid Kinematics.TITLE: Acceleration along a Streamline (Baseball Example)
Fluid Kinematics.DESCRIPTION: Determines the acceleration along a streamline given the velocity function.

Fluid Kinematics.TITLE: Acceleration Field Given a Velocity Field
Fluid Kinematics.DESCRIPTION: Determine the acceleration components based on Cartesian components of a velocity field.

Fluid Kinematics.TITLE: Control Volume vs Systems Representations (Bio)
Fluid Kinematics.DESCRIPTION: Describes the concept of a control volume approach to fluid flow compared to a systems approach.

Fluid Kinematics.TITLE: Fluid Acceleration (Interactive)
Fluid Kinematics.DESCRIPTION: Multiple choice question: Does a river accelerate as it passes through this conduit? Interactive screencast.

Fluid Kinematics.TITLE: Fluid Flow through a Control Volume
Fluid Kinematics.DESCRIPTION: Determine what happens to a flowing system at a later time and fluid flow through a control volume using the Reynolds Transport Theorem.

Fluid Kinematics.TITLE: Fluid Kinematics Calculations
Fluid Kinematics.DESCRIPTION: Determine the volumetric dilatation rate, the rotation vector and angular rotation for a 3D flow field.

Fluid Kinematics.TITLE: How to Sketch Streamlines
Fluid Kinematics.DESCRIPTION: An example that demonstrates how to sketch streamlines within the flow using the velocity components and the stream function.

Fluid Kinematics.TITLE: Introduction to Fluid Kinematics
Fluid Kinematics.DESCRIPTION: An introduction to the equations used in fluid kinematics including translation, volume dilatation rate, rotation, and angular deformation.

Fluid Kinematics.TITLE: Local and Convective Acceleration from Velocity Profiles
Fluid Kinematics.DESCRIPTION: Given velocity profiles at two different points in a flow, the total, local and convective accelerations are calculated.

Fluid Kinematics.TITLE: Reynolds Transport Theorem
Fluid Kinematics.DESCRIPTION: Reynold's Transport Theorem is described, including why it was developed and how it is used in different situations.

Fluid Kinematics.TITLE: Shear Stress vs. Rate of Shearing Strain (Interactive)
Fluid Kinematics.DESCRIPTION: Based on plots relating shear stress to the rate of shearing strain for different fluids, which one is the shear thickening fluid? Interactive screencast.

Fluid Kinematics.TITLE: Velocity Fields and Streamlines
Fluid Kinematics.DESCRIPTION: Conceptual visualization of velocity fields and how to determine streamline equations given velocity fields.

Dimensional Analysis and Scaling.TITLE: Buckingham Pi Theorem Application
Dimensional Analysis and Scaling.DESCRIPTION: Describes how the coefficient of drag is correlated to the Reynolds number and how these dimensionless parameters were found.

Dimensional Analysis and Scaling.TITLE: Deriving the Dimensionless Equations of Motion
Dimensional Analysis and Scaling.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to non-dimensionalize the momentum equations.

Dimensional Analysis and Scaling.TITLE: Determining Pi Terms (Buckingham Pi Theorem)
Dimensional Analysis and Scaling.DESCRIPTION: Utilizes the Buckingham pi theorem to determine Pi terms for a wave.

Dimensional Analysis and Scaling.TITLE: Dimensions of Differential Equations
Dimensional Analysis and Scaling.DESCRIPTION: Determine the units of constants in a dimensionally homogeneous equation.

Dimensional Analysis and Scaling.TITLE: Dynamic Similitude - Scaling (Interactive)
Dimensional Analysis and Scaling.DESCRIPTION: What must the flow parameters be in a model case to predict results for a real prototype? Interactive screencasts.

Dimensional Analysis and Scaling.TITLE: Scaling a Model Airplane Wing (Interactive)
Dimensional Analysis and Scaling.DESCRIPTION: MCQ: If a model airplane is being built using a length scale, how is the wing area scaled? Interactive screencast.

Dimensional Analysis and Scaling.TITLE: Scaling Analysis
Dimensional Analysis and Scaling.DESCRIPTION: Performs a scaling analysis on a blimp flowing through water to estimate the drag and power consumption of a full size prototype.

Dimensional Analysis and Scaling.TITLE: Using Similitude to Predict Results (Glacier Example)
Dimensional Analysis and Scaling.DESCRIPTION: Determine appropriate dimensionless parameters to scale between model and prototype and predict results in the prototype.

Dimensional Analysis and Scaling.TITLE: Using Similitude to Scale from Model to Prototype
Dimensional Analysis and Scaling.DESCRIPTION: Determines pi groups using Buckingham pi theorem to scale force acting on a model to a prototype.

Dimensional Analysis and Scaling.TITLE: Utility of Dimensionless Parameters
Dimensional Analysis and Scaling.DESCRIPTION: Describes the importance of plotting dimensionless parameters as a function of other dimensionless  variables to develop correlations. Uses the coefficient of drag and the Reynolds number as an example.

Introduction to Heat Transfer.TITLE: Heat Transfer Basics
Introduction to Heat Transfer.DESCRIPTION: Explains the types of heat transfer and the terms associated with the governing equations.

Introduction to Heat Transfer.TITLE: Heat Transfer Parameters and Units
Introduction to Heat Transfer.DESCRIPTION: Discusses the most common heat transfer parameters and associated units.

Introduction to Heat Transfer.TITLE: Introduction to Heat Transfer - Potato Example
Introduction to Heat Transfer.DESCRIPTION: An experiment is discussed with a student to demonstrate the main concepts of heat transfer.

The Heat Equation/Temperature Distributi.TITLE: Boundary Conditions
The Heat Equation/Temperature Distributi.DESCRIPTION: Compares various boundary conditions for a steady-state, one-dimensional system.

The Heat Equation/Temperature Distributi.TITLE: Conduction Equation Derivation
The Heat Equation/Temperature Distributi.DESCRIPTION: Derives the equation for conductive heat transfer through a plane wall at steady-state conditions.

The Heat Equation/Temperature Distributi.TITLE: Heat Equation Derivation
The Heat Equation/Temperature Distributi.DESCRIPTION: Derives the heat equation using an energy balance on a differential control volume.

The Heat Equation/Temperature Distributi.TITLE: Heat Equation Derivation: Cylindrical Coordinates
The Heat Equation/Temperature Distributi.DESCRIPTION: Derives the heat diffusion equation in cylindrical coordinates.

One-Dimensional Steady-State.TITLE: Composite Wall with a Series/Parallel Configuration
One-Dimensional Steady-State.DESCRIPTION: Shows how to write a thermal circuit for a composite wall with two different materials in series and parallel.

One-Dimensional Steady-State.TITLE: Composite Wall: Maximum Temperature
One-Dimensional Steady-State.DESCRIPTION: Determines the maximum temperature within a composite wall given information about composite materials and heat flux.

One-Dimensional Steady-State.TITLE: Conduction through Spherical Walls
One-Dimensional Steady-State.DESCRIPTION: Determines the heat transfer rate in a spherical container using Fourier's law. A thermal circuit approach is used to analyze a more complicated system

One-Dimensional Steady-State.TITLE: Contact Resistance
One-Dimensional Steady-State.DESCRIPTION: Uses thermal resistances to examine surface contact resistances.

One-Dimensional Steady-State.TITLE: Contact Resistance Example
One-Dimensional Steady-State.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the contact resistance for a composite wall using the overall heat transfer coefficient.

One-Dimensional Steady-State.TITLE: Efficiency for an Array of Fins
One-Dimensional Steady-State.DESCRIPTION: presents two approaches to calculate the efficiency of an array of fins

One-Dimensional Steady-State.TITLE: Heat Flux: Temperature Distribution
One-Dimensional Steady-State.DESCRIPTION: Given the temperature distribution for a one-dimensional wall, determines the heat flux, the rate of heat storage, and the heat transfer coefficient on both faces of the wall.

One-Dimensional Steady-State.TITLE: Heat Loss from a Cylindrical Pin Fin
One-Dimensional Steady-State.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the heat transfer coefficient and rate of heat transfer for a cylindrical pin fin.

One-Dimensional Steady-State.TITLE: Heat Loss from a Rectangular Fin
One-Dimensional Steady-State.DESCRIPTION: Models heat loss from a rectangular fin. Assumes properties similar to fins used in microprocessors.

One-Dimensional Steady-State.TITLE: Heat Transfer from an Array of Fins
One-Dimensional Steady-State.DESCRIPTION: Presents the method to calculate the heat transfer rate from an array of fins.

One-Dimensional Steady-State.TITLE: Heat Transfer through a Spherical Container
One-Dimensional Steady-State.DESCRIPTION: Determines the thickness of a spherical container using a given heat rate and a thermal circuit approach.

One-Dimensional Steady-State.TITLE: Introduction to Fins
One-Dimensional Steady-State.DESCRIPTION: Derives the governing equation for fins with a uniform cross-sectional area.

One-Dimensional Steady-State.TITLE: Radial Conduction with Generation Part 1
One-Dimensional Steady-State.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the volumetric generation and surface temperature of a rod using an overall energy balance.

One-Dimensional Steady-State.TITLE: Radial Conduction with Generation Part 2
One-Dimensional Steady-State.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the surface temperature of a generating rod as well as the surface temperature of the insulating sleeve using the thermal circuit approach.

One-Dimensional Steady-State.TITLE: Radial Conduction with Generation Part 3
One-Dimensional Steady-State.DESCRIPTION: Explains why the overall energy balance or thermal circuit approach cannot be used to find temperatures within a generating medium. Calculates the centerline temperature for a generating rod using tabulated equations.

One-Dimensional Steady-State.TITLE: Rate of Heat Generation
One-Dimensional Steady-State.DESCRIPTION: Determines the rate of heat generation for a wall.

One-Dimensional Steady-State.TITLE: Steady-State One Dimensional Heat Transfer in a Plane Wall (Simulation)
One-Dimensional Steady-State.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the Plane Wall simulation which shows the temperature profile within a plane wall based on various conditions.

One-Dimensional Steady-State.TITLE: Surface Temperature for a Cylindrical Pipe
One-Dimensional Steady-State.DESCRIPTION: The overall heat transfer coefficient for radial systems is used to find the surface temperature of a pipe.

One-Dimensional Steady-State.TITLE: Temperature Distribution for a Cylinder
One-Dimensional Steady-State.DESCRIPTION: Simplifies the heat equation for conduction in a hollow cylinder and  solves for the temperature distribution.

One-Dimensional Steady-State.TITLE: Temperature Profile in a Fin (Simulation)
One-Dimensional Steady-State.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the Compare Fins simulation. This simulation shows how the temperature profile changes inside various boundary conditions.

One-Dimensional Steady-State.TITLE: Thermal Circuits Introduction
One-Dimensional Steady-State.DESCRIPTION: Introduces the concept of thermal circuits to solve for heat transfer through a plane wall.

One-Dimensional Steady-State.TITLE: Thermal Circuits: Temperatures in a Composite Wall
One-Dimensional Steady-State.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the temperatures in a composite wall using thermal circuits.

One-Dimensional Steady-State.TITLE: Thermal Energy Generation
One-Dimensional Steady-State.DESCRIPTION: Derives an expression for one-dimensional, steady-state conduction with uniform generation for an adiabatic surface from the heat equation.

One-Dimensional Steady-State.TITLE: Uniform Heat Generation: Maximum Temperature
One-Dimensional Steady-State.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the maximum temperature for a plane wall with uniform heat generation.

Transient Conduction.TITLE: Analytical Solution to a Transient Conduction Problem
Transient Conduction.DESCRIPTION: Uses an analytical approximation to solve a transient conduction problem. Compares the solution to that calculated by the lumped capacitance method.

Transient Conduction.TITLE: Introduction to Plane Wall with Convection
Transient Conduction.DESCRIPTION: Explains how spatial effects can change how to solve for one-dimensional transient conduction problems.

Transient Conduction.TITLE: Lumped Capacitance Introduction
Transient Conduction.DESCRIPTION: Explains the lumped capacitance model for transient conduction and derives its governing equation.

Transient Conduction.TITLE: Lumped Capacitance vs Full Heat Transfer Model (Simulation)
Transient Conduction.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the Lumped Capacitance Model vs Full Model simulation in heat transfer.

Transient Conduction.TITLE: Lumped Capacitance: Temperature of a Sphere
Transient Conduction.DESCRIPTION: Uses the lumped capacitance assumption to find how long it takes the temperature at the center of a silver sphere placed in a water bath to reach 310 K.

Transient Conduction.TITLE: Methods for Solving Transient Conduction Problems
Transient Conduction.DESCRIPTION: Compares lumped capacitance to an analytical solution for a gold sphere dropped into a water bath.

Transient Conduction.TITLE: Modeling Heat Transfer along a Semi-Infinite Medium
Transient Conduction.DESCRIPTION: Determines the temperature in a slab modeled as a semi-infinite solid.

Transient Conduction.TITLE: Plane Wall with Convection Example
Transient Conduction.DESCRIPTION: An example of a plane wall with convection using the one-term approximation of an infinite series solution.

Transient Conduction.TITLE: Rod Center-line Temperature
Transient Conduction.DESCRIPTION: Determines the center-line temperature of a cylindrical rod heated by convection.

Transient Conduction.TITLE: Semi-Infinite Solid Example
Transient Conduction.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates a semi-infinite solid experiencing surface convection.

Transient Conduction.TITLE: Total Energy Transfer for Transient Conduction
Transient Conduction.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to calculate the total energy transfer from a plane wall, a long cylinder and a sphere undergoing transient conduction.

Transient Conduction.TITLE: Total Energy Transfer from a Cylinder
Transient Conduction.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the total energy transfer of a long rod placed in a bath for a certain amount of time.

Transient Conduction.TITLE: Total Energy Transfer from a Sphere
Transient Conduction.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the time it takes to remove 80% of the total energy from a heated sphere and the temperature of the water bath needed to perform this energy transfer.

Transient Conduction.TITLE: Transient Conduction in a Sphere: Part 1
Transient Conduction.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the time to cool a sphere placed in a water bath. The problem solving approach is determined by calculating the Biot number. Part 1 of 2.

Transient Conduction.TITLE: Transient Conduction in a Sphere: Part 2
Transient Conduction.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the time to cool a sphere placed in a water bath using an analytical approach. Part 2 of 2.

Transient Conduction.TITLE: Transient Conduction: One-Term Approximation
Transient Conduction.DESCRIPTION: Models the temperature of a sphere suddenly immersed in a hot bath using the one-term approximation method.

Introduction to Convection.TITLE: Laminar Flow Over an Isothermal Flat Plate (Simulation)
Introduction to Convection.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the simulation Boundary Layer which looks out how the boundary layers are formed over an isothermal flat plate.

Introduction to Convection.TITLE: Laminar Flow: Flat Plate Surface Temperature
Introduction to Convection.DESCRIPTION: Solves for the surface temperature of an isothermal flat plate using a laminar flow correlation.

Introduction to Convection.TITLE: Local and Average Heat Transfer Coefficients
Introduction to Convection.DESCRIPTION: Compares local and average heat transfer coefficients.

Introduction to Convection.TITLE: Normalizing Thermal Boundary Layer Equations
Introduction to Convection.DESCRIPTION: Normalizes the thermal boundary layer equations and shows the Nusselt number is a function of only the Reynolds number and Prandlt number.

Introduction to Convection.TITLE: Overall Heat Transfer Coefficient: Rectangular Coordinates
Introduction to Convection.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to calculate the overall heat transfer coefficient for a system with conduction and convection.

Introduction to Convection.TITLE: Solar Cell Part 1: Heat Transfer Coefficient
Introduction to Convection.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the convective heat transfer coefficient  for a solar cell using the appropriate correlation. Part 1 of 2.

Introduction to Convection.TITLE: Solar Cell Part 2: Surface Temperature
Introduction to Convection.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the surface temperature for a solar cell using the thermal circuit method. Part 2 of 2.

Introduction to Convection.TITLE: Solving Convection Problems
Introduction to Convection.DESCRIPTION: Outlines the procedure to solve convection problems.

Introduction to Convection.TITLE: Thermal Boundary Layer Example
Introduction to Convection.DESCRIPTION: Presents an example of a thermal boundary layer problem of a fluid over a flat plate.

Introduction to Convection.TITLE: Thermal Boundary Layers Introduction
Introduction to Convection.DESCRIPTION: Presents the idea of a thermal boundary layer and derives the convective heat transfer coefficient.

External Flow.TITLE: Blasius Solution for Boundary Layer Thickness
External Flow.DESCRIPTION: Uses flat plate laminar boundary layer functions to solve for boundary layer thickness.

External Flow.TITLE: Blasius Solution for the y-Component of Velocity
External Flow.DESCRIPTION: Uses the Blasius solutions to develop an expression for the y-component of velocity at the edge of a boundary layer.

External Flow.TITLE: Convective Heat Transfer over a Flat Plate
External Flow.DESCRIPTION: Determines the heat transfer coefficient for laminar flow over a flat plate and the surface temperature of the plate.

External Flow.TITLE: Heat Transfer Rate: Tube Bank
External Flow.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the total heat transfer rate for a bank of tubes used to heat air.

External Flow.TITLE: Impinging Jets Example
External Flow.DESCRIPTION: Example of an impinging jet with a single round nozzle.

External Flow.TITLE: Introduction to Blasius Solutions
External Flow.DESCRIPTION: Introduces Blasius solutions to solve steady-state, two-dimensional boundary layer problems for a semi-infinite plate.

External Flow.TITLE: Introduction to Impinging Jets
External Flow.DESCRIPTION: Introduces the idea and corresponding correlations for impinging jets.

External Flow.TITLE: Introduction to Radial Convective Heat Transfer
External Flow.DESCRIPTION: Introduces radial convective heat transfer and shows the appropriate correlations (Hilpert, Zukauskas, Churchill-Bernstein, and Whitaker).

External Flow.TITLE: Shear Stress at a Wall: Blasius Solutions
External Flow.DESCRIPTION: Uses the Blasius solutions to find the shear stress at a wall as a function of plate length.

External Flow.TITLE: Sphere in Cross Flow
External Flow.DESCRIPTION: Compares the surface temperature of a sphere undergoing convective heat transfer in two different cases: 1) placed in water and 2) placed in air. Uses the Whitaker correlation to calculate the Nusselt number in both cases.

External Flow.TITLE: Using the Churchill-Bernstein Correlation for Cylinder in Cross Flow
External Flow.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the surface temperature for a cylinder in cross flow with radial convective heat transfer using the Churchill-Bernstein correlation. Third of three screencasts using the same initial problem but using different correlations to solve.

External Flow.TITLE: Using the Hilpert Correlation for Cylinder in Cross Flow
External Flow.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the surface temperature for a cylinder in cross flow with radial convective heat transfer using the Hilpert correlation. First of three screencasts using the same initial problem but using different correlations to solve.

External Flow.TITLE: Using the Zukauskas Correlation for Cylinder in Cross Flow
External Flow.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the surface temperature for a cylinder in cross flow with radial convective heat transfer using the Zukauskas correlation. Second of three screencasts using the same initial problem but using different correlations to solve.

External Flow.TITLE: y-Component of Velocity at a Boundary Layer
External Flow.DESCRIPTION: Shows how to find the y-component of velocity at the edge of a boundary layer at any point along the length of a flat plate.

Internal Flow.TITLE: Heat Generation in a Pipe
Internal Flow.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the heat generation needed to heat water in a thick-walled pipe

Internal Flow.TITLE: Internal Flow with Constant Surface Heat Flux
Internal Flow.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the mass flow rate of a fluid through a pipe with constant surface heat flu

Internal Flow.TITLE: Internal Flow with Constant Surface Temperature
Internal Flow.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the mass flow rate of fluid through a pipe with constant surface temperature.

Internal Flow.TITLE: Laminar, Fully-Developed Internal Flow Through a Pipe
Internal Flow.DESCRIPTION: Uses a correlation to calculate the heat transfer coefficient and the outlet temperature of a laminar, fully-developed fluid flowing through a pipe with constant surface temperature.

Internal Flow.TITLE: Outlet Mean Temperature
Internal Flow.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the outlet mean temperature for internal flow through a tube.

Free Convection.TITLE: Free Convection over a Heated Horiztonal Plate
Free Convection.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates free convection over a heated horizontal plate using an example

Free Convection.TITLE: Free Convection over a Vertical Plate
Free Convection.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates free convection over a vertical plate using an example.

Free Convection.TITLE: Heat Transfer Rate: Cross-Section Orientation
Free Convection.DESCRIPTION: Examines the dependence of the heat transfer rate on the physical orientation of a rectangular cross-section.

Free Convection.TITLE: Introduction to Free Convection
Free Convection.DESCRIPTION: Explains the physics of free convection and introduces pertinent correlations.

Boiling and Condensation.TITLE: Film Pool Boiling
Boiling and Condensation.DESCRIPTION: Describes the regime of film pool boiling and uses an example to illustrate how to determine the heat transfer

Boiling and Condensation.TITLE: Nucleate Pool Boiling
Boiling and Condensation.DESCRIPTION: The heat flux and convective heat transfer coefficient are determined for a copper pipe with water undergoing nucleate pool boiling.

Boiling and Condensation.TITLE: Nucleate Pool Boiling Example
Boiling and Condensation.DESCRIPTION: Determines the rate of vapor production for saturated water during nucleate boiling.

Boiling and Condensation.TITLE: Nucleate Pool Boiling: Unit Conversion
Boiling and Condensation.DESCRIPTION: Gives a detailed explanation of the unit conversions for the Nucleate Pool Boiling screencast.

Basics.TITLE: Estimates for Heat Transfer Coefficients
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Provides estimates for heat transfer coefficients for different scenarios.

Basics.TITLE: Heat Exchanger (Simulation)
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the Heat Exchanger simulation, which demonstrates how the temperature profiles change inside various heat exchangers.

Basics.TITLE: How to Calculate Heat Duty
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Introduces heat duty and calculates it for a stream of water heated from 25C to 140C at 30 psi.

Basics.TITLE: Log Mean Temperature Difference
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to calculate the log mean temperature difference for a heat exchanger.

Basics.TITLE: NTU Effectiveness Method
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Introduces the NTU effectiveness method to analyze a heat exchanger.

Counterflow.TITLE: Counterflow Heat Exchanger: Outlet Temperature (Bio)
Counterflow.DESCRIPTION: Determines the outlet temperature for a concentric tube, counter-current heat exchanger used to cool blood during open heart surgery.

Counterflow.TITLE: Heat Exchanger: Mass Flow Rate
Counterflow.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the mass flow rate of cooling water in a concentric, counter-current heat exchanger.

Counterflow.TITLE: NTU Effectiveness: Counter-Flow Heat Exchanger
Counterflow.DESCRIPTION: Uses the NTU effectiveness method to find the overall heat transfer coefficient for a counter-flow, concentric heat exchanger.

Counterflow.TITLE: Sizing a Heat Exchanger: Counter-Flow
Counterflow.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the length of a concentric counter-flow heat exchanger using the same parameters as in 'Sizing a Heat Exchanger: Parallel Flow.' Describes how counter-flow is different from parallel flow.

Parallel-Flow.TITLE: NTU Effectiveness: Parallel Flow Heat Exchanger
Parallel-Flow.DESCRIPTION: Uses the NTU effectiveness method to find the overall heat transfer coefficient for a parallel flow, concentric heat exchanger.

Parallel-Flow.TITLE: Sizing a Heat Exchanger: Parallel Flow
Parallel-Flow.DESCRIPTION: Finds the length of a concentric, parallel flow heat exchanger using an overall heat transfer coefficient and the log mean temperature.

Radiation.TITLE: Net Radiative Heat Transfer Rate from a Surface
Radiation.DESCRIPTION: Defines opaque, diffuse and gray surfaces and discusses how they differ from blackbodies.

Radiation.TITLE: Properties of Radiative Heat Transfer
Radiation.DESCRIPTION: Explanation of the process of radiation.

Radiation.TITLE: Radiation Exchange Between Surfaces
Radiation.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to calculate radiation exchange between surfaces in an enclosure.

Radiation.TITLE: View Factors
Radiation.DESCRIPTION: Defines view factors and shows two examples of how to calculate them.

Introduction to Reactors.TITLE: Euler Method for ODEs
Introduction to Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Reviews the Euler method used to solve ordinary differential equations.

Introduction to Reactors.TITLE: How to Solve Reactor Design Problems
Introduction to Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Presents an overview of approach to solving mole balances for reactor design problems for ideal chemical reactors. Also provides links to other screencasts that present more details for the mole balances for each type of reactor.

Introduction to Reactors.TITLE: Introduction to Chemical Reactor Design
Introduction to Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Overviews chemical reactors, ideal reactors, and some important aspects of reactor design.

Introduction to Reactors.TITLE: Runge-Kutta Method Introduction
Introduction to Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Reviews the Runge-Kutta method used to solve ordinary differential equations.

Introduction to Reactors.TITLE: Solving Linear ODEs Analytically
Introduction to Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Presents an example from reaction engineering on how to solve a linear ordinary differential equation using an integrating factor.

Batch and Semibatch Reactors.TITLE: Batch Reactor Overview
Batch and Semibatch Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Describes why batch reactors are used, their scale up capabilities, and presents mole balances for the reactor.

Batch and Semibatch Reactors.TITLE: Batch Reactor Scale-Up
Batch and Semibatch Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates why you cannot use geometric scale-up of a batch reactor with heat transfer.

Batch and Semibatch Reactors.TITLE: Batch Reactor with Excess Reactant
Batch and Semibatch Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Example problem examining the time needed for a reaction in a batch reactor given that one reactant is provided in excess. Comparison of same reaction setup in a semibatch process is also discussed.

Batch and Semibatch Reactors.TITLE: Batch Reactor with Multiple Reactions
Batch and Semibatch Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Setup for a multiple reaction process in an isothermal batch reactor.

Batch and Semibatch Reactors.TITLE: Batch Reactor with Reversible Reaction
Batch and Semibatch Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Develops the mass balance for an isothermal batch reactor with a reversible reaction.

Batch and Semibatch Reactors.TITLE: Batch Reactor: Catalyst Activity Decays
Batch and Semibatch Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Solve the mass balance for an isothermal batch reactor in which the rate constant for a first-order reaction decreases with time (catalyst activity decays).

Batch and Semibatch Reactors.TITLE: Catalytic Reactor: Activity Decay
Batch and Semibatch Reactors.DESCRIPTION: A first order catalytic reaction takes place in batch reactor. The catalyst decays with time and the conversion at a specific time is examined.

Batch and Semibatch Reactors.TITLE: Half-Life for First-Order Reaction
Batch and Semibatch Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Description of half-life and how it applies to a first-order reaction.

Batch and Semibatch Reactors.TITLE: Inert Effect on Equilibrium
Batch and Semibatch Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Calculate the effect of an inert on the equilibrium conversion.

Batch and Semibatch Reactors.TITLE: Isothermal Batch Reactor Part 1
Batch and Semibatch Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Part 1: Explanation on how to setup the solutions to an isothermal batch reactor given the stoichiometry and rate constant.

Batch and Semibatch Reactors.TITLE: Isothermal Batch Reactor Part 2 (POLYMATH Solution)
Batch and Semibatch Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Part 2: An overview of how to perform the numerical solution using POLYMATH software with the equations generated from part 1.

Batch and Semibatch Reactors.TITLE: Isothermal Semibatch Catalytic Reactor
Batch and Semibatch Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Solves mass balances for a semibatch reactor in which a catalyst is continuously fed to the reactor. Differential equations are solved with POLYMATH.

Batch and Semibatch Reactors.TITLE: Levenspiel Plots
Batch and Semibatch Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Explains Levenspiel plots for CSTRs, PFRs, and batch reactors.

Batch and Semibatch Reactors.TITLE: Material Balances on Tank Reactors
Batch and Semibatch Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to set up material balances for batch reactors, semibatch reactors, and  CSTRs.

Batch and Semibatch Reactors.TITLE: Reaction Times for High Conversion
Batch and Semibatch Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Shows that the reaction time to reach 99% conversion can be much higher than the time to reach 90% conversion in a batch reactor.

Batch and Semibatch Reactors.TITLE: Semibatch Hydrogenation Example
Batch and Semibatch Reactors.DESCRIPTION: An example of a catalyst driven hydrogenation (gas phase) reaction in a semibatch reactor. Determine the time for a specific reaction conversion and flow of reactant as a function of time given certain operating conditions.

Batch and Semibatch Reactors.TITLE: Semibatch Reactor Overview
Batch and Semibatch Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Overview of situations where the semibatch reactor has advantages over other types of reactors. The mole balance for the reactor is briefly presented.

Continuous Stirred Tank Reactors.TITLE: Comparing CSTR and PFR Balances
Continuous Stirred Tank Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Comparison of the material balances for both a continuous stirred tank reactor (CSTR) and a plug flow reactor (PFR).

Continuous Stirred Tank Reactors.TITLE: CSTR Design Example (Using Damkohler Number)
Continuous Stirred Tank Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Example of how to use the Damkohler number (a dimensionless unit) to examine how changing a single variable can affect overall reactor conditions in a CSTR.

Continuous Stirred Tank Reactors.TITLE: CSTR Material Balance: Effect of Increasing Volume on Yield (Interactive)
Continuous Stirred Tank Reactors.DESCRIPTION: An interactive screencast exploring how a change in reactor size translates to a change in yield.

Continuous Stirred Tank Reactors.TITLE: CSTR Overview
Continuous Stirred Tank Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Describes reasons for using a CSTR, presents mass balances and discusses unique aspects of CSTRs.

Continuous Stirred Tank Reactors.TITLE: Equivalence between a PFR and CSTR
Continuous Stirred Tank Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Explanation of why a PFR behaves as a large number of CSTRs in series, or as a system of small batch reactors moving down a tube.

Continuous Stirred Tank Reactors.TITLE: Levenspiel Plots
Continuous Stirred Tank Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Explains Levenspiel plots for CSTRs, PFRs, and batch reactors.

Continuous Stirred Tank Reactors.TITLE: Reactor with Highest Rate of Consumption
Continuous Stirred Tank Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Compares the performance of a larger CSTR with a smaller PFR.

Continuous Stirred Tank Reactors.TITLE: Continuous Stirred Tank Reactor (CSTR) Example
Continuous Stirred Tank Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Solves mass balances for an isothermal CSTR for a second order reaction to determine conversion.

Continuous Stirred Tank Reactors.TITLE: Reversible Reaction in an Isothermal CSTR
Continuous Stirred Tank Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Solves a mass balance for a reversible reaction in an isothermal CSTR. The reaction is second order in both directions.

Plug Flow Reactors.TITLE: Comparing CSTR and PFR Balances
Plug Flow Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Comparison of the material balances for both a continuous stirred tank reactor (CSTR) and a plug flow reactor (PFR).

Plug Flow Reactors.TITLE: Effect of Ignoring Density Change in PFR
Plug Flow Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Compare the volume of a plug flow reactor calculated by taking into account or ignoring the density change. A second order, gas-phase reaction with a mole increase is used.

Plug Flow Reactors.TITLE: Effect of Stoichiometry in Gas Phase Reaction (Molar Change)
Plug Flow Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Example that describes how to account for volume changes in a gas-phase reaction.

Plug Flow Reactors.TITLE: Equivalence between a PFR and CSTR
Plug Flow Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Explanation of why a PFR behaves as a large number of CSTRs in series, or as a system of small batch reactors moving down a tube.

Plug Flow Reactors.TITLE: Gas Reacts to Form Solid Product in PFR
Plug Flow Reactors.DESCRIPTION: A gas reacts in a plug flow reactor (PFR) to form a solid product. This is a simplified model of a polymerization reaction.  The conversion is calculated taking into account the large difference in density between the gas and the solid.

Plug Flow Reactors.TITLE: Isothermal PFR Part 1
Plug Flow Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Part 1: Material balances and setup for an isothermal gas-phase plug flow reactor (PFR).

Plug Flow Reactors.TITLE: Isothermal PFR Part 2
Plug Flow Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Part 2: An overview of how to perform the numerical solution using Athena Studio software with the equations generated from part 1.

Plug Flow Reactors.TITLE: Levenspiel Plots
Plug Flow Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Explains Levenspiel plots for CSTRs, PFRs, and batch reactors.

Plug Flow Reactors.TITLE: Mole Balance on a Plug Flow Reactor
Plug Flow Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Derives the mole balance for a plug flow reactor (PFR) and describes how to account for changes in volumetric flow rates with distance down the PFR.

Plug Flow Reactors.TITLE: PFR Design Example (Using Damkohler Number)
Plug Flow Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Example of how to use the Damkohler number (a dimensionless unit) to examine how changing a single variable can affect overall reactor conditions in a PFR.

Plug Flow Reactors.TITLE: Plug Flow Reactor Overview
Plug Flow Reactors.DESCRIPTION: A brief overview of plug flow reactors, their properties, equations, and uses.

Plug Flow Reactors.TITLE: Reaction in a PFR with Pressure Drop
Plug Flow Reactors.DESCRIPTION: This example applies the ideal gas law to a plug flow, packed-bed reactor in which the number of moles in the reaction changes, and the pressure drops through the reactor.

Plug Flow Reactors.TITLE: Reaction Rate in an Isothermal PFR
Plug Flow Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Determine the reaction rate in an isothermal PFR given information about the incoming feed stream.

Plug Flow Reactors.TITLE: Reactor with Highest Rate of Consumption
Plug Flow Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Compares the performance of a larger CSTR with a smaller PFR.

Plug Flow Reactors.TITLE: Transient PFR Part 1: Material Balances
Plug Flow Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Part 1: General approach to solving transient PFR reactors. Material balances are determined and setup for further numerical analysis.

Plug Flow Reactors.TITLE: Transient PFR Part 2: Solutions (Athena)
Plug Flow Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Part 2: Tutorial on using Athena Software to solve multiple differentials simultaneously, such as those setup in a transient tubular reactor.

Plug Flow Reactors.TITLE: Variable Density Reaction in a PFR
Plug Flow Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Looks at the effects of a mole change in a gas phase reaction (i.e. A to 3B) on reaction kinetics in a plug flow reactor.

Packed Bed Reactors.TITLE: Catalyst Amount in Packed Bed Reactor
Packed Bed Reactors.DESCRIPTION: An example problem on calculating the amount of catalyst needed in a packed bed reactor. Also a conceptual part examining the effects of a pressure drop through the reactor.

Packed Bed Reactors.TITLE: Catalytic Packed Bed Reactor
Packed Bed Reactors.DESCRIPTION: An example where mole balances are solved as a function of catalyst weight in an isothermal packed bed reactor. The differential equations for the mole balances are solved using POLYMATH.

Packed Bed Reactors.TITLE: Catalytic Packed Bed Reactor (POLYMATH)
Packed Bed Reactors.DESCRIPTION: A continuation of the Catalytic Packed Bed Reactor screencast. The equations are setup in POLYMATH and solved as tabular and graphical reports.

Packed Bed Reactors.TITLE: Determining Unknown Rate Constant in a PBR (POLYMATH)
Packed Bed Reactors.DESCRIPTION: An example of gas phase reaction in a packed bed reactor where the rate constant of the reaction is unknown. Polymath is used to solve the system of differential equations setup from the problem.

Packed Bed Reactors.TITLE: Explanation of the Ergun Equation
Packed Bed Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Describes how to use the Ergun equation to calculate the pressure drop in a packed bed.

Packed Bed Reactors.TITLE: Pressure Drop in a Packed Bed Reactor
Packed Bed Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the exit pressure from a packed bed using the Ergun equation.

Packed Bed Reactors.TITLE: Pressure Drop in a Packed Bed Reactor (POLYMATH)
Packed Bed Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the change in conversion in a packed bed catalytic reactor when the reactor length increases 50%. Uses POLYMATH to solve mass balances and the Ergun equation simultaneously.

Series and Parallel Reactors.TITLE: Comparing Reactors in Series
Series and Parallel Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Uses graphical approach to compare volumes of two CSTRs in series and two PFRs in series.

Series and Parallel Reactors.TITLE: CSTRs in Series
Series and Parallel Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Analyze the reaction system in which two CSTRs are in series. Calculate volume for isothermal reaction.

Series and Parallel Reactors.TITLE: PFR and CSTR in Series A
Series and Parallel Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Find the outlet product concentration leaving a CSTR and PFR in series when the reaction order and inlet concentrations are known.

Series and Parallel Reactors.TITLE: PFR and CSTR in Series B
Series and Parallel Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Shows that the conversion is the same for a first-order reaction in a PFR and CSTR in series (isothermal) independent of the order of the reactors.

Series and Parallel Reactors.TITLE: Reactor Sequence: CSTR and PFR
Series and Parallel Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Determines which reactor sequence results in the highest conversion using a CSTR and PFR in series for a 2nd-order reaction.

Series and Parallel Reactors.TITLE: Reactors in Series: First-Order Reaction
Series and Parallel Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Explains why the order of isothermal reactors in series (PFR and CSTR or two CSTRs) does not matter for a first-order reaction or for a zero-order reaction.

Series and Parallel Reactors.TITLE: Replacing a CSTR with Two CSTRs in Series
Series and Parallel Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Determine the change in reaction conversion when using two CSTRs having a total volume equivalent to one CSTR.

Series and Parallel Reactors.TITLE: Sizing CSTRs on Reciprocal Rate Data
Series and Parallel Reactors.DESCRIPTION: An example problem comparing an individual CSTR to series CSTRs to parallel CSTRs given specific conversion needs and reciprocal rate data for the reaction.

Series and Parallel Reactors.TITLE: Sizing Two CSTRs in Series
Series and Parallel Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Determine the relative volume of one CSTR to another one in series given the conversion of the overall reaction and the first reactor conversion.

Other Reactor Types.TITLE: Laminar Flow Reactor: Segregated Flow
Other Reactor Types.DESCRIPTION: A laminar flow reactor is modeled using the assumption of segregated flow to determine the conversion for a second-order reaction. This requires using the residence time distribution for laminar flow.

Other Reactor Types.TITLE: Length of a Porous Wall Tubular Reactor
Other Reactor Types.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the length of a porous wall reactor in which an inert flows through the reactor wall.

Other Reactor Types.TITLE: Membrane Reactor
Other Reactor Types.DESCRIPTION: An example of a membrane reactor that is aimed at improving conversion by removing a specific product from the reactor. All equations are worked out and plugged into a differential equation solver (Polymath) to show graphical solutions.

Other Reactor Types.TITLE: Recycle Reactor Example
Other Reactor Types.DESCRIPTION: Given a conversion in a recycle PFR reactor, determine what would happen if the recycle stream were cutoff.

Basics.TITLE: Activation Energy & Arrhenius Relationship
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Example looking at how the rate constant changes with temperature using Arrhenius relationship.

Basics.TITLE: Apparent Activation Energy
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Explains how the apparent activation energy for a catalytic reaction depends on the surface reaction activation energy and the heats of adsorption of reactants.

Basics.TITLE: Description of the Reaction Coordinate
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Explains the energy versus reaction coordinate diagram. Relates the activation energies for the forward and reverse reactions of an exothermic reaction to the equilibrium constant dependence on temperature.

Basics.TITLE: Heat of Reaction (from Heat of Formation)
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Determine the heat of reaction at a higher temperature from the heat of reaction at 25 C.

Basics.TITLE: Kinetics and Thermodynamics
Basics.DESCRIPTION: Discuss the differences between reaction kinetics and thermodynamics and describes how thermodynamics is important in kinetics and reactor design.

Adiabatic Reactors.TITLE: Adiabatic Batch Reactor
Adiabatic Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Determine temperature change and time to reach specific reaction conversion for an adiabatic batch reactor.

Adiabatic Reactors.TITLE: Adiabatic CSTR Example
Adiabatic Reactors.DESCRIPTION: An adiabatic CSTR example where outlet conditions are calculated based on reaction information and inlet conditions.

Adiabatic Reactors.TITLE: Adiabatic PFR
Adiabatic Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Solves the mass and energy balances for an adiabatic plug flow reactor. The reaction is exothermic. The differential equations are solved with POLYMATH.

Adiabatic Reactors.TITLE: Adiabatic Reactor Temperature
Adiabatic Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Calculate the adiabatic reactor temperature for a reversible reaction.

Adiabatic Reactors.TITLE: Adiabatic Semi-Batch Reactor Part 1
Adiabatic Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to set up the material balances for an adiabatic semibatch reactor. The equations would then be solved numerically (see Adiabatic Semibatch Reactor Part 2).

Adiabatic Reactors.TITLE: Adiabatic Semi-Batch Reactor Part 2
Adiabatic Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Presents the POLYMATH program used to solve the differential equations generated in the screencast 'Adiabatic Semibatch Reactor Part 1.'

Adiabatic Reactors.TITLE: Adiabatic Temperature
Adiabatic Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Calculate the adiabatic temperature for a reactor with 30% conversion.

Adiabatic Reactors.TITLE: Adiabatic, Exothermic Reaction in a Tubular Reactor (Interactive)
Adiabatic Reactors.DESCRIPTION: An interactive screencast that explore the relationship between feed temperature, feed flow rate, and conversion.

Adiabatic Reactors.TITLE: Chemical Equilibrium: Effect of an Inert
Adiabatic Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Examine how adding an inert changes the equilibrium conversion of a gas-phase reaction for both isothermal and adiabatic cases.

Adiabatic Reactors.TITLE: Chemical Reactor Design: Choosing a Temperature
Adiabatic Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Describes the various parameters of chemical reactors that are affected by temperature (rate, equilibrium, selectivity, heat transfer, stability, etc.).

Adiabatic Reactors.TITLE: Endothermic Reaction in Plug Flow Reactor
Adiabatic Reactors.DESCRIPTION: A second-order, endothermic reaction takes place in a jacketed plug flow reactor (PFR). Applies the energy balance to determine if the temperature increases or decreases at the beginning of the reactor.

Adiabatic Reactors.TITLE: Energy Balance in an Adiabatic PBR
