Adiabatic Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Given a reaction and information on inlet and outlet conditions, determine whether it is exothermic or endothermic and how conversion changes if outlet temperature changes.

Adiabatic Reactors.TITLE: Energy Balance on a Semi-Batch Reactor
Adiabatic Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Apply the 1st law to a semi-batch reactor for a fast reaction, so the conversion is limited by thermodynamics. Demonstrates how the heat of reaction appears from an energy balance.

Adiabatic Reactors.TITLE: Unsteady-State Adiabatic CSTR
Adiabatic Reactors.DESCRIPTION: Using information about an adiabatic CSTR, determine whether the reactant concentration is increasing or decreasing at short times.

Reactors with Heat Exchange.TITLE: Autothermal Reactor
Reactors with Heat Exchange.DESCRIPTION: Describes the operation and the equations used to model an autothermal reactor. A POLYMATH solution is presented.

Reactors with Heat Exchange.TITLE: CSTR Energy Balance Calculation
Reactors with Heat Exchange.DESCRIPTION: This example does material and energy balances for a continuous stirred tank reactor with cooling to determine the volumetric flow rate for a given conversion and the coolant temperature needed to maintain the specified reactor temperature. Made by faculty at University of Colorado Boulder Department of Chemical & Biological Engineering. Check out our Kinetics and Reactor Design playlist: http://www.youtube.com/playlist?llist=PL25CBC8287575CFB4

Reactors with Heat Exchange.TITLE: CSTR Energy Balances
Reactors with Heat Exchange.DESCRIPTION: Setup of energy balances for stirred tank reactors. Comparisons are made with batch and semi-batch reactors. Made by faculty at University of Colorado Boulder Department of Chemical & Biological Engineering. Check out our Kinetics and Reactor Design playlist: http://www.youtube.com/playlist?llist=PL25CBC8287575CFB4

Reactors with Heat Exchange.TITLE: CSTR Sizing for Equilibrium Reaction
Reactors with Heat Exchange.DESCRIPTION: Given an equilibrium reaction, feed rates, and other information about the components, determine the volume of a CSTR reactor. Both material and energy balances are necessary.

Reactors with Heat Exchange.TITLE: CSTR with Heat Exchanger
Reactors with Heat Exchange.DESCRIPTION: Determines the reactor volume and the heat transfer coefficient needed to maintain a CSTR at isothermal conditions.

Reactors with Heat Exchange.TITLE: Heat Removal from a Chemical Reactor
Reactors with Heat Exchange.DESCRIPTION: Determine heat removal so that a chemical reactor is isothermal.

Reactors with Heat Exchange.TITLE: Heat Transfer Rate for a Semibatch Reactor
Reactors with Heat Exchange.DESCRIPTION: An example of a semi-batch reactor that necessitates heat transfer to maintain reaction temperature. Determine the rate of heat transfer as a function of time.

Reactors with Heat Exchange.TITLE: Multiple Reactions: Energy Balances Part 1
Reactors with Heat Exchange.DESCRIPTION: Solves material and energy balances for system of reactions in a CSTR.

Reactors with Heat Exchange.TITLE: Non-Isothermal CSTR Balance
Reactors with Heat Exchange.DESCRIPTION: Determine the volume of a reactor given information on the reaction and specific flow requirements. Also asked to determine energy requirements based on heat capacities and heats of reaction.

Reactors with Heat Exchange.TITLE: PFR Energy Balances
Reactors with Heat Exchange.DESCRIPTION: Introduction to setting up the general energy balance for a plug flow reactor (PFR).

Reactors with Heat Exchange.TITLE: Reactor Runaway/Parametric Sensitivity
Reactors with Heat Exchange.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how sensitive the temperature profile in a plug flow reactor with heat transfer is to the inlet temperature and activation energy used in the reactor model. A Mathematica interactive simulation is used to demonstrate the behavior.

Reactors with Heat Exchange.TITLE: Stirred Tank Reactor Energy Balances
Reactors with Heat Exchange.DESCRIPTION: An overview of how to set up an energy balance for stirred tank reactors and how the end product changes depending on the reactor type and conditions.

Reactors with Heat Exchange.TITLE: Tubular Reactor Energy Balance: Part 1
Reactors with Heat Exchange.DESCRIPTION: Discusses details of the energy balance for a tubular reactor and the energy balance for coolant in an annular region around tubular reactor. Part 1 of 2.

Reactors with Heat Exchange.TITLE: Tubular Reactor Energy Balance: Part 2
Reactors with Heat Exchange.DESCRIPTION: Discusses details of the energy balance for a tubular reactor and the energy balance for coolant in an annular region around tubular reactor. Part 2 of 2.

Multiple Steady-States.TITLE: CSTR with Multiple Steady-States and Heat Exchange
Multiple Steady-States.DESCRIPTION: Find the steady-state operating conditions for a CSTR with heat exchange.

Multiple Steady-States.TITLE: Multiple States in a CSTR - Heat Generation
Multiple Steady-States.DESCRIPTION: Analyzes a continuous stirred tank reactor in terms of heat generated and heat removed to predict which solutions to the mass and energy balances are stable.

Multiple Steady-States.TITLE: Multiple Steady-States in a CSTR
Multiple Steady-States.DESCRIPTION: A look at how multiple steady states can occur in a CSTR when both the material and energy balances are performed together.

Multiple Steady-States.TITLE: Multiple Steady-States Part 1
Multiple Steady-States.DESCRIPTION: Explain multiple steady states and how they arise for a CSTR operating at steady state.

Multiple Steady-States.TITLE: Multiple Steady-States Part 2
Multiple Steady-States.DESCRIPTION: Explain multiple steady states and how they arise for a CSTR operating at steady state, part 2.

Deriving Mechanisms.TITLE: Chain Growth Polymerization Mechanism via SS Approximation
Deriving Mechanisms.DESCRIPTION: Applies the steady-state approximation to a chain growth polymerization to determine how the rate of reaction depends on initiator and monomer concentrations. Prepared by faculty at the University of Colorado Boulder, Department of Chemical and Biological Engineering.

Deriving Mechanisms.TITLE: Chain Reaction Mechanism via SS Approximation
Deriving Mechanisms.DESCRIPTION: Apply the steady-state approximation to a reaction sequence that proceeds by a chain mechanism.

Deriving Mechanisms.TITLE: Steady-State Approximation
Deriving Mechanisms.DESCRIPTION: Using rate constant information for a two step reaction, use steady-state approximations to determine an overall rate expression for the product formation.

Deriving Mechanisms.TITLE: Steady-State Approximation Part 2
Deriving Mechanisms.DESCRIPTION: Apply the steady-state approximation to a sequence of elementary steps to obtain a rate expression.

Deriving Mechanisms.TITLE: Steady-State Approximation vs. Rate Determining Step
Deriving Mechanisms.DESCRIPTION: Compare steady-state approximation method to rate determining step methods for an equilibrium reaction.

Adsorption and Catalysis.TITLE: Adsorption Introduction
Adsorption and Catalysis.DESCRIPTION: Explains the concept of adsorption and derives the Langmuir isotherm.

Adsorption and Catalysis.TITLE: Catalytic Selectivity and Equilibrium
Adsorption and Catalysis.DESCRIPTION: An overview of the benefit of catalysts in both reaction selectivity and equilibrium.

Adsorption and Catalysis.TITLE: Eley-Rideal Surface Reaction
Adsorption and Catalysis.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to derive a rate expression for an Eley-Rideal surface reaction.

Adsorption and Catalysis.TITLE: Heat of Adsorption Calculation
Adsorption and Catalysis.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the heat of adsorption from adsorption measurements at low coverages.

Adsorption and Catalysis.TITLE: Introduction to Catalysis
Adsorption and Catalysis.DESCRIPTION: Introduces the important aspects of catalytic reactions.

Adsorption and Catalysis.TITLE: Langmuir Isotherm: Dissociative Adsorption
Adsorption and Catalysis.DESCRIPTION: Derives the Langmuir isotherm for dissociative adsorption of hydrogen on a Pt catalyst.

Adsorption and Catalysis.TITLE: Langmuir Isotherms for Binary Mixture (Simulation)
Adsorption and Catalysis.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the amounts adsorbed on a surface for a binary gas mixture using an interactive Mathematica simulation. The adsorption is modeled using extended Langmuir isotherms.

Adsorption and Catalysis.TITLE: Langmuir-Hinshelwood Kinetics
Adsorption and Catalysis.DESCRIPTION: For a surface reaction, use proposed mechanisms to verify the model as Langmuir Hinshelwood kinetics.

Adsorption and Catalysis.TITLE: Temperature-Programmed Desorption
Adsorption and Catalysis.DESCRIPTION: Explains temperature-programmed desorption (TPD) and solves the equations for first-order desorption.

Adsorption and Catalysis.TITLE: Thiele Modulus/Particle Size Effects (Interactive)
Adsorption and Catalysis.DESCRIPTION: Problem about estimating the effect on effective rate of reaction when the pellet size of a catalyst particle is increased for operation in a differential reactor.

Diffusion and Reaction.TITLE: Diffusion and Bulk Flow for Catalytic Reaction
Diffusion and Reaction.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the concentration profile and the flux to a catalyst surface that is covered by a porous layer. Because the reaction has a mole change, bulk flow is taken into account.

Diffusion and Reaction.TITLE: Diffusion and Reaction in a Cylindrical Porous Catalyst
Diffusion and Reaction.DESCRIPTION: Given a concentration gradient in a porous cylindrical catalyst pellet, determine the amount reacting within the cylinder.

Diffusion and Reaction.TITLE: Effectiveness Factor for a Spherical Catalyst
Diffusion and Reaction.DESCRIPTION: Calculate how the total rate of reaction increases in a porous catalyst sphere (whose effectiveness factor is less than one) when the diameter  increases.

Diffusion and Reaction.TITLE: Effectiveness Factor for Single Catalyst Pore
Diffusion and Reaction.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the concentration gradient and the effectiveness factor for a catalyst pore with catalyst on the walls by carrying out a differential material balance.

Diffusion and Reaction.TITLE: Mass Transfer in a Catalyst Sphere
Diffusion and Reaction.DESCRIPTION: Uses a shell balance to determine the rate of product formed with respect to time for a spherical catalyst.

Bioreactions.TITLE: Derivation of Enzyme Kinetics for Competitive Inhibition
Bioreactions.DESCRIPTION: Derives the rate expression for an enzyme reaction with a substrate to make a product where an inhibitor competes for the enzyme to form an inactive complex; this is competitive inhibition. The rate determining step approximation is used to determine the rate expression.

Bioreactions.TITLE: Derivation of Enzyme Kinetics for Noncompetitive Inhibition
Bioreactions.DESCRIPTION: Derives the rate expression for an enzyme reaction with a substrate to make a product where an inhibitor competes for the substrate and it also competes for the enzyme-substrate complex to form an inactive complex; this is noncompetitive inhibition (or mixed inhibition). The rate determining step approximation is used to determine the rate expression.

Bioreactions.TITLE: Derivation of Enzyme Kinetics for Uncompetitive Inhibition
Bioreactions.DESCRIPTION: Derives the rate expression for an enzyme reaction with a substrate to make a product where an inhibitor competes for the enzyme-substrate complex to form an inactive complex; this is uncompetitive inhibition. The rate determining step approximation is used to determine the rate expression.

Bioreactions.TITLE: Derivation of Michaelis-Menten Kinetics
Bioreactions.DESCRIPTION: Derives the rate expression for an enzyme reaction with a substrate to make a product using the rate-determining step approximation.

Bioreactions.TITLE: Enzyme Mechanism: Rate Derivation
Bioreactions.DESCRIPTION: Derives the reaction rate expression for product formation using Michaelis-Menten kinetics.

Bioreactions.TITLE: Enzyme Reaction in a CSTR (Bio)
Bioreactions.DESCRIPTION: Example using enzyme-substrate kinetics modeled by Michaelis-Menten kinetics in a CSTR. Also examines role of inhibitor in non-competitive inhibition.

Bioreactions.TITLE: Michaelis-Menten Introduction (BIO)
Bioreactions.DESCRIPTION: Introduction to Michaelis-Menten kinetics for enzymatic reactions.

Bioreactions.TITLE: Michaelis-Menten Kinetics in a CSTR (BIO)
Bioreactions.DESCRIPTION: Example problem: CSTR involving enzymatic reactions following Michaelis-Menten kinetics.

Bioreactions.TITLE: Michaelis-Menten Parameters from Differential Reactor Data
Bioreactions.DESCRIPTION: Uses experimental differential reactor data to determine Michaelis-Menten parameters, and subsequently uses the rate expression to design a tubular reactor capable of quantitative conversion.

Bioreactions.TITLE: Michaelis-Menten: Competitive Inhibition (BIO)
Bioreactions.DESCRIPTION: Using Michaelis-Menten kinetics, describes the rate of reaction when competitive inhibition is present.

Polymerization.TITLE: Polymerization in a CSTR (Part 1)
Polymerization.DESCRIPTION: Part 1 of the solution for a polymerization carried out in a CSTR. Find the molecular weight distribution, degree of polymerization, average molecular weights and polydispersity.

Polymerization.TITLE: Polymerization in a CSTR (Part 2)
Polymerization.DESCRIPTION: This is a continuation of the screencast "Polymerization in a CSTR - Part 1.

Polymerization.TITLE: Polymerization in a CSTR (Part 3, Excel)
Polymerization.DESCRIPTION: This is a continuation of the screencasts "Polymerization in a CSTR - Part 1" and "-Part 2.

Polymerization.TITLE: Polymerization Reactor: Molecular Weight Distribution
Polymerization.DESCRIPTION: Discusses how molecular weight distribution (MWD) in a polymerization reactor depends on the type of reactor used because the MWD depends on the residence time distribution, the concentration at which reaction takes place, and the chain growth rate.

Rate Laws.TITLE: Compare First- and Second-Order Reactions
Rate Laws.DESCRIPTION: Compares the reactant and product concentrations as a function of time in a batch reactor for a first-order reaction and a second-order reaction.

Rate Laws.TITLE: Determining Rate Constants from Selectivity
Rate Laws.DESCRIPTION: Given information about two reactions in a CSTR, one producing a desired product and another an undesired product, determine rate constants and instantaneous selectivity.

Rate Laws.TITLE: Elementary Reactions
Rate Laws.DESCRIPTION: Determines the rate law in terms of the forward rate constant and equilibrium constant for a reaction that is elementary as written.

Rate Laws.TITLE: Kinetics that Demonstrate Chaotic Behavior
Rate Laws.DESCRIPTION: Presents a hypothetical model that demonstrates chaotic behavior for an insect population changing with time.

Rate Laws.TITLE: Reaction Rate Explanation
Rate Laws.DESCRIPTION: Compares the rate of reaction  for 2 conditions in a plug flow reactor and explains why the rate of reaction in higher in one reactor. Also, compare the rate of reaction in 3 catalyst pellets with different concentration gradients.

Rate Laws.TITLE: Relationship Between Arrhenius Activation Energy and Transition State Theory (Eyring Equation)
Rate Laws.DESCRIPTION: Introduces how activation energy can be computed from enthalpy change of the transition state

Rate Laws.TITLE: Relationship Between the Equilibrium Constants
Rate Laws.DESCRIPTION: Considers the relationship between the equilibrium constants K, Kc, and Kp that show up in reversible kinetic rate expressions.

Rate Laws.TITLE: Reverse Reaction Rate
Rate Laws.DESCRIPTION: Determine the reverse rate using equilibrium relations, given information about the forward reaction rate.

Rate Laws.TITLE: Reversible Non-Elementary Reaction
Rate Laws.DESCRIPTION: Determines the overall rate expression for a non-elementary, reversible, gas-phase reaction given the forward rate expression.

Rate Laws.TITLE: Thermodynamic Interpretation of Transition State Theory: The Eyring Equation
Rate Laws.DESCRIPTION: Introduces how rate constants can be calculated from thermodynamic properties of transition states.

Analyzing Rate Data.TITLE: CSTR Conversion Based on Batch Data
Analyzing Rate Data.DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use batch data to determine a rate constant, which is used to size a CSTR.

Analyzing Rate Data.TITLE: Determining Rate Order
Analyzing Rate Data.DESCRIPTION: Using a natural log-natural log plot and reaction information, determine the reaction order and rate constant associated with one of the reagents.

Analyzing Rate Data.TITLE: Differential Analysis: Determining a Rate Law (Batch Reactor)
Analyzing Rate Data.DESCRIPTION: Determine the rate law for a reaction occurring in a batch reactor using differential analysis.

Analyzing Rate Data.TITLE: Differential Data Analysis
Analyzing Rate Data.DESCRIPTION: Determine the rate order and rate constant by performing differential data analysis.

Analyzing Rate Data.TITLE: Differential PBR Data
Analyzing Rate Data.DESCRIPTION: Using differential reactor data for a packed bed reactor, determine the rate law expression for a catalyst driven gas phase reaction.

Analyzing Rate Data.TITLE: Differential Reactor Analysis
Analyzing Rate Data.DESCRIPTION: Uses differential reactor data to develop a rate law for a particular reaction, and on the basis of that rate law predicts what the results of other experiments should be.

Analyzing Rate Data.TITLE: Differential Reactor Data  (PBR)
Analyzing Rate Data.DESCRIPTION: Find the rate expression given differential reactor data for a gas phase reaction through a packed catalyst reactor.

Analyzing Rate Data.TITLE: Least Squares Method
Analyzing Rate Data.DESCRIPTION: A continuation of the Differential Reactor Data in a Batch Reactor screencast but using a least square error comparison as another method to determine rate law expressions.

Analyzing Rate Data.TITLE: Non-Linear Regression Introduction
Analyzing Rate Data.DESCRIPTION: Uses non-linear regression to obtain kinetic parameters from kinetic data obtained from an isothermal CSTR. POLYMATH is used to carry out the regression.

Analyzing Rate Data.TITLE: Non-Linear Regression/POLYMATH
Analyzing Rate Data.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use POLYMATH software to carry out non-linear regression to determine kinetic parameters from tabulated data. Uses the same data presented in the screencast titled Non-Linear Regression Introduction.

Analyzing Rate Data.TITLE: Packed Bed Reactor Design
Analyzing Rate Data.DESCRIPTION: Uses kinetic data from a differential reactor to calculate the amount of catalyst needed to convert 70% of feed in a larger packed bed reactor.

Analyzing Rate Data.TITLE: Pharmacokinetics: Analyzing Concentration Data (Bio)
Analyzing Rate Data.DESCRIPTION: Given drug concentrations in a patient's blood measured over a 12 hour period determine the drug decay rate constant, initial concentration of the drug, and volume of the patient's blood using the integral method to analyze the kinetic data.

Analyzing Rate Data.TITLE: Reaction Rates and Production Rates: Part 1
Analyzing Rate Data.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use a stoichiometry matrix to relate reaction rates of individual reactions to production rates of individual species. Part 1 of 2.

Analyzing Rate Data.TITLE: Reaction Rates and Production Rates: Part 2
Analyzing Rate Data.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates, using matric calculations, how to calculate reaction rates from measurements of production rates using least squares approach to account for measurement errors. Part 2 of 2.

Analyzing Rate Data.TITLE: Reaction Rates from Production Rates: Matlab
Analyzing Rate Data.DESCRIPTION: Uses Matlab for matrix calculations to determine the rates of three reactions, when have measurements for the rates of production of the five species involved in the reactions.

Analyzing Rate Data.TITLE: Simpson's Rule/Excel
Analyzing Rate Data.DESCRIPTION: Use Simpson's rule in a spreadsheet to calculate the integral for a set of data.

Analyzing Rate Data.TITLE: Using Data to Size a PBR Part 1
Analyzing Rate Data.DESCRIPTION: A packed bed reactor problem involving the determination of the rate constant for a gas phase reaction using experimental data. This information is used to calculate the necessary catalyst weight for the PBR.

Analyzing Rate Data.TITLE: Using Data to Size a PBR Part 2
Analyzing Rate Data.DESCRIPTION: A continuation of part 1, this screencast examines the mechanisms of reaction with the catalyst using Langmuir-Hinshelwood kinetics. The determined expressions are compared with the data.

Selectivity & Equilibrium.TITLE: Introduction to Multiple Reactions and Selectivity
Selectivity & Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Explains selectivity in chemical reactors and the factors that affect selectivity.

Selectivity & Equilibrium.TITLE: Multiple Reactions in a Membrane Reactor (POLYMATH)
Selectivity & Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: An example of a membrane reactor that improves selectivity of the desired reaction.

Selectivity & Equilibrium.TITLE: Predator-Prey Model
Selectivity & Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: A simple model of the interaction between predator and prey that is set up very similarly to a kinetics model of a system with multiple reactions.

Selectivity & Equilibrium.TITLE: Selectivity for Parallel Reactions in Fixed Bed Reactor (Interactive)
Selectivity & Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: An interactive screencast that probes how selectivity in parallel reactions is influenced by operating conditions.

Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.TITLE: Batch Reactor with Multiple Reactions
Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.DESCRIPTION: Setup for a multiple reaction process in an isothermal batch reactor.

Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.TITLE: Isothermal Semibatch Reactor with Multiple Reactions
Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.DESCRIPTION: An example involving a semibatch reactor having two simultaneous reactions. Based on particular operating conditions, determine steady-state results.

Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.TITLE: Mass Balance for Reversible Reactions in a Batch Reactor
Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.DESCRIPTION: Presents the mass balances for an isothermal batch reactor in which two reversible reactions take place.

Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.TITLE: Multiple Reactions in a CSTR
Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.DESCRIPTION: Solves the mass balance for two reactions (series/parallel) in an isothermal CSTR.  The non-linear algebraic equations are solved with POLYMATH.

Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.TITLE: Multiple Reactions in an Isothermal CSTR
Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.DESCRIPTION: Determine outlet concentrations given reaction kinetics and entering conditions to an isothermal CSTR. Multiple reactions take place in the CSTR.

Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.TITLE: Multiple Reactions in PBR Part 1
Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.DESCRIPTION: Examine a three reaction system in a packed bed reactor and determine relationships between operating conditions, size and reaction conversion and selectivity. Part 1 focuses on setting up the material balances and equations necessary to solve.

Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.TITLE: Multiple Reactions in PBR Part 2 (POLYMATH)
Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.DESCRIPTION: A continuation of part 1, this screencast focuses on using POLYMATH to solve the differential equations set up in part 1 and inspect the influences of certain operating conditions on reactor performance.

Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.TITLE: Packed Bed Reactor Example
Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.DESCRIPTION: An example problem involving two reactions taking place in a packed bed reactor. Determine flow rates given information on kinetic rates.

Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.TITLE: Parallel Reactions and Selectivity
Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.DESCRIPTION: Describes the effects of concentration, temperature, and reactor type on selectivity for parallel reactions.

Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.TITLE: Parallel Reactions in a Batch Reactor
Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.DESCRIPTION: Solves mass balances for an isothermal batch reactor with three parallel reactions. The POLYMATH program is used to solve differential equations.

Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.TITLE: Selectivity in a Semibatch Reactor
Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.DESCRIPTION: Discusses which mode of operation of a semibatch reactor yields higher selectivity for two parallel reactions (A + B react to form products) that have different reaction orders. One mode of operation starts with A in the reactor and adds B, and the other starts with B in the reactor and adds A.

Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.TITLE: Semibatch Reactor with Heat Exchange
Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.DESCRIPTION: Solves the mass and energy balances for a semibatch reactor in which two reactions in series take place. The differential equations are solved with POLYMATH.

Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.TITLE: Series Reaction in a Batch Reactor
Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.DESCRIPTION: Determine the relationships for concentration vs. time for a series reaction in a batch reactor.

Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.TITLE: Series Reaction in a Plug Flow Reactor
Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.DESCRIPTION: Analyzes how the flow rate of an intermediate product for a series reaction depends on feed conversion and rate constants.

Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.TITLE: Series Reactions and Selectivity
Parallel/Series/Complex Reactions.DESCRIPTION: Describes the effect of reaction time on selectivity for a series reaction.

Residence Time Distributions.TITLE: Analyzing Tracer Data for a Tank
Residence Time Distributions.DESCRIPTION: Given tracer data for a stirred tank, determine the average residence time and the standard deviation of the distribution. Use Simspon's Rule for integration.

Residence Time Distributions.TITLE: Average Residence Time
Residence Time Distributions.DESCRIPTION: Calculate the average residence time using tracer measurement data for a reactor.

Residence Time Distributions.TITLE: Model Non-Ideal CSTR
Residence Time Distributions.DESCRIPTION: Given a tracer response plot, model a non-ideal CSTR with a combination of ideal reactors, recycle, bypass, and hold-up.

Residence Time Distributions.TITLE: Modeling Non-Ideal Reactors with CSTRS in Series
Residence Time Distributions.DESCRIPTION: Solves mass balances for first-order reaction in a series of CSTRs, where n CSTRs in series are used to model a non-ideal reactor.

Residence Time Distributions.TITLE: PFR Residence Time
Residence Time Distributions.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the residence time in a plug flow reactor for a gas-phase reaction with mole change.

Residence Time Distributions.TITLE: Polymerization Reactor: Molecular Weight Distribution
Residence Time Distributions.DESCRIPTION: Discusses how molecular weight distribution (MWD) in a polymerization reactor depends on the type of reactor used because the MWD depends on the residence time distribution, the concentration at which reaction takes place, and the chain growth rate.

Residence Time Distributions.TITLE: Residence Time Distribution Introduction
Residence Time Distributions.DESCRIPTION: Introduces the idea that not all molecules spend the same time in a chemical reactor and explains how the residence time distribution can be measured with a tracer.

Residence Time Distributions.TITLE: RTD for CSTRs in Series Part 1
Residence Time Distributions.DESCRIPTION: Solves mass balances for a tracer injected into the first CSTR in a series to determine the residence time distribution (RTD) for CSTRs in series.

Residence Time Distributions.TITLE: RTD for CSTRs in Series Part 2
Residence Time Distributions.DESCRIPTION: Show plots of the residence time distribution for CSTRs in series.

Residence Time Distributions.TITLE: Segregated Flow and Residence Time Distribution
Residence Time Distributions.DESCRIPTION: A reactor having segregated flow is modeled using a tracer curve and residence time distribution analysis.

Residence Time Distributions.TITLE: Segregated Flow Example
Residence Time Distributions.DESCRIPTION: Shows how the residence time distribution for a reactor and the assumption of segregated flow can be used to calculate conversion in a reactor. Made by faculty at University of Colorado Boulder Department of Chemical & Biological Engineering. Check out our Kinetics and Reactor Design playlist: http://www.youtube.com/playlist?llist=PL25CBC8287575CFB4

Residence Time Distributions.TITLE: What is Segregated Flow?
Residence Time Distributions.DESCRIPTION: Describes segregated flow in chemical reactors, and how it affects conversion. Made by faculty at University of Colorado Boulder Department of Chemical & Biological Engineering. Check out our Kinetics and Reactor Design playlist: http://www.youtube.com/playlist?llist=PL25CBC8287575CFB4

Biokinetics.TITLE: Cell Growth in a Batch Reactor (Bio)
Biokinetics.DESCRIPTION: Develop and plot cell growth kinetics in a batch reactor.

Biokinetics.TITLE: Cell vs. Bacteria Growth in a Reactor (Bio)
Biokinetics.DESCRIPTION: Example of the effects of rate constants on cell and bacteria growth and the simplified exponential relationships that govern cell growth kinetics.

Biokinetics.TITLE: Ethanol Pharmacokinetics (Bio)
Biokinetics.DESCRIPTION: A model of how ethanol is absorbed and broken down in the human body via first and zeroth order reactions.

Biokinetics.TITLE: Ethanol Pharmacokinetics/POLYMATH
Biokinetics.DESCRIPTION: A continuation of the Ethanol Pharmacokinetics screencast. The equations are set up in Polymath and then solved for a graphical solution.

Biokinetics.TITLE: Introduction to Inhibition of Enzyme Reactions
Biokinetics.DESCRIPTION: Describes the three types if inhibition of enzyme reactions: competitive, noncompetitive, uncompetitive.

Biokinetics.TITLE: Monod Cell Growth Example (Bio)
Biokinetics.DESCRIPTION: An example of Monod growth kinetics. Produce a recombinant protein in E. coli and find how long it will take to reach a specified cell density.

Biokinetics.TITLE: Pharmacokinetics Example (Dosing a Patient)
Biokinetics.DESCRIPTION: Example problem modeling an anesthetic delivery to a human body as either batch (bolus dose) or semi-batch (IV delivery).

Biokinetics.TITLE: Pharmacokinetics: Determining Dosage (Bio)
Biokinetics.DESCRIPTION: Determine initial concentrations of a drug dose administered to a patient given the reaction rate constant of drug conversion in the body.

Biokinetics.TITLE: Pharmacokinetics: Drug Injection (Bio)
Biokinetics.DESCRIPTION: Analyzes the change in concentration of drug in body by modeling the plasma volume as a semi-batch reactor. Determine time between drug injections.

Biokinetics.TITLE: Washout Calculation for CSTR Bioreactor (Bio)
Biokinetics.DESCRIPTION: Using derived equations for washout in a CSTR, determine the dilution rate for cell washout to occur in a bioreactor.

Biokinetics.TITLE: Washout Derivation in CSTR Bioreactor (Bio)
Biokinetics.DESCRIPTION: Derivation of the washout equations for a CSTR bioreactor assuming basic Monod cell growth kinetics. Washout is when feed dilutes reactor to the point no cells are left.

Software Tutorials.TITLE: Athena Tutorial: Batch Reactor
Software Tutorials.DESCRIPTION: Isothermal Batch Reactor: Using setup from part 1, this video complements the numerical solutions in Part 2, through providing a tutorial on the use of Athena Studio for numerical solutions.

Software Tutorials.TITLE: Athena Tutorial: PFR
Software Tutorials.DESCRIPTION: Tutorial on using Athena Software to solve multiple differentials simultaneously, such as those setup in a transient tubular reactor.

Software Tutorials.TITLE: Creating Interactive Simulations in Mathematica
Software Tutorials.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the Manipulate command in Mathematica to create interactive graphical output from the solution of two ordinary differential equations. The equations used are for two reactions in a batch reactor.

Software Tutorials.TITLE: CSTR with Heat Transfer
Software Tutorials.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the behavior of a CSTR with heat transfer through solution in Athena software. Conditions are controlled and plotted with a discussion of its effects on concentration and temperature vs. time.

Software Tutorials.TITLE: Multiple Regression in Excel
Software Tutorials.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to use multiple regression in Excel 2010.

Software Tutorials.TITLE: Non-Linear Regression in Mathematica
Software Tutorials.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use non-linear regression in Mathematica to determine kinetic parameters. Uses the NonlinearModelFit function in Mathematica.

Software Tutorials.TITLE: Numerically Solve ODEs with Mathematica 1
Software Tutorials.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the Mathematica function NDSolve to solve two ordinary differential equations numerically. This is an initial value problem for a batch reactor with a single reaction. Part 1 of 2.

Software Tutorials.TITLE: Numerically Solve ODEs with Mathematica 2
Software Tutorials.DESCRIPTION: Uses the solution from the Mathematica 1 screencast to show how to format a plot. Part 2 of 2.

Software Tutorials.TITLE: Plot Equations with Mathematica
Software Tutorials.DESCRIPTION: Shows how to plot two equations in Mathematica and how to make multiple plots for different values of one parameter in one equation.  The equations used are the mass and energy balances for an adiabatic CSTR.

Software Tutorials.TITLE: POLYMATH Excel Add-in to Solve ODEs
Software Tutorials.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use POLYMATH to solve ordinary differential equations (ODEs) by transferring the POLYMATH program into Excel 2010 in order to take advantage of Excel's capabilities.

Software Tutorials.TITLE: Solving ODEs/POLYMATH
Software Tutorials.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to solve systems of ordinary differential equations using POLYMATH software. The example used is from reaction kinetics.

Engineering Calculations.TITLE: Advanced Interpolation
Engineering Calculations.DESCRIPTION: Performs interpolation multiple times to calculate specific volume given pressure and temperature.

Engineering Calculations.TITLE: Changing Units in an Equation
Engineering Calculations.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to convert the Arrhenius equation from SI to English units.

Engineering Calculations.TITLE: Dimensional Homogeneity
Engineering Calculations.DESCRIPTION: Introduces the concept of dimensional homogeneity and dimensionless numbers.

Engineering Calculations.TITLE: Dimensionless Groups (Reynolds Number Example)
Engineering Calculations.DESCRIPTION: Example of unit conversion for a dimensionless group by showing the Reynolds number, a number describing how a fluid flows through a pipe.

Engineering Calculations.TITLE: Dimensions of Differential Equations
Engineering Calculations.DESCRIPTION: Determine the units of constants in a dimensionally homogeneous equation.

Engineering Calculations.TITLE: Excel Solver Introduction
Engineering Calculations.DESCRIPTION: Describes how to use the solver function in Excel 2010.

Engineering Calculations.TITLE: Force & Weight (Units & Conversions)
Engineering Calculations.DESCRIPTION: Overview of SI and American Engineering units used for force. Describes use of gravitational constant as conversion factor and difference between force and weight.

Engineering Calculations.TITLE: Linear Interpolation
Engineering Calculations.DESCRIPTION: Calculates saturated pressure by linear interpolation using information from the steam tables.

Engineering Calculations.TITLE: Linearization Example (Cell Growth) (BIO)
Engineering Calculations.DESCRIPTION: An example describing how you can determine cell growth kinetics given two data points during their exponential growth phase. Simplified example demonstrating linearization practice.

Engineering Calculations.TITLE: Linearization of Non-linear Equations
Engineering Calculations.DESCRIPTION: Examples of how you can linearize non-linear equations into the form y=mx + b so that plotted data can help you determine the parameters a and b.

Engineering Calculations.TITLE: Linearize/Plot Non-Linear Equations (Excel)
Engineering Calculations.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to linearize and plot non-linear equations using Excel 2010.

Engineering Calculations.TITLE: Significant Figures
Engineering Calculations.DESCRIPTION: The rules for significant figures are presented. Examples are given of how to add, subtract, multiply, and divide numbers so that the answer has the correct number of significant figures.

Engineering Calculations.TITLE: Solving Set of Linear Equations
Engineering Calculations.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to solve multiple equations simultaneously. Shows an example of how to solve a system of equations with three unknowns.

Engineering Calculations.TITLE: Systems of Units
Engineering Calculations.DESCRIPTION: Overview of base units in SI/CGS/American Engineering. Summarizes use of multiples and derived units.

Engineering Calculations.TITLE: Unit Conversions (Practice)
Engineering Calculations.DESCRIPTION: Three examples on approaching unit conversions using a single dimensional equation.

Process Variables.TITLE: Acceleration due to Pressure
Process Variables.DESCRIPTION: Calculates acceleration using a force balance and gauge pressure.

Process Variables.TITLE: Average Molecular Weight Calculation
Process Variables.DESCRIPTION: Calculates average molecular weight using a mass basis and a molar basis.

Process Variables.TITLE: Average Molecular Weight Derivation
Process Variables.DESCRIPTION: Derives average molecular weight given mass or molar compositions.

Process Variables.TITLE: Density, Mass Flow, and Volumetric Flow
Process Variables.DESCRIPTION: A description on the relationship between density, mass flow rate and volumetric flow rate. An example conceptual problem is discussed.

Process Variables.TITLE: Determining Concentrations of Streams (ppm)
Process Variables.DESCRIPTION: A wastewater stream needs treatment.  Determine the amount of acid needed to neutralize a base.

Process Variables.TITLE: Introduction to Pressure
Process Variables.DESCRIPTION: Defines the different types of pressure. Uses head pressure to solve an example problem.

Process Variables.TITLE: Manometers
Process Variables.DESCRIPTION: An overview on manometers and how they are used to determine force differentials.

Process Variables.TITLE: Mass and Mole Fractions (Conversions)
Process Variables.DESCRIPTION: An overview on how to change molar fractions to mass fractions and vice-versa.

Process Variables.TITLE: Molar Conversions
Process Variables.DESCRIPTION: Shows how to convert quickly between mol, g-mol, lb-mol, kg-mol, and k-mol.

Process Variables.TITLE: Specific Gravity of a Mixture
Process Variables.DESCRIPTION: Determine the composition given the specific gravity of two components and the mixture.

Process Variables.TITLE: Using Average Molecular Weight to Simplify Balance
Process Variables.DESCRIPTION: Determines the molar flow rate of a gas mixture using the average molecular weight.

Single Unit Balances.TITLE: Average Molecular Weight of Mixed Stream
Single Unit Balances.DESCRIPTION: Air and methane are being diluted to create non-flammable mixture. Determine amount of air needed to dilute stream given starting composition.

Single Unit Balances.TITLE: Degree of Freedom Analysis on a Single Unit
Single Unit Balances.DESCRIPTION: A degree of freedom analysis is done on a single process unit to determine whether the unknowns can be solved for given the information presented.

Single Unit Balances.TITLE: Dry to Wet Basis
Single Unit Balances.DESCRIPTION: Converts a dry stack gas to a wet basis given the mole fraction of water in the product gas.

Single Unit Balances.TITLE: Flowchart Example
Single Unit Balances.DESCRIPTION: Example of how to create a flowchart.

Single Unit Balances.TITLE: General Balance for Material Balances
Single Unit Balances.DESCRIPTION: A general mass balance is presented and simplifications of the balance are shown for different processes.

Single Unit Balances.TITLE: General Mass Balance on Single Tank
Single Unit Balances.DESCRIPTION: Introduction to processes and the general material balance. A short example on a tank with inlet and outlet flow.

Single Unit Balances.TITLE: Introduction to Degrees of Freedom
Single Unit Balances.DESCRIPTION: The process of calculating degrees of freedom is explained, and examples are shown to reinforce the ideas.

Single Unit Balances.TITLE: Liquid-Liquid Extraction Material Balance
Single Unit Balances.DESCRIPTION: Briefly explains liquid-liquid extraction and performs the mass balances to calculate the mass flow rate of organic needed to obtain a certain separation.

Single Unit Balances.TITLE: Material Balance over a Crystallizer (Solubility)
Single Unit Balances.DESCRIPTION: Given solubility plot, determine degrees of superheat of incoming stream and compositions of streams entering and exiting a crystallizer.

Single Unit Balances.TITLE: Material Balance Problem Approach
Single Unit Balances.DESCRIPTION: Presents a general approach for solving simple material balances. Includes an example of independent versus dependent equations.

Single Unit Balances.TITLE: Material Balances for a Mixing Process
Single Unit Balances.DESCRIPTION: Determine instrument settings to control material balances in a mixing process.

Single Unit Balances.TITLE: Performing a Material Balance on a Single Unit
Single Unit Balances.DESCRIPTION: Performs a mass balance on a distillation column using degree of freedom analysis.

Single Unit Balances.TITLE: Scaling a Material Balance
Single Unit Balances.DESCRIPTION: Describes how to obtain and use a scaling factor.

Single Unit Balances.TITLE: Water Vapor Adsorber Material Balance
Single Unit Balances.DESCRIPTION: Given an inlet water-air stream and amount adsorbed from the air, determine flow rates and composition of water.

Single Unit Balances.TITLE: Wet to Dry Basis
Single Unit Balances.DESCRIPTION: Discusses the difference between wet and dry basis analysis. Shows how to convert from a wet basis to a dry basis.

Multiple Unit Balances.TITLE: Analysis of a Split Point
Multiple Unit Balances.DESCRIPTION: Analyzes a splitting point and explains why modeling this type of system is different from other types of systems

Multiple Unit Balances.TITLE: Crystallizer Material Balance with Recycle
Multiple Unit Balances.DESCRIPTION: Performs material balances on multiple units to solve for unknowns. Focuses on crystallizer balance where a slurry is part solid and part liquid.

Multiple Unit Balances.TITLE: Degree of Freedom Analysis on Multiple Unit Process
Multiple Unit Balances.DESCRIPTION: Uses the degree of freedom analysis to analyze a process and determine whether it can be defined.

Multiple Unit Balances.TITLE: Designing a Flowchart
Multiple Unit Balances.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to take a problem description and build a flowchart from it.

Multiple Unit Balances.TITLE: Multiple Unit Material Balance/Recycle - Decaf Coffee
Multiple Unit Balances.DESCRIPTION: Performs multiple unit balances to solve for unknown stream rates and compositions.

Multiple Unit Balances.TITLE: Multiple Unit Material Balance: Degree of Freedom Analysis
Multiple Unit Balances.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates using degree of freedom analysis on a multiple unit process to solve for unknown stream parameters.

Multiple Unit Balances.TITLE: Reactor with Recycle
Multiple Unit Balances.DESCRIPTION: Solves material balances over a process involving a combustion reactor and a recycle loop.

Multiple Unit Balances.TITLE: Solving Material Balances on Multiple Units
Multiple Unit Balances.DESCRIPTION: Example of setting up material balances on a multiple unit process involving a liquid-liquid extraction unit and a distillation column.

Balances on Reactions.TITLE: Atomic Species Balances
Balances on Reactions.DESCRIPTION: Uses atomic species balances to solve a material balance.

Balances on Reactions.TITLE: Chemical Equilibrium: Effect of an Inert
Balances on Reactions.DESCRIPTION: Examine how adding an inert changes the equilibrium conversion of a gas-phase reaction for both isothermal and adiabatic cases.

Balances on Reactions.TITLE: Equilibrium
Balances on Reactions.DESCRIPTION: Solves for equilibrium compositions using extent of reaction.

Balances on Reactions.TITLE: Extent of Reaction for Material Balances
Balances on Reactions.DESCRIPTION: An overview of how to use the extent of reaction in a material balance involving multiple reactions.

Balances on Reactions.TITLE: Fractional Conversion (Interactive)
Balances on Reactions.DESCRIPTION: Multiple choice question: Examine how fractional conversion relates between species in a reaction.

Balances on Reactions.TITLE: Gas Phase Chemical Equilibrium
Balances on Reactions.DESCRIPTION: Determine the equilibrium conversion of a gas phase reaction with and without the presence of an inert.

Balances on Reactions.TITLE: Limiting Reagent (Interactive)
Balances on Reactions.DESCRIPTION: Multiple choice question: Determine amount of product formed based on conversion of limiting reactant.

Balances on Reactions.TITLE: Molecular Species Balances
Balances on Reactions.DESCRIPTION: Performs a molecular species balance for a single reactor.

Balances on Reactions.TITLE: Percent Excess Air
Balances on Reactions.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the percent excess air needed to produce rust from iron.

Balances on Reactions.TITLE: Reaction Stoichiometry (Interactive)
Balances on Reactions.DESCRIPTION: MCQ: Determine amount of a product formed based on reactant information.

Balances on Reactions.TITLE: Single Reaction With Recycle
Balances on Reactions.DESCRIPTION: Determines production rates and purge stream conditions for a single reaction with recycle and purge.

Balances on Reactions.TITLE: Three Methods for Reactive MEB Problems
Balances on Reactions.DESCRIPTION: An overview of molecular and atomic species balances and the extent of reaction method for solving reactive material balances.

Balances on Reactions.TITLE: Two Reactions (Extent of Reaction)
Balances on Reactions.DESCRIPTION: Example problem with two reactions, one desired and one undesired, occurring in a reactor. Determines conversion, percent excess, selectivity and yield.

Balances on Reactions.TITLE: Two Reactions in a Two-Phase Reactor
Balances on Reactions.DESCRIPTION: Based on outlet compositions, determine flow rates and the selectivity for a two reaction system.

Single-Phase Systems.TITLE: Compressibility Factor (Z-Factor) Equation of State
Single-Phase Systems.DESCRIPTION: An example problem where the pressure inside a bottle of CO2 is calculated using the compressibility factor equation of state.

Single-Phase Systems.TITLE: Critical Properties of a Fluid (T and P)
Single-Phase Systems.DESCRIPTION: An introduction to the critical temperature and pressure of a species and how it will relate to using equations of state.

Single-Phase Systems.TITLE: Ideal Gas Law - Lung Example (BIO)
Single-Phase Systems.DESCRIPTION: A brief overview of the ideal gas law and an example demonstrating its use in determining the pressure change in the lungs.

Single-Phase Systems.TITLE: Ideal Gas Mixture Characterization
Single-Phase Systems.DESCRIPTION: Determine partial pressures in an ideal gas mixture and physical properties about the mixture.

Single-Phase Systems.TITLE: Ideal Gas Mixtures Example
Single-Phase Systems.DESCRIPTION: Example problem looking at potential hazards caused by an acetone spill in a lab, specifically explosive and inhalation hazards.

Single-Phase Systems.TITLE: Ideal Gases Example Biofermentation (BIO)
Single-Phase Systems.DESCRIPTION: Use material balances and the ideal gas law to determine the oxygen uptake rate for cells in a bioreactor.

Single-Phase Systems.TITLE: SRK Equation of State Example
Single-Phase Systems.DESCRIPTION: Calculate the pressure for a tank containing propane using the Soave-Redlich-Kwong equation of state, given the mass of propane, the tank volume, and the temperature.

Single-Phase Systems.TITLE: Standard Temperature and Pressure - Ideal Gas Law
Single-Phase Systems.DESCRIPTION: Overview of standard conditions (temperature and pressure) and its use with the ideal gas law.

Single-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Air/Water Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium
Single-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Discusses how vapor-liquid equilibrium changes in an air/water system when some of the air is removed.

Single-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Condense Water Vapor from Air
Single-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Plots partial pressure versus temperature as the temperature of 50% relative humidity air is lowered.

Single-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Phase Behavior on a PV Diagram (Simulation)
Single-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Describes how to use the interactive simulation that represents the pressure-volume behavior for water. The simulation is located at http://demonstrations.wolfram.com/PhaseBehaviorOnAPressureVolumeDiagram/

Single-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Pressure-Volume Diagram
Single-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Explains a single-component pressure-volume phase diagram.

Single-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Relative and Absolute Humidity
Single-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Overview of relative and absolute humidity and how to calculate the amount of water in the vapor phase.

Single-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Single Condensable Species Balance (Raoult's Law)
Single-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the use of Raoult's law on a single condensable species in vapor liquid equilibrium.

Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Add Non-Volatile Component to VLE System
Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: A component with a negligible vapor pressure is added to a two-phase N2/H2O system.

Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Add One Component to Binary VLE System
Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Explain what happens when one component is added to a binary mixture in vapor-liquid equilibrium.

Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Binary Vapor: Partial Condensation
Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Determine the fraction of binary vapor that condenses as the temperature decreases.

Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Condense a Binary Vapor Mixture
Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Discuss which species condense when a binary vapor is cooled.

Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Dew Temperature Calculation/Excel Solver
Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Determine the liquid composition and temperature using Excel solver, given the vapor composition and the pressure.

Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Gibbs Phase Rule
Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Explains the Gibbs phase rule and applies it to a binary system that has vapor and partially miscible liquids.

Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Interpolating Tie Lines on a Ternary Diagram
Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Describes how to interpolate equilibrium tie lines on a ternary diagram.

Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Lever Rule (Interactive)
Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Interactive screencast that asks a question about the relative amounts of liquid and vapor for a binary system in vapor-liquid equilibrium.

Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Lever Rule Derivation
Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Uses mass balance to derive the lever rule, which determines the amounts of liquid and vapor in equilibrium given the overall mole fraction and the mole fractions in each phase.

Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Multicondensable Species in VLE
Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the use of Raoult's law to a system containing three components in the vapor phase in equilibrium with two condensable species in the liquid phase.

Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Partial Pressure: Immiscible Liquids
Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Determine the partial pressures of two species that are being condensed if the liquids are immiscible.

Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Phase Equilibrium: Txy Diagram
Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: A conceptual question investigating how the molar composition changes to a vapor-liquid equilibrium system as temperature is changed.

Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Plotting a Ternary Phase Diagram
Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Develops a ternary phase diagram using equilibrium data.

Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Pxy Diagram for VLE (Simulation)
Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Uses an interactive Mathematica simulation to describe a pressure-mole fraction diagram (P-x-y) that is generated with Raoult's law. Behavior is discussed where the pressure is changed at constant overall composition and where the overall composition is changed at constant pressure.

Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Raoult's Law (Water as Condensable Component)
Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Uses Raoult's law to determine molar fraction of water in a vapor stream that is removed in a condenser.

Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Raoult's Law Explanation
Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Explains the shapes of the Pxy and the Txy diagrams for Raoult's law.

Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Solubility Introduction
Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Introduces saturated and supersaturated solutions and uses a solubility chart to determine the mass fraction of solute.

Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Solving VLE Using Raoult's Law and Iterative Method Solver
Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Perform a material balance on a vapor-liquid equilibrium system and use Antoine's equations and Excel Solver to determine the system temperature.

Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Ternary Phase Diagram Basics (Simulation)
Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Uses a simulation to show how ternary phase diagrams are interpreted. This is for a single phase, three component system.

Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Triangular (Ternary) Phase Diagram Example
Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Using a triangular phase diagram for a tertiary system, determine compositions of the outlet streams coming from a mixer.

Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Using a Triangular (Ternary) Phase Diagram
Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: A brief overview of using a triangular phase diagram for a tertiary system (acetone-water-MIBK).

Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Using Solubility Diagrams for Material Balances
Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Uses a salt solubility diagram to determine concentrations of salt solute in water for a crystallizer material balance.

Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: VLLE Immiscible Liquids
Multi-Component Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Txy diagram is used to explain phases present for vapor-liquid-liquid equilibrium for 2 immiscible species.

Balances With Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Distillation of a Two Component Mixture Part 1
Balances With Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Example of a material balance on a distillation column used to separate two distinct streams, a vapor and a liquid phase. Both streams include recycle components back into the distillation column.

Balances With Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Distillation of a Two Component Mixture Part 2
Balances With Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: A continuation of the Distillation Column problem focusing on the reboiler. Determine the operating temperature of the reboiler and the vapor composition recycled to the distillation column.

Balances With Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: Gas Stripping (Henry and Raoult's Laws)
Balances With Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: An example of gas stripping using both Henry's law and Raoult's law as equations which help solve the system.

Balances With Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: MEB Final Part 3: How To Set Up A Problem/Distillation Column Mass Balance
Balances With Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: A final exam review for Material & Energy Balances. This is part 3 of 4.

Balances With Phase Equilibrium.TITLE: MEB Final Part 4: Distillation Column Mass Balance (continued)
Balances With Phase Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Continues from MEB Final exam review part 3 for solving material balances on a distillation column.

Combustion.TITLE: Complete and Partial Combustion of Ethane
Combustion.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the ratio of water/dry gas in the stack gas for both complete and partial combustion of ethane

Combustion.TITLE: Material Balances on Complete Combustion of Methane
Combustion.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the moles of air fed to a reactor and the composition of the stack gas for the complete combustion of methane.

Combustion.TITLE: Overview of Combustion Chemistry
Combustion.DESCRIPTION: Overview of combustion which is the reaction of fuel (usually hydrocarbons) with oxygen to produce water, carbon dioxide/carbon monoxide, and energy. Quickly reviews percent excess air and wet/dry basis.

Combustion.TITLE: Percent Excess Air (Combustion)
Combustion.DESCRIPTION: Introduces percent excess air for combustion reactions.

Energy Balances.TITLE: Adiabatic Compression of an Ideal Gas
Energy Balances.DESCRIPTION: Calculate the adiabatic temperature for compression of an ideal gas, both reversibly and irreversibly.

Energy Balances.TITLE: Bernoulli Equation Example
Energy Balances.DESCRIPTION: Given a pipe system determine the height water would reach leaving the pipe.

Energy Balances.TITLE: Energy Balance on a Condenser
Energy Balances.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the cooling duty required to condense and cool acetone from 100C to 25C using an energy balance.

Energy Balances.TITLE: Energy Balance on a Heat Exchanger
Energy Balances.DESCRIPTION: An energy balance is done on a steady-state heat exchanger in which superheated steam is used to heat a reaction stream. Steam tables are used to determine the values in the energy balance.

Energy Balances.TITLE: Energy Balance on a Human (BIO)
Energy Balances.DESCRIPTION: Applies the first law to a human and calculates the temperature increase if the body is modeled as a closed system and the water loss if modeled as an open system.

Energy Balances.TITLE: Energy Balance on Open System (PAV Device) (BIO)
Energy Balances.DESCRIPTION: Compare two biomedical devices for reducing work done by the heart. An energy balance is performed from the veins to the aorta.

Energy Balances.TITLE: Gas Expansion from a Tank
Energy Balances.DESCRIPTION: A valve controls the release of an ideal gas from a tank into a piston-cylinder. Given information about the initial and final conditions, determine the missing state variables by performing an energy balance.

Energy Balances.TITLE: Introduction to Energy
Energy Balances.DESCRIPTION: An introduction to the first law and explanation of the terms in the energy balance.

Energy Balances.TITLE: Open and Closed Systems
Energy Balances.DESCRIPTION: Gives the energy balance for both open and closed systems and compares the two.

Energy Balances.TITLE: Problem Solving Approach
Energy Balances.DESCRIPTION: Problem solving approach to solve closed system energy balance.

Energy Balances.TITLE: Throttle: Changing Gas Pressure
Energy Balances.DESCRIPTION: Determine the outlet temperature when a high-pressure liquid is throttled.

Tables/Charts.TITLE: Compare Steam Tables to Ideal Gas Law
Tables/Charts.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the volume of a gas using the ideal gas law and compares to the volume at the same conditions from the steam tables.

Tables/Charts.TITLE: Compressibility Factor Chart (simulation)
Tables/Charts.DESCRIPTION: Describes how to use an interactive simulation that shows plots of compressibility factor versus reduced pressure, with reduced temperature as a parameter, for five molecules.

Tables/Charts.TITLE: How to use a Psychrometric Chart
Tables/Charts.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to read on a psychrometric chart: dry bulb temperature, relative humidity, moisture content, dew point temperature, enthalpy, humid air volume, and wet bulb temperature. Uses the interactive simulation http://demonstrations.wolfram.com/ReadingAPsychrometricChart/

Tables/Charts.TITLE: How to Use Steam Tables
Tables/Charts.DESCRIPTION: Simple steam tables are introduced and differences between types of steam are presented.

Tables/Charts.TITLE: Introduction to Steam Tables
Tables/Charts.DESCRIPTION: Steam tables are used to solve two example problems: 1) density at critical point, 2), quality of liquid-vapor mixture.

Tables/Charts.TITLE: Introduction to Steam Tables 2
Tables/Charts.DESCRIPTION: Steam tables are used to solve two example problems: 1) throttle liquid water from high pressure, 2) heat liquid-vapor mixture at constant volume.

Tables/Charts.TITLE: Properties of Liquid Water in Steam Tables
Tables/Charts.DESCRIPTION: Determines the properties of liquid water when the pressure is greater than saturation pressure using the steam tables.

Tables/Charts.TITLE: Psychrometric Chart Examples
Tables/Charts.DESCRIPTION: Calculates heat required to raise the temperature of saturated air and determines which of two systems has the lower wet bulb temperature. Uses the interactive simulation: http://demonstrations.wolfram.com/ReadingAPsychrometricChart/

Tables/Charts.TITLE: Quality of Steam
Tables/Charts.DESCRIPTION: Defines vapor quality and compares mass percent and volume percent of steam.

Tables/Charts.TITLE: Quality of Steam: Mass and Volume Fractions
Tables/Charts.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the difference between mass and volume fractions, as a function of quality, for vapor-liquid equilibrium of water.

Tables/Charts.TITLE: Reading a Psychrometric Chart (Simulation)
Tables/Charts.DESCRIPTION: Uses an interactive simulation to show how to read a psychrometric chart and extract information from the chart.

Tables/Charts.TITLE: Reading Compressibility Factor Charts
Tables/Charts.DESCRIPTION: Uses an interactive simulation to explain how to read generalized compressibility factor charts, which are based on the theory of corresponding states. These charts show how real gas behavior deviates from ideal gas behavior.

Tables/Charts.TITLE: Steam Table Example
Tables/Charts.DESCRIPTION: Presents an example on how to use the steam tables to find enthalpy changes as well as volumetric flows of steam.

Tables/Charts.TITLE: Steam Tables: Calculating Quality
Tables/Charts.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the quality of a two-phase water mixture in vapor-liquid equilibrium using steam tables.

Tables/Charts.TITLE: Steam Tables: Constant Volume Process
Tables/Charts.DESCRIPTION: Use steam tables to determine the final conditions when water vapor is cooled.

Tables/Charts.TITLE: Steam Tables: Interpolation
Tables/Charts.DESCRIPTION: Example problems that calculate enthalpy of steam by interpolation of steam tables.

Tables/Charts.TITLE: Using the DePriester Chart for Vapor Liquid Equilibrium (simulation)
Tables/Charts.DESCRIPTION: Uses an interactive simulation to explain how to use a DePriester chart for hydrocarbons to determine K values and show how K values change with temperature, pressure, and hydrocarbon.

Tables/Charts.TITLE: Water Properties from Steam Tables
Tables/Charts.DESCRIPTION: Use steam tables to determine properties of water.

Balances on Nonreactive Processes.TITLE: Adiabatic Mixing
Balances on Nonreactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the outlet temperature of an adiabatic mixing process using enthalpy concentration diagrams.

Balances on Nonreactive Processes.TITLE: Calculate Physical Properties Using Humidity Charts
Balances on Nonreactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: Uses humidity charts to calculate the dew point and the wet bulb temperature of a system.

Balances on Nonreactive Processes.TITLE: Choosing a Reference State (Example)
Balances on Nonreactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: An example problem detailing the use of a reference state in determining the change in enthalpy of vapor system reaching equilibrium.

Balances on Nonreactive Processes.TITLE: Heat of Mixing
Balances on Nonreactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: Calculate heat of mixing when two solutions are mixed.

Balances on Nonreactive Processes.TITLE: Heat of Reaction (from Heat of Formation)
Balances on Nonreactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: Determine the heat of reaction at a higher temperature from the heat of reaction at 25C.

Balances on Nonreactive Processes.TITLE: Heat of Vaporization: Antoine's Equation
Balances on Nonreactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: Uses Antoine's equation, which relates saturation pressure to temperature, to determine the heat of vaporization using the Clausius-Clapeyron equation.

Balances on Nonreactive Processes.TITLE: Heat of Vaporization: Clausius-Clapeyron
Balances on Nonreactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: Estimate the heat of vaporization using the Clausius-Clapeyron equation.

Balances on Nonreactive Processes.TITLE: Humidity Chart Example
Balances on Nonreactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: Uses humidity chart to model a heating process. Obtains specific enthalpy, humid volume, and relative humidity values from the humidity charts.

Balances on Nonreactive Processes.TITLE: Humidity Chart: Adiabatic Cooling
Balances on Nonreactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the outlet temperature and rate of water evaporation in a spray chamber for an adiabatic cooling process using the humidity charts.

Balances on Nonreactive Processes.TITLE: Including a Phase Change in an Energy Balance
Balances on Nonreactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: Overview of sensible and latent heats and how to account for phase changes in energy balances.

Balances on Nonreactive Processes.TITLE: Irreversible Adiabatic Expansion
Balances on Nonreactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: Energy balance on an ideal gas that undergoes irreversible, adiabatic expansion.

Balances on Nonreactive Processes.TITLE: Isothermal Mixing
Balances on Nonreactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the heat released during an isothermal mixing process using an enthalpy concentration diagram.

Balances on Nonreactive Processes.TITLE: Latent Heat
Balances on Nonreactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: Provides an overview of latent heat. Calculates the heat required to vaporize and condense 100 mol of water at 100C and atmospheric pressure.

Balances on Nonreactive Processes.TITLE: Reference States in Enthalpy Calculations
Balances on Nonreactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: An overview of what reference states are and how to use them in calculating enthalpy changes for a variety of systems.

Balances on Nonreactive Processes.TITLE: Sensible Heat from Specific Enthalpy
Balances on Nonreactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: Example using physical properties to perform sensible heat calculations. Calculates the heat required to increase the temperature of water vapor from 100C to 300C.

Balances on Nonreactive Processes.TITLE: Thermochemistry of Solutions
Balances on Nonreactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the heat of reaction for the neutralization of sulfuric acid with sodium hydroxide.

Balances on Nonreactive Processes.TITLE: What is Enthalpy?
Balances on Nonreactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: Presents the definition of enthalpy, its differential, and its use in energy balances.

Balances on Reactive Processes.TITLE: Adiabatic Flame Temperature
Balances on Reactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the adiabatic flame temperature when butane burns in pure oxygen.

Balances on Reactive Processes.TITLE: Calculating Enthalpy Changes Using Heat of Reaction Method
Balances on Reactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: An example problem where the enthalpy change of a reaction is determined using the heat of reaction method and material balances.

Balances on Reactive Processes.TITLE: Calculating Enthalpy Changes Using Heats of Formation Method
Balances on Reactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: An example problem where the enthalpy change of a reaction is determined using the heats of formation method and material balances.

Balances on Reactive Processes.TITLE: Energy Balances with Unknown Outlet Conditions
Balances on Reactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: Performs an energy balance to calculate the unknown outlet temperature.

Balances on Reactive Processes.TITLE: Heat of Combustion
Balances on Reactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: Uses Hess's law to show how heat of combustion is used to calculate the heat of reaction.

Balances on Reactive Processes.TITLE: Heat Removal from a Chemical Reactor
Balances on Reactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: Determine heat removal so that a chemical reactor is isothermal.

Balances on Reactive Processes.TITLE: Heats of Formation
Balances on Reactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: An example problem using heats of reaction to determine the heat of formation of one of the reactants.

Balances on Reactive Processes.TITLE: Hess's Law
Balances on Reactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: Explains Hess's law and provides an example of how to use it to solve for the heat of reaction for an equation.

Balances on Reactive Processes.TITLE: MEB Final Part 1: Dew Point of Combustion Reaction
Balances on Reactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: A final exam review for Material & Energy Balances. This is part 1 of 4.

Balances on Reactive Processes.TITLE: MEB Final Part 2: Dew Point of Combustion Reaction (continued)
Balances on Reactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: A final exam review for Material & Energy Balances. This is part 2 of 4.

Balances on Reactive Processes.TITLE: Steam Reformer Material and Energy Balances
Balances on Reactive Processes.DESCRIPTION: Use atomic balances and a general energy balance on an adiabatic reactor to determine the molar flow rates of outgoing product streams in the gas-phase steam reforming of propane.

Balances on Transient Processes.TITLE: Unsteady-State Energy Balance (Steam Tables)
Balances on Transient Processes.DESCRIPTION: Unsteady-state energy balance on a tank containing steam to which additional steam is added. Uses steam tables.

Atomic Bonding.TITLE: Atomic Bonding
Atomic Bonding.DESCRIPTION: Describes the three types of atomic bonding and presents the equation used to calculate percent ionic character.

Structures of Metals and Ceramics.TITLE: (111) Planes in FCC Metal
Structures of Metals and Ceramics.DESCRIPTION: Determines how many distinct sets of (111) planes are present in a face-centered cubic metal.

Structures of Metals and Ceramics.TITLE: Calculate Metal Density
Structures of Metals and Ceramics.DESCRIPTION: Calculate the density of a metal from its atomic radius and atomic mass.

Structures of Metals and Ceramics.TITLE: Carbon Allotropes (external author)
Structures of Metals and Ceramics.DESCRIPTION: A discussion of carbon allotropes - including diamond, lonsdaleite, graphite, and the fullerenes.

Structures of Metals and Ceramics.TITLE: Crystal Plane Miller Indices
Structures of Metals and Ceramics.DESCRIPTION: Explains the Miller indices notation used to label planes in a crystal structure.

Structures of Metals and Ceramics.TITLE: Crystal Systems and Ceramic Structures
Structures of Metals and Ceramics.DESCRIPTION: The seven crystal systems are discussed and examples of cubic and tetragonal structures are given. Ceramic structures are discussed and an example of the perovskite unit cell is given.

Structures of Metals and Ceramics.TITLE: Direction in a HCP Unit Cell
Structures of Metals and Ceramics.DESCRIPTION: Draw a direction on hexgonal close-packed  unit cell diagram.

Structures of Metals and Ceramics.TITLE: Directions in Crystals
Structures of Metals and Ceramics.DESCRIPTION: The indices for  directions in a crystal are determined.

Structures of Metals and Ceramics.TITLE: Lattice Structures, Part 1 (external author)
Structures of Metals and Ceramics.DESCRIPTION: Part one of a two-part sequence on the structure of solids.

Structures of Metals and Ceramics.TITLE: Lattice Structures, Part 2 (external author)
Structures of Metals and Ceramics.DESCRIPTION: Part two of a two-part sequence on lattice structure. Covers tetrahedral and octahedral holes and the structures of halite, fluorite, and sphalerite.

Structures of Metals and Ceramics.TITLE: Linear and Planar Densities
Structures of Metals and Ceramics.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the linear and planar densities of a metal.

Structures of Metals and Ceramics.TITLE: Miller-Bravais Indices: Hexagonal Structure
Structures of Metals and Ceramics.DESCRIPTION: Determines the four-parameter Miller-Bravais indices for an hexagonal unit cell.

Structures of Metals and Ceramics.TITLE: Packing Factor for a Body-Centered Cubic Structure
Structures of Metals and Ceramics.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the atomic packing factor (fraction of the unit cell occupied by atoms) for a body-centered cubic (BCC) structure.

Structures of Metals and Ceramics.TITLE: Radius of a Metal Atom and Metal Density
Structures of Metals and Ceramics.DESCRIPTION: Uses the unit cell structure and dimensions to determine the radius of a lead atom and the density of lead.

Structures of Metals and Ceramics.TITLE: Rock Salt Structure
Structures of Metals and Ceramics.DESCRIPTION: Describes the rock salt crystal structure, which is the structure of FeO.

Structures of Metals and Ceramics.TITLE: Tetrahedral and Octahedral Sites
Structures of Metals and Ceramics.DESCRIPTION: Describe the locations of tetrahedral and octahedral sites in a face-centered cubic (FCC) crystal structure.

Structures of Metals and Ceramics.TITLE: Unit Cell Length for Iron Oxide
Structures of Metals and Ceramics.DESCRIPTION: Uses the density and the structure of FeO to determine its unit cell dimension.

Structures of Metals and Ceramics.TITLE: XRD Peak Analysis
Structures of Metals and Ceramics.DESCRIPTION: Find the Miller indices of a peak in a x-ray diffraction pattern for copper.

Imperfections in Solids.TITLE: Hume-Rothery Rules
Imperfections in Solids.DESCRIPTION: Applies the Hume-Rothery rules to predict solubility of an aluminum-silicon alloy.

Imperfections in Solids.TITLE: Point Defects in Ceramics
Imperfections in Solids.DESCRIPTION: Describes vacancy and interstitial defects in a salt crystal.

Imperfections in Solids.TITLE: Vacancies in Metals
Imperfections in Solids.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the fraction of vacancies in a copper crystal structure at 1000C.

Diffusion.TITLE: Diffusion into a Solid
Diffusion.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the time for carbon to diffuse into a metal alloy at high temperature.

Diffusion.TITLE: Hydrogen Diffusion through Palladium
Diffusion.DESCRIPTION: Use Fick's law to calculate the temperature needed to obtain a desired flux of hydrogen, which is diffusing through a palladium membrane.

Mechanical Properties.TITLE: Area Moment of Inertia of a Wide-Flange Beam
Mechanical Properties.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the area moment of inertia for a wide-flange beam by breaking it into three parts: the web, the upper flange, and the lower flange. Note that the flanges support the majority of the normal stress because they are far from the centroid. The web supports very little normal stress. When a wide-flange beam is loaded sideways, its moment of inertia is only about 1-3 as large.

Mechanical Properties.TITLE: Elastic Properties of Metals
Mechanical Properties.DESCRIPTION: Uses the elastic properties of metals to select a material for a design problem.

Mechanical Properties.TITLE: Engineering Stress and Strain
Mechanical Properties.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to calculate engineering stress and strain.

Mechanical Properties.TITLE: Moment of Inertia for a Circular Beam
Mechanical Properties.DESCRIPTION: Derives the moment of inertia for a beam with a circular cross section.

Mechanical Properties.TITLE: Moment of Inertia for a Rectangular Beam
Mechanical Properties.DESCRIPTION: Derives the moment of inertia for a beam with a rectangular cross section.

Mechanical Properties.TITLE: Stress-Strain Diagrams
Mechanical Properties.DESCRIPTION: Introduction to engineering stress-strain diagrams for metals.

Electrical Properties.TITLE: Electrical Conductivity
Electrical Properties.DESCRIPTION: Compares the electrical conductivities of two metal alloys given voltage drop data in a test circuit.

Electrical Properties.TITLE: Electron Energy Bands in Solids
Electrical Properties.DESCRIPTION: Describes the electron energy band structures in metals, insulators, and semiconductors.

Polymers.TITLE: Addition Polymerization
Polymers.DESCRIPTION: Describes the reaction steps in addition polymerization, using free radical polymerization as an example.

Polymers.TITLE: Polymer Molecular Weight
Polymers.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the number average and the weight average molecular weight from a polymer molecular weight distribution.

Polymers.TITLE: Polymerization Reactor: Molecular Weight Distribution
Polymers.DESCRIPTION: Discusses how molecular weight distribution (MWD) in a polymerization reactor depends on the type of reactor used because the MWD depends on the residence time distribution, the concentration at which reaction takes place, and the chain growth rate

Polymers.TITLE: Step-Growth Polymerization
Polymers.DESCRIPTION: An introduction to step growth polymerization.

Phase Diagrams.TITLE: Cooling Curves for a Liquid-Solid System
Phase Diagrams.DESCRIPTION: Uses the information in a phase diagram to draw the temperature dependence on time as a binary liquid alloy is slowly cooled.

Phase Diagrams.TITLE: Gibbs Phase Rule for Material Science
Phase Diagrams.DESCRIPTION: Explains the Gibbs phase rule and applies to a binary  system in which the two components are only partially miscible in the liquid phase.

Phase Diagrams.TITLE: Lever Rule for Solid-Liquid Phase Diagram
Phase Diagrams.DESCRIPTION: Applies the lever rule to a solid-liquid mixture to determine the fraction of each phase in equilibrium and explains the basis for the lever rule.

Phase Diagrams.TITLE: Non-Equilibrium Microstructures
Phase Diagrams.DESCRIPTION: Describes the non-equilibrium solid microstructures that form when a binary liquid alloy cools.

Phase Diagrams.TITLE: Phase Diagram with Peritectic Reaction
Phase Diagrams.DESCRIPTION: Describes the phases that form when a binary liquid is cooled and the mixture undergoes a peritectic reaction.

Phase Diagrams.TITLE: Pressure-Temperature Diagram
Phase Diagrams.DESCRIPTION: Describes the regions of a pressure-temperature projection and the behavior across phase boundaries.

Phase Diagrams.TITLE: Solid-Liquid Phase Diagram (Simulation)
Phase Diagrams.DESCRIPTION: Describes the phases present on a temperature versus mole fraction diagram for the titanium-uranium system using an interactive Mathematica simulation. This simulation is available at:

Phase Diagrams.TITLE: Solid-Liquid Phase Diagram for Miscible Metals
Phase Diagrams.DESCRIPTION: Describes the regions of the T-x phase diagram for two miscible metals, describes the behavior as a liquid is cooled to form a solid, and discusses why the two metals are miscible.

Phase Diagrams.TITLE: Solid-Liquid Phase Diagrams
Phase Diagrams.DESCRIPTION: Describes the regions of a liquid-solid, T-x phase diagram for a system composed of Mg and Si.

Phase Diagrams.TITLE: Solid-Solid-Liquid Phase Diagram (Simulation)
Phase Diagrams.DESCRIPTION:
