escribes an interactive simulation that shows the phase diagram (temperature versus mole fraction) for two solids that form a solid compound. Heat can be added to show how phases change with temperature and liquid forms. The simulation is located at:
http://demonstrations.wolfram.com/SolidSolidLiquidEquilibrium/

Phase Diagrams.TITLE: Ternary Phase Diagram with Phase Envelope (Simulation)
Phase Diagrams.DESCRIPTION:
Describes two interactive simulations that show ternary phase diagrams where two types of phase separation occur to form two solutions in equilibrium. These simulations are located at:
http://demonstrations.wolfram.com/TernaryPhaseDiagramWithPhaseEnvelope/ 
http://demonstrations.wolfram.com/TernaryPhaseDiagramWithAlternatePhaseEnvelope/

Phase Diagrams.TITLE: Txy Phase Diagrams for VLLE (Simulation)
Phase Diagrams.DESCRIPTION: Uses an interactive simulation to demonstrate equilibrium phases for a binary system on a T-x-y diagram where the two components are only partially miscible in the liquid phase. The interactive simulation is available on the Wolfram Demonstration Project website: http://demonstrations.wolfram.com/VaporLiquidLiquidEquilibriumVLLE/

Phase Diagrams.TITLE: What is a Eutectic?
Phase Diagrams.DESCRIPTION: Describes what a eutectic is and shows eutectic formation of a temperature-composition diagram for solid-liquid equilibrium.

Phase Diagrams.TITLE: What is a Eutectic? (Simulation)
Phase Diagrams.DESCRIPTION:
Describes how to use an interactive simulation that plots temperature versus composition for a binary mixture and demonstrates eutectic melting. The simulation is located at:
http://demonstrations.wolfram.com/SolidSolidLiquidEquilibrium/

Deformation and Strengthening.TITLE: Dislocations and Plastic Deformation
Deformation and Strengthening.DESCRIPTION: Explains the concepts of dislocations in metal crystal structures and plastic deformation.

Deformation and Strengthening.TITLE: Recrystallization
Deformation and Strengthening.DESCRIPTION: Describes recrystallization and grain growth when a material is plastically deformed.

Physical Chemistry.TITLE: Degeneracy
Physical Chemistry.DESCRIPTION: Discusses degeneracy which is usually related to the presence of symmetry in a system. Example uses a particle in a 2-D "square" box.

Physical Chemistry.TITLE: Eigenvalues and Eigenfunctions
Physical Chemistry.DESCRIPTION: Determine whether or not the given functions are eigenfunctions of the operator d/dx.

Physical Chemistry.TITLE: Harmonic Oscillator
Physical Chemistry.DESCRIPTION: Determine allowed energies and wave function for a particle undergoing harmonic motion.

Physical Chemistry.TITLE: Normalizing a Wavefunction
Physical Chemistry.DESCRIPTION: Determine the normalization factor "A" for the wave function psi(x) = A*sin(n*pi*x/L).

Physical Chemistry.TITLE: Particle in a Box
Physical Chemistry.DESCRIPTION: Determine the allowed energies and solve for the wave function for a particle in  a 1-D box.

Physical Chemistry.TITLE: Separation of Variables
Physical Chemistry.DESCRIPTION: Determine the wave function ad allowed energy levels for a particle in a 2-D box.

Simulink.TITLE: Introduction to Simulink
Simulink.DESCRIPTION: Introduces Simulink in Matlab and models a first-order transfer function.

Simulink.TITLE: Simulink: FOPDT Approximations
Simulink.DESCRIPTION: Models high order transfer functions using first-order plus dead time approximations (Taylor and Skogestad methods) in Simulink.

Simulink.TITLE: Simulink: Process Modeling Part 1
Simulink.DESCRIPTION: Models flow through two pressurized tanks in series using Simulink. Part 1 of 2.

Simulink.TITLE: Simulink: Process Modeling Part 2
Simulink.DESCRIPTION: Models a reactor with recycle using Simulink. Part 2 of 2.

Simulink.TITLE: Simulink: Second-Order Transfer Functions
Simulink.DESCRIPTION: Models second-order transfer models in Simulink.

Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.TITLE: Analysis Using Damping Coefficients
Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.DESCRIPTION: Analyzes the stability and oscillatory nature of a second-order differential equation.

Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.TITLE: Blending Process: Deviation Variables
Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.DESCRIPTION: Writes the mass balances for the blending process in terms of deviation variables.

Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.TITLE: Blending Process: Dynamic Modeling
Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.DESCRIPTION: Builds a dynamic model of the blending process using mass balances.

Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.TITLE: Blending Process: Final Value Theorem
Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.DESCRIPTION: The long-term behavior of the blending process is calculated directly from the transfer function, using the final value theorem.

Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.TITLE: Blending Process: Introduction to Laplace Transform
Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.DESCRIPTION: Presents the concept of the Laplace transform, and demonstrates the method on the blending process. The time-varying volume in the tank is calculated, for the case when a step change is applied to the inlet flow.

Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.TITLE: Blending Process: Introduction to Linearization
Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.DESCRIPTION: Presents the concept of linearization using a first-order Taylor series approximation, and demonstrates this concept on the blending process.  The example used here is the volume in the tank, which is described by a linear differential equation.

Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.TITLE: Blending Process: Laplace Transform and State Space
Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.DESCRIPTION: Calculate long-term behavior of the system using Laplace transforms.

Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.TITLE: Blending Process: Laplace Transform Example
Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the Laplace transform method to the blending process. The time-varying mass fraction in the tank is calculated, for the case when a step change is applied to the inlet flow.

Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.TITLE: Blending Process: Linearization Example
Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates linearization using the blending process.  A nonlinear differential equation is considered here, which describes the mass fraction in the tank.

Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.TITLE: Blending Process: State Space
Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.DESCRIPTION: The linear approximate model of the blending process is rewritten in state space form.  The dynamic states are the deviations in volume and in mass fraction.  The inputs are the flow rates of the inlet and outlet streams.

Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.TITLE: Blending Process: Steady-State
Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the steady states for the blending process, beginning with a dynamic model.

Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.TITLE: Integrating Process: Model and Math
Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.DESCRIPTION: Describes an integrating process and uses an example of a cylindrical storage tank to develop a transfer function.

Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.TITLE: Laplace Transforms: Differential Equations 1
Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to solve differential equations using Laplace transforms when the initial conditions are all zero.

Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.TITLE: Laplace Transforms: Graphs
Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.DESCRIPTION: Converts a graphical function in the time domain into the Laplace domain using the definition of a Laplace transfer.

Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.TITLE: Laplace Transforms: Heaviside Method
Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.DESCRIPTION: Uses the Heaviside method to solve Laplace transforms.

Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.TITLE: Laplace Transforms: Initial and Final Value Theorem
Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.DESCRIPTION: Uses the initial value theorem (IVT) and the final value theorem (FVT) to solve a Laplace transform problem.

Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.TITLE: Laplace Transforms: Partial Fractions (Imaginary Roots)
Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.DESCRIPTION: Shows how to solve equations in the Laplace domain that contain imaginary roots and convert them into the time domain.

Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.TITLE: Laplace Transforms: Real Transition Theorem
Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.DESCRIPTION: Explores dead time in the Laplace domain and the usage of the real translation theorem.

Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.TITLE: Linearization of Differential Equations
Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.DESCRIPTION: Derives the method of converting a differential equation into deviation variables.

Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.TITLE: Mathematical Modeling: Energy Balances
Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.DESCRIPTION: Develops a mathematical model for a chemical process using energy balances.

Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.TITLE: Mathematical Modeling: Material Balances
Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.DESCRIPTION: Develops a mathematical model for a chemical process using material balances.

Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.TITLE: Mathematical Modeling: Multiple Balances
Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.DESCRIPTION: Develops a mathematical model for a chemical process using material & energy balances.

Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.TITLE: Transfer Function Models
Mathematical Modeling/Laplace Transforms.DESCRIPTION: Develops a transfer function model using an energy balance. Shows how changes in the inlet temperature of a tank impact the outlet temperature.

First- and Second-Order Models.TITLE: Approximating Higher-Order Transfer Functions as FOPDTs
First- and Second-Order Models.DESCRIPTION: Discusses how to model higher-order transfer functions as first-order plus dead time transfer functions (FOPDT).

First- and Second-Order Models.TITLE: Developing First-Order Response to Step
First- and Second-Order Models.DESCRIPTION: Shows how a first-order transfer function responds to a step change. Develops a generic equation and applies it to an example.

First- and Second-Order Models.TITLE: Developing Transfer Functions for an Interacting Process
First- and Second-Order Models.DESCRIPTION: Develops the transfer functions to describe an interacting process.

First- and Second-Order Models.TITLE: Finding Gain and Time Constant from a Transfer Function Model
First- and Second-Order Models.DESCRIPTION: Determines the gain and the time constant for a stirred tank bioreactor that is represented by a first-order transfer function.

First- and Second-Order Models.TITLE: First-Order Lead Lag Systems
First- and Second-Order Models.DESCRIPTION: Introduces lead lag systems with a particular focus on first-order systems.

First- and Second-Order Models.TITLE: First-Order Transfer Functions in Series
First- and Second-Order Models.DESCRIPTION: Shows how two first-order transfer functions in series can lead to a second-order transfer function using an example.

First- and Second-Order Models.TITLE: First-Order Transform Function with Linearization
First- and Second-Order Models.DESCRIPTION: Determines how the exiting concentration changes as a function of time for a CSTR using Laplace transforms

First- and Second-Order Models.TITLE: Interacting vs Non-Interacting Processes
First- and Second-Order Models.DESCRIPTION: Discusses the differences between interacting and non-interacting processes.

First- and Second-Order Models.TITLE: Inverse Response
First- and Second-Order Models.DESCRIPTION: explains an inverse response to a step input for a second-order, overdamped, lead-lag system

First- and Second-Order Models.TITLE: Second-Order Underdamped Example
First- and Second-Order Models.DESCRIPTION: Develops a second-order underdamped transfer function for a temperature control loop.

First- and Second-Order Models.TITLE: Second-Order Underdamped Transfer Functions
First- and Second-Order Models.DESCRIPTION: Describes second-order underdamped transfer functions and how they respond to a step change in the input.

First- and Second-Order Models.TITLE: Using Data to Develop a FOPDT
First- and Second-Order Models.DESCRIPTION: Uses process data to develop a first-order plus dead time (FOPDT) transfer function to relate the process variables.

Block Diagrams and Controllers.TITLE: Block Diagram Algebra Basics
Block Diagrams and Controllers.DESCRIPTION: Shows the basic components of block diagrams and briefly discusses some mathematical properties.

Block Diagrams and Controllers.TITLE: Controller Action
Block Diagrams and Controllers.DESCRIPTION: Discusses how to determine if a controller should be direct acting or reverse acting.

Block Diagrams and Controllers.TITLE: Converting a Problem Statement to a P&ID and a Block Diagram
Block Diagrams and Controllers.DESCRIPTION: Converts a process control problem statement into a P&ID and develops the block diagram for the process.

Block Diagrams and Controllers.TITLE: Feedback Control Loop Block Diagram
Block Diagrams and Controllers.DESCRIPTION: Analyzes each of the blocks found in a feedback only control loop.

Block Diagrams and Controllers.TITLE: Feedforward Control Example (Dynamic)
Block Diagrams and Controllers.DESCRIPTION: Develops a dynamic feedforward control scheme for a blending tank that mixes two streams and explores possibility of perfect control.

Block Diagrams and Controllers.TITLE: Introduction to Cascade Control
Block Diagrams and Controllers.DESCRIPTION: Introduces cascade control, describes how it is implemented, and draws a block diagram for a reactor with a cooling jacket.

Block Diagrams and Controllers.TITLE: Introduction to Feedforward Control
Block Diagrams and Controllers.DESCRIPTION: Introduces feedforward control, describes how it is implemented, and draws a block diagram for a reactor with two inlet streams.

Block Diagrams and Controllers.TITLE: Introduction to PID Controllers
Block Diagrams and Controllers.DESCRIPTION: Discusses the PID family of controllers (P-only, I-only, PI, D-only and PID).

Block Diagrams and Controllers.TITLE: Not as Simple Block Diagram Analysis
Block Diagrams and Controllers.DESCRIPTION: Analyses a block diagram with multiple loops and inputs.

Block Diagrams and Controllers.TITLE: PID Controllers and Disturbances
Block Diagrams and Controllers.DESCRIPTION: Analyses how the type of control selected from the PID family affects the steady-state value of a process for a change that occurs to a disturbance variable.

Block Diagrams and Controllers.TITLE: Set Point and Controllers
Block Diagrams and Controllers.DESCRIPTION: Explains how the selection of a controller is effected by a set point change.

Block Diagrams and Controllers.TITLE: Simple Block Diagram Analysis
Block Diagrams and Controllers.DESCRIPTION: Uses block diagram algebra to find the transfer function relating an input to an output.

Block Diagrams and Controllers.TITLE: Static Feedforward Controller
Block Diagrams and Controllers.DESCRIPTION: Develops a static feedforward control scheme for a blending tank that mixes two streams.

Block Diagrams and Controllers.TITLE: Transfer Functions for Cascade Control using a Block Diagram
Block Diagrams and Controllers.DESCRIPTION: Develops transfer functions for a generic cascade control scheme using a block diagram.

Block Diagrams and Controllers.TITLE: Turning Model into Block Diagram
Block Diagrams and Controllers.DESCRIPTION: shows how to turn a model into a block diagram for a process control problem

Equipment.TITLE: Control Valves
Equipment.DESCRIPTION: Discusses concepts of a control valve, one of the most important parts in a control scheme. It often controls the flow rate of the manipulated variable.

Equipment.TITLE: Fail Safety Status of Valves
Equipment.DESCRIPTION: Introduces fail-open and fail-closed valves and gives examples of when each type of valve should be used.

Equipment.TITLE: Inherent vs. Installed Control Valves
Equipment.DESCRIPTION: Explains the differences between inherent and installed characteristics of valves, why they are important and how to conduct calculations.

Equipment.TITLE: Sensors and Transmitters
Equipment.DESCRIPTION: Discusses the concept of sensors and transmitters and how they relate to the machinery in order to control a process.

Stability/Controller Tuning.TITLE: Characteristic Equation
Stability/Controller Tuning.DESCRIPTION: Discusses the characteristic equation and applies it to a basic block diagram. Explains how to determine process stability.

Stability/Controller Tuning.TITLE: Cohen-Coon Tuning (Process Reaction Curve)
Stability/Controller Tuning.DESCRIPTION: Uses the Cohen-Coon tuning method to develop tuning parameters given process data.

Stability/Controller Tuning.TITLE: Continuous Cycling Method (Ziegler-Nichols Method)
Stability/Controller Tuning.DESCRIPTION: Explains how the continuous cycling method (also known as the Ziegler-Nichols method) is used to develop tuning parameters for a controlled system.

Stability/Controller Tuning.TITLE: Controller Synthesis Introduction
Stability/Controller Tuning.DESCRIPTION: Introduces the theory of controller synthesis for process control.

Stability/Controller Tuning.TITLE: Controller Synthesis: First-Order Plus Dead Time
Stability/Controller Tuning.DESCRIPTION: Applies the theory of controller synthesis to a process that follows first-order plus dead time (FOPDT) transfer function.

Stability/Controller Tuning.TITLE: Determine Stability of Controlled System using a Routh Array
Stability/Controller Tuning.DESCRIPTION: Uses a Routh array to determine the stability of a controlled system.

Stability/Controller Tuning.TITLE: Direct Substitution Method
Stability/Controller Tuning.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to use the direct substitution method to determine the stability of a controlled process.

Stability/Controller Tuning.TITLE: Direct Substitution Method Example 1
Stability/Controller Tuning.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the ultimate gain and the ultimate period for a temperature control loop used to control the temperature of a process fluid exiting a heat exchanger using cooling water.

Stability/Controller Tuning.TITLE: Direct Substitution Method Example 2
Stability/Controller Tuning.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the ultimate gain and the ultimate period using the same set up as the screencast 'Direct Substitution Method Example 1', but with a new sensor-transmitter. Compares how the new sensor-transmitter changes the control system.

Stability/Controller Tuning.TITLE: Introduction to Routh Arrays
Stability/Controller Tuning.DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use a Routh array to determine if two characteristic equations for two different processes are stable or unstable.

Stability/Controller Tuning.TITLE: PID Controller: Ziegler-Nichols Tuning Parameters
Stability/Controller Tuning.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to use the Ziegler-Nichols tuning parameters for a PID controller.

Stability/Controller Tuning.TITLE: Routh Array: Dead Time
Stability/Controller Tuning.DESCRIPTION: Analyses whether processes with dead time are stable or unstable using a Routh array.

Stability/Controller Tuning.TITLE: Routh Array: PI Controller
Stability/Controller Tuning.DESCRIPTION: Conducts a stability analysis for a process controlled by a PI controller. Determines the range for which the controller gain and the time constant are stable.

The Blending Process.TITLE: Blending Process: Dynamic Modeling
The Blending Process.DESCRIPTION: Builds a dynamic model of the blending process using mass balances.

The Blending Process.TITLE: Blending Process: Steady-State
The Blending Process.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the steady states for the blending process, beginning with a dynamic model.

The Blending Process.TITLE: Blending Process: Deviation Variables
The Blending Process.DESCRIPTION: Writes the mass balances for the blending process in terms of deviation variables.

The Blending Process.TITLE: Blending Process: Introduction to Linearization
The Blending Process.DESCRIPTION: Presents the concept of linearization using a first-order Taylor series approximation, and demonstrates this concept on the blending process.  The example used here is the volume in the tank, which is described by a linear differential equation.

The Blending Process.TITLE: Blending Process: Linearization Example
The Blending Process.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates linearization using the blending process.  A nonlinear differential equation is considered here, which describes the mass fraction in the tank.

The Blending Process.TITLE: Blending Process: Introduction to Laplace Transform
The Blending Process.DESCRIPTION: Presents the concept of the Laplace transform, and demonstrates the method on the blending process. The time-varying volume in the tank is calculated, for the case when a step change is applied to the inlet flow.

The Blending Process.TITLE: Blending Process: Laplace Transform Example
The Blending Process.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the Laplace transform method to the blending process. The time-varying mass fraction in the tank is calculated, for the case when a step change is applied to the inlet flow.

The Blending Process.TITLE: Blending Process: State Space
The Blending Process.DESCRIPTION: The linear approximate model of the blending process is rewritten in state space form.  The dynamic states are the deviations in volume and in mass fraction.  The inputs are the flow rates of the inlet and outlet streams.

The Blending Process.TITLE: Blending Process: Final Value Theorem
The Blending Process.DESCRIPTION: The long-term behavior of the blending process is calculated directly from the transfer function, using the final value theorem.

The Blending Process.TITLE: Blending Process: Laplace Transform and State Space
The Blending Process.DESCRIPTION: Calculate long-term behavior of the system using Laplace transforms.

The Blending Process.TITLE: Blending Process: Closing the Loop
The Blending Process.DESCRIPTION: The basic principle of feedback is introduced, in which the process input is automatically and continuously adjusted based on the measured process output.  A new closed loop dynamic system is obtained, in which the new input is the setpoint value for the output.

The Blending Process.TITLE: Blending Process: Closed Loop Response
The Blending Process.DESCRIPTION: The closed loop response of the blending process is calculated, for a step change in the process setpoint.  A proportional controller is used, and the dependence of the response on the control gain is discussed.

The Blending Process.TITLE: Blending Process: Closed Loop Stability
The Blending Process.DESCRIPTION: The concept of stability is presented, requiring a bounded output for any bounded input.  The stability of the closed loop blending process is calculated for a proportional control law.  The root locus plot is introduced to visualize the dependence of stability on controller gain.

The Blending Process.TITLE: Blending Process: Direct Synthesis
The Blending Process.DESCRIPTION: The feedback control law is calculated using the direct synthesis method, to achieve a desired closed-loop behavior for good setpoint tracking.  Given a model of the process, the control law is calculated.  For the blending process, this gives a proportional-integral controller.

The Blending Process.TITLE: Blending Process: Introduction to Ratio Control
The Blending Process.DESCRIPTION: The concept of ratio control is introduced, as a type of feedforward control to keep two streams in a fixed ratio.  The block diagram is introduced, and the overall transfer function is derived.

The Blending Process.TITLE: Blending Process: Ratio Control Example
The Blending Process.DESCRIPTION: The transfer function for the blending process is derived, using a proportional controller for the feedback block.

The Blending Process.TITLE: Blending Process: Relative Gain Array
The Blending Process.DESCRIPTION: The relative gain array is calculated for a multi-input, multi-output blending process.  A best pairing of inputs and outputs is identified, as well as significant interaction terms between the two loops.

Process Diagrams.TITLE: Basics of BFDs, PFDs, & PIDs
Process Diagrams.DESCRIPTION: Compares block flow diagrams (BFDs), process flow diagrams (PFDs), and piping and instrumentation diagrams (PIDs).

Process Diagrams.TITLE: BFD: Avoiding Common Mistakes
Process Diagrams.DESCRIPTION: Describes common mistakes made when drawing block flow diagrams and how to avoid making them.

Process Diagrams.TITLE: Block Flow Diagram Examples
Process Diagrams.DESCRIPTION: Gives examples of block flow diagrams (BFDs) for various processes.

Process Diagrams.TITLE: Characteristics of BFDs
Process Diagrams.DESCRIPTION: Describes characteristics of block flow diagrams (BFDs).

Characteristics of PFDs.TITLE: Importance of PFDs
Characteristics of PFDs.DESCRIPTION: Introduces and explains the importance of process flow diagrams (PFDs).

Characteristics of PFDs.TITLE: PFDs: Compressors and Pumps Part 1
Characteristics of PFDs.DESCRIPTION: Introduces the symbol representations of compressors and pumps and gives a general overview of how these pieces of equipment operate. Part 1 of 4.

Characteristics of PFDs.TITLE: PFDs: Compressors and Pumps Part 2
Characteristics of PFDs.DESCRIPTION: Introduces equipment summary tables for compressors and pumps. Part 2 of 4.

Characteristics of PFDs.TITLE: PFDs: Compressors and Pumps Part 3
Characteristics of PFDs.DESCRIPTION: Explains what should be included in an equipment summary table for compressors and pumps. Part 3 of 4.

Characteristics of PFDs.TITLE: PFDs: Compressors and Pumps Part 4
Characteristics of PFDs.DESCRIPTION: Explains what should be included in an equipment summary table for compressors and pumps. Part 4 of 4.

Characteristics of PFDs.TITLE: PFDs: Furnaces
Characteristics of PFDs.DESCRIPTION: Introduces furnaces/fired heaters and explains what information should be included in an equipment summary table for a furnace.

Characteristics of PFDs.TITLE: PFDs: Letter and Number Designation
Characteristics of PFDs.DESCRIPTION: Describes the proper letter and number designation for equipment on a process flow diagram (PFD).

Characteristics of PFDs.TITLE: PFDs: Mixers and Splitters
Characteristics of PFDs.DESCRIPTION: Describes the types of mixers and splitters commonly used on a process flow diagram (PFD).

Characteristics of PFDs.TITLE: PFDs: Reactor Symbols
Characteristics of PFDs.DESCRIPTION: Describes the reactor symbols used on a process flow diagram in Aspen Plus and CHEMCAD.

Characteristics of PFDs.TITLE: PFDs: Simple Control Loops Part 1
Characteristics of PFDs.DESCRIPTION: Discusses adding simple control loops to a PFD and the four main variables controlled in a process. Gives an example of a temperature control loop. Part 1 of 4.

Characteristics of PFDs.TITLE: PFDs: Simple Control Loops Part 2
Characteristics of PFDs.DESCRIPTION: Example of a simple pressure control loop and a simple level control loop. Part 2 of 4.

Characteristics of PFDs.TITLE: PFDs: Simple Control Loops Part 3
Characteristics of PFDs.DESCRIPTION: Example of a simple flow rate control loop. Part 3 of 4.

Characteristics of PFDs.TITLE: PFDs: Simple Control Loops Part 4
Characteristics of PFDs.DESCRIPTION: Example of a combination of control loops. Part 4 of 4.

Characteristics of PFDs.TITLE: PFDs: Stream Tables
Characteristics of PFDs.DESCRIPTION: Describes what a stream table is and what should be included.

Characteristics of PFDs.TITLE: PFDs: Utility Summary Table
Characteristics of PFDs.DESCRIPTION: Describes utility summary tables and what should be included in them.

Heat Exchangers.TITLE: Estimates for Heat Transfer Coefficients
Heat Exchangers.DESCRIPTION: Provides estimates for heat transfer coefficients for different scenarios.

Heat Exchangers.TITLE: How to Calculate Heat Duty
Heat Exchangers.DESCRIPTION: Introduces heat duty and calculates it for a stream of water heated from 25C to 140C at 30 psi.

Heat Exchangers.TITLE: PFDs: Heat Exchangers Part 1
Heat Exchangers.DESCRIPTION: Introduces the symbol representations for heat exchangers on a PFD. Part 1 of 5.

Heat Exchangers.TITLE: PFDs: Heat Exchangers Part 2
Heat Exchangers.DESCRIPTION: Discusses an equipment summary table for heat exchangers. Part 2 of 5.

Heat Exchangers.TITLE: PFDs: Heat Exchangers Part 3
Heat Exchangers.DESCRIPTION: Discusses different types of heat exchangers. Part 3 of 5.

Heat Exchangers.TITLE: PFDs: Heat Exchangers Part 4
Heat Exchangers.DESCRIPTION: Continues the discussion of equipment summary tables for heat exchangers. Part 4 of 5.

Heat Exchangers.TITLE: PFDs: Heat Exchangers Part 5
Heat Exchangers.DESCRIPTION: Finalizes the discussion of equipment summary tables for heat exchangers. Discusses materials of construction for heat exchangers. Part 5 of 5.

Reactors, Vessels, Towers.TITLE: PFDs: Reactors/Towers/Vessels Part 1
Reactors, Vessels, Towers.DESCRIPTION: Introduces the different types of towers found on a PFD. Part 1 of 5.

Reactors, Vessels, Towers.TITLE: PFDs: Reactors/Towers/Vessels Part 2
Reactors, Vessels, Towers.DESCRIPTION: Introduces the different types of vessels found on a PFD. Part 2 of 5.

Reactors, Vessels, Towers.TITLE: PFDs: Reactors/Towers/Vessels Part 3
Reactors, Vessels, Towers.DESCRIPTION: Discusses an equipment summary table for reactors, towers, and vessels. Part 3 of 5.

Reactors, Vessels, Towers.TITLE: PFDs: Reactors/Towers/Vessels Part 4
Reactors, Vessels, Towers.DESCRIPTION: Discusses an equipment summary table for reactors, towers, and vessels. Part 4 of 5.

Reactors, Vessels, Towers.TITLE: PFDs: Reactors/Towers/Vessels Part 5
Reactors, Vessels, Towers.DESCRIPTION: Discusses an equipment summary table for reactors, towers, and vessels. Part 5 of 5.

Considerations.TITLE: Designing a Heat Exchanger Network
Considerations.DESCRIPTION: Using MER targets and pinch point determined in prior screencast, setup a heat exchanger network with utilities.

Considerations.TITLE: Rule of Thumb: Adding an Expander to a System
Considerations.DESCRIPTION: Uses a design heuristic related to recovering energy from a process when reducing the pressure of a fluid stream.

Considerations.TITLE: Rule of Thumb: Energy Losses in a Piping System
Considerations.DESCRIPTION: Uses a design heuristic related to energy losses in a piping system.

Considerations.TITLE: Temperature Interval Method for Heat Exchanger Networks
Considerations.DESCRIPTION: Use the temperature interval method to determine minimum energy requirements in designing a heat exchanger network.

Economics.TITLE: Approximate Profitability Measures
Economics.DESCRIPTION: Introduces the concept of return on investment, payback period and venture profit.

Economics.TITLE: Capital Cost Comparison: Capitalized Cost Analysis
Economics.DESCRIPTION: Compares the cost of two equipment options using the concept of capitalized cost.

Economics.TITLE: Capital Cost Comparison: Present Worth Analysis
Economics.DESCRIPTION: Compares the cost of two equipment options using the concept of present worth.

Economics.TITLE: Gross Economic Profit Analysis
Economics.DESCRIPTION: Performs a gross economic profit analysis on two reactions to determine which pathway should move forward in the design tree.

Economics.TITLE: Net Present Value and Investor's Rate of Return
Economics.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the net present value (NPV) for a project using cash flow and time value of money as well as the investor's rate of return (IRR).

Economics.TITLE: Sensitivity Analysis and Tornado Plots
Economics.DESCRIPTION: Analyzes net present value using sensitivity analysis and generates a tornado plot.

Equipment Design/Economics.TITLE: Excel User Form: Heat Exchanger Cost Estimator
Equipment Design/Economics.DESCRIPTION: Uses VBA to develop a user form to estimate the cost of a heat exchanger given type of heat exchanger, internal heat exchange area, construction material, and inflation.

SuperPro Designer.TITLE: SuperPro Designer: Adding a Stock Mixture
SuperPro Designer.DESCRIPTION: Shows how to add a stock mixture to an inlet stream and have the outlet streams composed of only the stock mixture components.

SuperPro Designer.TITLE: SuperPro Designer: Fermentation Simulation
SuperPro Designer.DESCRIPTION: Tutorial on setting up a fermentation in SuperPro Designer.

SuperPro Designer.TITLE: SuperPro Designer: Modeling a Batch Reactor
SuperPro Designer.DESCRIPTION: Overview of setting up a batch reactor in SuperPro Designer.

SuperPro Designer.TITLE: SuperPro Designer: Modeling a Reactor and Separator
SuperPro Designer.DESCRIPTION: Uses transesterification reaction to demonstrate setting up reactor and separator to obtain product of interest.

Aspen Plus Introduction.TITLE: Introduction to Aspen Plus: Building a Flowsheet
Aspen Plus Introduction.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to build a flowsheet in Aspen Plus by modeling a two-stream heat exchanger.

Aspen Plus Introduction.TITLE: Introduction to Aspen Plus: Chlorobenzene Plant
Aspen Plus Introduction.DESCRIPTION: Applies the fundamentals discussed in the Introduction to Aspen Plus screencasts to a industrially relevant chlorobenzene plant.

Aspen Plus Introduction.TITLE: Introduction to Aspen Plus: Choosing a Property Method
Aspen Plus Introduction.DESCRIPTION: Introduces Aspen Plus and describes the various property methods available.

Aspen Plus Introduction.TITLE: Introduction to Aspen Plus: Convergence and Presentation of Results
Aspen Plus Introduction.DESCRIPTION: Provides a detailed overview of simulation convergence and presentation of results in Aspen Plus.

Aspen Plus Introduction.TITLE: Introduction to Aspen Plus: Data Input and Running the Simulation
Aspen Plus Introduction.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to input data and run a simulation in Aspen Plus. Uses the flowsheet developed in the screencast "Introduction to Aspen Plus: Building a Flowsheet.

Aspen Plus Basics.TITLE: Aspen Plus: Compressors
Aspen Plus Basics.DESCRIPTION: Details the use of compressors in Aspen Plus.

Aspen Plus Basics.TITLE: Aspen Plus: Detailed Heat Exchanger Method
Aspen Plus Basics.DESCRIPTION: Explains the detailed heat exchanger method in Aspen Plus.

Aspen Plus Basics.TITLE: Aspen Plus: Double Heater Method
Aspen Plus Basics.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to use two heater models to simulate a heat exchanger in Aspen Plus.

Aspen Plus Basics.TITLE: Aspen Plus: DSTWU
Aspen Plus Basics.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to use a DSTWU separator model in Aspen Plus.

Aspen Plus Basics.TITLE: Aspen Plus: Flash Separators
Aspen Plus Basics.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates a flash separator model in Aspen Plus.

Aspen Plus Basics.TITLE: Aspen Plus: Pipes
Aspen Plus Basics.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to model different types of process piping in Aspen Plus.

Aspen Plus Basics.TITLE: Aspen Plus: Pumps
Aspen Plus Basics.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to use a pump simulator block in Aspen Plus.

Aspen Plus Basics.TITLE: Aspen Plus: RadFrac
Aspen Plus Basics.DESCRIPTION: Refines the DSTWU model from the screencast "Aspen Plus: DSTWU"  using a RadFrac model in Aspen Plus.

Aspen Plus Basics.TITLE: Aspen Plus: Reactor Example Problem
Aspen Plus Basics.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the use of reactor models through an example problem on the production of ethyl acetate in Aspen Plus.

Aspen Plus Basics.TITLE: Aspen Plus: Reactor Types
Aspen Plus Basics.DESCRIPTION: Provides an overview of the various types of reactor simulator blocks found in Aspen Plus.

Aspen Plus Basics.TITLE: Aspen Plus: Shortcut Heat Exchanger Method
Aspen Plus Basics.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the shortcut heat exchanger method in Aspen Plus.

Aspen Plus Basics.TITLE: Aspen Plus: Valves
Aspen Plus Basics.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to simulate a valve in Aspen Plus.

Aspen Plus Chlorobenzene Plant.TITLE: Aspen Plus: Chlorobenzene Costing
Aspen Plus Chlorobenzene Plant.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates an economic analysis of a chlorobenzene plant designed in Aspen Plus.

Aspen Plus Chlorobenzene Plant.TITLE: Aspen Plus: Chlorobenzene Plant
Aspen Plus Chlorobenzene Plant.DESCRIPTION: Runs the simulation of a chlorobenzene plant.

Aspen Plus Chlorobenzene Plant.TITLE: Aspen Plus: Heat Exchangers - Chlorobenzene Plant
Aspen Plus Chlorobenzene Plant.DESCRIPTION: Applies the concept of heat exchangers to the chlorobenzene plant simulation developed in the screencast "Introduction to Aspen Plus: Chlorobenzene Plant.

Aspen Plus Chlorobenzene Plant.TITLE: Aspen Plus: Pressure Changers - Chlorobenzene Plant
Aspen Plus Chlorobenzene Plant.DESCRIPTION: Applies the concept of pressure changers to the chlorobenzene plant simulation developed in the screencast "Introduction to Aspen Plus: Chlorobenzene Plant.

Aspen Plus Chlorobenzene Plant.TITLE: Aspen Plus: Reactors - Chlorobenzene Plant
Aspen Plus Chlorobenzene Plant.DESCRIPTION: Applies the concept of reactors to the chlorobenzene plant simulation developed in the screencast "Introduction to Aspen Plus: Chlorobenzene Plant.

Aspen Plus Chlorobenzene Plant.TITLE: Aspen Plus: Separators - Chlorobenzene Plant
Aspen Plus Chlorobenzene Plant.DESCRIPTION: Applies the concept of separators to the chlorobenzene plant simulation developed in the screencast "Introduction to Aspen Plus: Chlorobenzene Plant.

Team Dynamics.TITLE: Working in a Team Part 1
Team Dynamics.DESCRIPTION: Provides guidance on how to work in teams on a project. Part 1 of 3.

Team Dynamics.TITLE: Working in a Team Part 2
Team Dynamics.DESCRIPTION: Provides guidance on how to work in teams on a project. Part 2 of 3.

Team Dynamics.TITLE: Working in a Team Part 3
Team Dynamics.DESCRIPTION: Provides guidance on how to work in teams on a project. Part 3 of 3.

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: Adiabatic Compressor: Non-Ideal Gas
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: Uses the Peng-Robinson equation of state to calculate the exit temperature from an adiabatic compressor. The EOS spreadsheet that is used can be found on www.cheThermodynamics.net/software.

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: Batch Distillation: Azeotrope
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: The changes in temperature and composition of the vapor are plotted versus time for batch distillation of a binary liquid that has an azeotrope.

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: Bubble Pressure - Margules Equation
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: Determine the bubble pressure for a binary system using the one-parameter Margules equation.

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: Calculate Fugacity of a Fluid
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: Determine the fugacity of a hydrofluorocarbon.

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: Entropy Change: Ideal Gas
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: Determine the entropy change when temperature and pressure change for an ideal gas.

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: Entropy: 2 Explanations
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: Discuss (1) the entropy change for a continuous engineering operation, and (2) can 100 J work can be converted to 100 J heat continuously?

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: Excess Gibbs Free Energy
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: Determine the excess Gibbs free energy for a binary mixture from vapor-liquid equilibrium data.

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: Fugacity of a Single Component
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: Calculate the fugacities of a gas and a liquid.

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: Gas Phase Entropy Change
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: Calculates entropy change for the irreversible expansion of an ideal gas into a vacuum.

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: Gibbs Phase Rule
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: Explains the Gibbs phase rule and applies it to a binary system that has vapor and partially miscible liquids.

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: Isothermal Compression of a Non-Ideal Gas
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: Solves Peng-Robinson equation of state for compression of a non-ideal gas.

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: Isothermal Compression of a Non-Ideal Gas (Spreadsheet)
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: Uses equation of state spreadsheet to solve isothermal compression (part 2). See "Isothermal Compression of a Non-Ideal Gas." Spreadsheet can be downloaded from http://www.chethermo.net/software.

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: Mixing Ideal Solutions
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: Illustrates the changes in state variables (V, H, U, S, G) when ideal solutions form.

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: Molecular Weight of a Protein from Osmotic Pressure (Bio)
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: Uses osmotic pressure of a protein solution to determine the protein molecular weight.

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: Osmotic Pressure Derivation
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: Explanation of osmotic pressure.

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: Peng-Robinson EOS Spreadsheet 1
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: A tutorial on using a Peng-Robinson equation of state spreadsheet. Spreadsheet available for download at www.cheThermodynamics.net/software.

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: Peng-Robinson EOS Spreadsheet 2
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: A tutorial on using a Peng-Robinson equation of state spreadsheet for single-component equilibrium. Spreadsheet can be downloaded from www.cheThermodynamics.net/software.

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: Raoult's Law: Entropy Explanation
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: An explanation of why the partial pressure of a component is lower when the liquid phase is diluted by a second component using an entropy viewpoint.

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: Real Gas Expansion
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: Determine the final state of a real gas that expands adiabatically into a vacuum.

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: Real Gas Expansion Part 2: Excel Solver
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: Uses the Peng-Robinson equation of state spreadsheet from Elliott & Lira's textbook (www.cheThermodynamics.net/software) and Excel solver to calculate the final conditions for a real gas expanding into a vacuum. "Real Gas Expansion Part 1" describes the problem setup in detail.

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: Roots of Peng-Robinson Equation of State
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: Discuss the meaning of the three roots of the Peng-Robinson equation of state and the effect of pressure on the roots.

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: Steam Fugacity
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: Determine the fugacity of saturated steam using the steam tables.

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: Three Parameter EOS
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: Introduces the van der Waals equation of state (EOS), which is cubic, and explains its three roots.

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: Van der Waals Equation of State
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: Explains the terms in the Van der Waals equation of state and the reason for the terms and present plots of reduced pressure versus reduced volume.

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: What is Chemical Potential? (Multi-Component Systems)
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: Explains chemical potential for a multi-component system and discusses movement between phases and chemical reactions.

Thermodynamics Review.TITLE: What is Chemical Potential? (Single Component Systems)
Thermodynamics Review.DESCRIPTION: Explains chemical potential for a single component system and discusses its dependence on temperature, pressure, and phase.

Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.TITLE: Binary Pressure-Temperature Diagram
Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Describes how to read a pressure-temperature diagram for a binary mixture and compares this diagram to P-x-y and T-x-y diagrams.

Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.TITLE: Flash Calculation: Raoult's Law
Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Determine the outlet compositions and the fraction of liquid and vapor when a high pressure liquid is flashed to lower pressure. The outlet temperature and pressure are given and the vapor-liquid equilibrium is modeled by Raoult's law.

Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.TITLE: Heat Removal to Condense a Vapor Mixture
Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Describes the steps to condense a binary vapor mixture at its dew point to a liquid at its bubble point using the concept of state functions.

Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.TITLE: Ideal Binary VLE
Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Vapor-liquid equilibrium calculations for an ideal binary system.

Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.TITLE: Lever Rule Derivation
Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Uses mass balance to derive the lever rule, which determines the amounts of liquid and vapor in equilibrium given the overall mole fraction and the mole fractions in each phase.

Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.TITLE: Phase Equilibrium: Txy Diagram
Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: A conceptual question investigating how the molar composition changes to a vapor-liquid equilibrium system as temperature is changed.

Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.TITLE: Pressure Effect on VLE
Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Describes how vapor and liquid compositions change for a binary mixture as the pressure changes.

Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.TITLE: Pressure-Temperature Diagram for Binary Mixture (Simulation)
Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Describes how to use an interactive simulation that plots pressure versus temperature for a mixture of ethane and hexane.

Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.TITLE: P-x-y Diagram for Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium of a Binary Mixture
Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Uses an interactive simulation to explain how to read a P-x-y diagram for a binary mixture that obeys Raoult's law. Explains what happens as the pressure is lowered at constant temperature for a binary liquid mixture.

Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.TITLE: Pxy Diagram for VLE (Simulation)
Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Uses an interactive Mathematica simulation to describe a pressure-mole fraction diagram (P-x-y) that is generated with Raoult's law. Behavior is discussed where the pressure is changed at constant overall composition and where the overall composition is changed at constant pressure.

Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.TITLE: Raoult's Law Explanation
Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Explains the shapes of the Pxy and the Txy diagrams for Raoult's law.

Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.TITLE: Ternary Phase Diagram with Phase Envelope (Simulation)
Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Describes two interactive simulations that show ternary phase diagrams where two types of phase separation occur to form two solutions in equilibrium. These simulations are located at: http://demonstrations.wolfram.com/TernaryPhaseDiagramWithPhaseEnvelope/ and http://demonstrations.wolfram.com/TernaryPhaseDiagramWithAlternatePhaseEnvelope/

Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.TITLE: T-x-y Diagram for Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium of a Binary Mixture
Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Uses an interactive simulation to explain how to read a T-x-y diagram for a binary mixture that obeys Raoult's law

Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.TITLE: Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium: Wilson's Equation
Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Model vapor-liquid equilibrium for a binary mixture using Wilson's equation to determine the activity coefficients for the liquid phase.

Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.TITLE: Vapor-Liquid-Liquid Equilibrium
Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Describes the behavior of a binary system that is cooled. The two components are only partially miscible in the liquid phase.

Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.TITLE: VLE Calculations with Margules Equation
Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Uses VLE data at one liquid composition for a binary mixture and the two-parameter Margules model for activity coefficients to calculate VLE at another liquid composition.

Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.TITLE: VLE Calculations with UNIFAC
Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: Tutorial on a spreadsheet for VLE calculations using UNIFAC.

Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.TITLE: VLE: Wilson's Equation (POLYMATH)
Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium.DESCRIPTION: The equations used in the POLYMATH program were developed in a separate screencast entitled vapor-liquid equilibrium: Wilson's equation.

Flash Distillation.TITLE: Adiabatic Flash of a Mixture (Simulation)
Flash Distillation.DESCRIPTION: Describes how to use an interactive simulation that solves material balances, an energy balance, and Raoult's law for vapor-liquid equilibrium for a flash drum. A methanol/water liquid mixture at high pressure is fed to an adiabatic flash drum that is at lower pressure. The simulation is located at: http://demonstrations.wolfram.com/AdiabaticFlashDrumWithBinaryLiquidFeed/

Flash Distillation.TITLE: Adiabatic Flash Separation for Binary Liquid Feed
Flash Distillation.DESCRIPTION: Uses an interactive simulation to describe the behavior of an adiabatic flash drum with a binary liquid feed.

Flash Distillation.TITLE: Binary Phase Diagrams (Txy and xy)
Flash Distillation.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to generate phase diagrams and read them for use in separation calculations.

Flash Distillation.TITLE: Enthalpy Concentration Diagram
Flash Distillation.DESCRIPTION: Shows how to read an enthalpy concentration diagram and determine phase compositions.

Flash Distillation.TITLE: Enthalpy Concentration Diagram Example
Flash Distillation.DESCRIPTION: Uses an enthalpy composition diagram in a partial condensation problem.

Flash Distillation.TITLE: Flash Distillation Derivation
Flash Distillation.DESCRIPTION: Derives the operating line for binary flash distillation and shows how to use it.

Flash Distillation.TITLE: Flash Distillation Energy Balance
Flash Distillation.DESCRIPTION: Determines the operating temperatures and energy requirements for flash distillation.

Flash Distillation.TITLE: Q-line on a y-x Phase Diagram
Flash Distillation.DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use mass balances to draw a q-line on a y-x phase diagram for a n-hexane/n-octane mixture. The q-line determines the equilibrium compositions during flash separations.

Flash Distillation.TITLE: y-x Phase Diagram for VLE of a Binary Mixture
Flash Distillation.DESCRIPTION: Compares a T-x-y diagram to a y-x diagram for an n-hexane/n-octane mixture, and explains what the y-x diagram represents. The y-x diagrams are used often to visualize separations behavior.

Column-Distillation.TITLE: Batch Column: Constant Reflux
Column-Distillation.DESCRIPTION: Calculates how much liquid is left in the reboiler for a batch distillation unit with a constant reflux ratio.

Column-Distillation.TITLE: Batch Column: Variable Reflux
Column-Distillation.DESCRIPTION: Calculates how much liquid is left in the reboiler for a batch distillation unit with a variable reflux ratio.

Column-Distillation.TITLE: Batch Still: Single Stage
Column-Distillation.DESCRIPTION: Performs simple material balances on a single, batch still to determine the amount of distillate collected and its composition.

Column-Distillation.TITLE: Binary Distillation with Multiple Feeds
Column-Distillation.DESCRIPTION: Binary distillation example with multiple feeds solved using McCabe-Thiele analysis.

Column-Distillation.TITLE: Binary Distillation with Non-Optimal Feed
Column-Distillation.DESCRIPTION: Example of a binary distillation column operating with a feed at a non-optimal location.  Column has total reboil and no condenser.

Column-Distillation.TITLE: Binary Distillation with Open Steam Heating
Column-Distillation.DESCRIPTION: Binary distillation example involving open steam (direct steam) heating instead of a reboiler.

Column-Distillation.TITLE: Binary Distillation with Side Stream Product
Column-Distillation.DESCRIPTION: Binary distillation example involving a side stream product.

Column-Distillation.TITLE: Binary Flash Distillation Example
Column-Distillation.DESCRIPTION: Example problem focused on determining the operating conditions for a binary flash distillation column.

Column-Distillation.TITLE: Distillation - Murphree Efficiency
Column-Distillation.DESCRIPTION: Example describing the use of Murphree efficiency and its effect on the number of stages in a distillation column.

Column-Distillation.TITLE: Distillation - Side Stream Feed
Column-Distillation.DESCRIPTION: Example distillation problem consisting of feed and secondary side stream feed containing steam. Determines feed location and number of stages

Column-Distillation.TITLE: Distillation using Partial Condenser Part 1
Column-Distillation.DESCRIPTION: Example separations problem for distillation of acetone/ethanol. Balances and determining stage number and feed entrance included.

Column-Distillation.TITLE: Distillation using Partial Condenser Part 2
Column-Distillation.DESCRIPTION: A continuation of Distillation - Partial Condenser/Total Reboil. Determine the number stages for minimum reflux and total reflux.

Column-Distillation.TITLE: Distillation with no Distillate
Column-Distillation.DESCRIPTION: An example of a distillation column having no distillate stream and a total reboiler. Determine bottoms composition and composition of a sample of distillate taken at steady-state conditions.

Column-Distillation.TITLE: Impact of Feed on Liquid and Vapor Flows in a Distillation Column
Column-Distillation.DESCRIPTION: Uses an interactive simulation to describe the impact of the state of the feed to a distillation column on the liquid and vapor flow rates in the column

Column-Distillation.TITLE: McCabe-Thiele Graphical Method Example Part 1
Column-Distillation.DESCRIPTION: Uses the McCabe-Thiele graphical method to determine the number of equilibrium stages in a distillation column. Part 1 of 2.

Column-Distillation.TITLE: McCabe-Thiele Graphical Method Example Part 2
Column-Distillation.DESCRIPTION: Uses the McCabe-Thiele graphical method to determine the number of equilibrium stages in a distillation column. Part 2 of 2.

Column-Distillation.TITLE: McCabe-Thiele: Stepping off Stages
Column-Distillation.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates conceptually how to step off stages on a McCabe-Thiele diagram.

Column-Distillation.TITLE: Using the DePriester Chart for Vapor Liquid Equilibrium (simulation)
Column-Distillation.DESCRIPTION: Uses an interactive simulation to explain how to use a DePriester chart for hydrocarbons to determine K values and show how K values change with temperature, pressure, and hydrocarbon

Multi-Component.TITLE: Rachford-Rice Procedure for Isothermal Flash Distillation
Multi-Component.DESCRIPTION: Derives the Rachford-Rice procedure for isothermal flash distillation calculations for multiple components.

Mass-Transfer Limited.TITLE: Packed Bed Column Height
Mass-Transfer Limited.DESCRIPTION: An example describing how to calculate the height of a packed bed distillation column.

Liquid-Liquid Extraction.TITLE: Hunter-Nash Method 1: Mixing and Operating Points
Liquid-Liquid Extraction.DESCRIPTION: Shows how the mixing point and the operating point in the Hunter-Nash method are determined from mass balances on a two-stage liquid-liquid extraction. The points are located on a ternary phase diagram. An interactive simulations that explains a ternary phase diagram is located at: http://demonstrations.wolfram.com/RightAndEquilateralTriangleTernaryPhaseDiagrams

Liquid-Liquid Extraction.TITLE: Hunter-Nash Method 2: Number of Stages
Liquid-Liquid Extraction.DESCRIPTION: Shows how mass balances and phase equilibrium are used to determine the number of stages in the Hunter-Nash method for liquid-liquid extraction. Phase equilibrium and mixing and operating points are on a ternary phase diagram, and the screencast Hunter-Nash method 1 shows how those points are determined. A simulation that explains a ternary phase diagram is located at: http://demonstrations.wolfram.com/RightAndEquilateralTriangleTernaryPhaseDiagrams

Liquid-Liquid Extraction.TITLE: Hunter-Nash Method for LLE Example
Liquid-Liquid Extraction.DESCRIPTION: Uses the Hunter Nash method to determine the number of stages needed to achieve a specified liquid-liquid extraction separation.

Liquid-Liquid Extraction.TITLE: Hunter-Nash Method: LLE Example
Liquid-Liquid Extraction.DESCRIPTION: Uses the Hunter-Nash graphical method to solve a liquid-liquid extraction separation problem.

Liquid-Liquid Extraction.TITLE: Interpolating Tie Lines on a Ternary Diagram
Liquid-Liquid Extraction.DESCRIPTION: Describes how to interpolate equilibrium tie lines on a ternary diagram.

Liquid-Liquid Extraction.TITLE: Liquid-Liquid Equlibrium using UNIFAC
Liquid-Liquid Extraction.DESCRIPTION: Tutorial on using an UNIFAC spreadsheet for liquid-liquid equilibrium calculations.

Liquid-Liquid Extraction.TITLE: Partially Miscible Liquid-Liquid Extraction
Liquid-Liquid Extraction.DESCRIPTION: Determining the number of stages in a liquid-liquid extraction for a partially miscible system. Given equilibrium data, design the separations system.

Liquid-Liquid Extraction.TITLE: Plotting a Ternary Phase Diagram
Liquid-Liquid Extraction.DESCRIPTION: Develops a ternary phase diagram using equilibrium data.

Liquid-Liquid Extraction.TITLE: Ternary Phase Diagram Basics (Simulation)
Liquid-Liquid Extraction.DESCRIPTION: Uses a simulation to show how ternary phase diagrams are interpreted. This is for a single phase, three component system.

Absorption/Stripping.TITLE: Absorption of a Dilute Species
Absorption/Stripping.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the number of stages for an absorption column needed to remove chloroform from an air stream given inlet and outlet specifications.

Absorption/Stripping.TITLE: Kremser Analysis for a Dilute Absorber
Absorption/Stripping.DESCRIPTION: Uses the Kremser analysis to calculate the number of equilibrium stages needed in an absorption system.

Absorption/Stripping.TITLE: Non-Dilute Absorber Example
Absorption/Stripping.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the number of equilibrium stages necessary for the separation of CO2 from a gas stream containing N2 to a water solvent stream.

Absorption/Stripping.TITLE: Operation of an Absorption Column (Simulation)
Absorption/Stripping.DESCRIPTION: Uses an interactive simulation that shows the operation of an absorption column that is used to transfer a solute from a gas phase to a liquid phase.

Adsorption.TITLE: Adsorption Introduction
Adsorption.DESCRIPTION: Explains the concept of adsorption and derives the Langmuir isotherm.

Adsorption.TITLE: Langmuir Isotherms for Binary Mixture (Simulation)
Adsorption.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the amounts adsorbed on a surface for a binary gas mixture using an interactive Mathematica simulation. The adsorption is modeled using extended Langmuir isotherms.

Filtration.TITLE: Membrane Concentration Profile (Simulation)
Filtration.DESCRIPTION: Describes how to use an interactive simulation that plots concentration of a single component as a function distance into a membrane. It also calculates the flux and how it changes with diffusion constant, membrane thickness, and equilibrium constant

Filtration.TITLE: Membrane Transport: Series Resistances Part 1
Filtration.DESCRIPTION: Introduces series resistances through a membrane using a simple model for both liquids and gases. Part 1 of 3.

Filtration.TITLE: Membrane Transport: Series Resistances Part 2
Filtration.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how permeability is derived from the fluxes of molecules through a membrane. Part 2 of 3.

Filtration.TITLE: Membrane Transport: Series Resistances Part 3
Filtration.DESCRIPTION: Applies the resistance in series equation derived in part 2 to an example in which wastewater is cleaned up. Part 3 of 3.

Filtration.TITLE: Reverse Osmosis
Filtration.DESCRIPTION: Describes the process of reverse osmosis in which a membrane is used to separate a solvent-solute mixture because of a pressure difference across a membrane.

Filtration.TITLE: Reverse Osmosis: Changes in Driving Force
Filtration.DESCRIPTION: Describes how the driving force for reverse osmosis decreases due to concentration polarization and the increase in solute concentration due to solvent permeation.

Other Separation Techniques.TITLE: Osmolarity Example (Bio)
Other Separation Techniques.DESCRIPTION: Covers the basics of calculating osmolarity.

Other Separation Techniques.TITLE: Osmotic Shock Disruption (Bio)
Other Separation Techniques.DESCRIPTION: Uses osmotic shock as a method of disrupting (lysing) cells.

Other Separation Techniques.TITLE: Single-Effect Evaporator: Heat Transfer Area
Other Separation Techniques.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the heat transfer area for a single-effect evaporator that is used to concentrate a salt solution.

Other Separation Techniques.TITLE: Single-Effect Evaporator: Introduction
Other Separation Techniques.DESCRIPTION: Describes the operation of a single-effect evaporator which is used to concentrate a solution.

Other Separation Techniques.TITLE: Triple-Effect Evaporator: Backward Feed
Other Separation Techniques.DESCRIPTION: Describes how a triple-effect evaporator with backward feed concentrates a dilute solution.

Other Separation Techniques.TITLE: Triple-Effect Evaporator: Introduction
Other Separation Techniques.DESCRIPTION: Describes the operation of a triple-effect evaporator to concentrate a solute liquid solution using significantly less energy than a single-effect evaporator.

Diffusion.TITLE: Deriving Molar Transfer Flux Equations
Diffusion.DESCRIPTION: Derives the equations for molar fluxes using Fick's law of diffusion.

Diffusion.TITLE: Deriving the Differential Equations of Mass Transfer
Diffusion.DESCRIPTION: Derives the differential equations for mass transfer using the integral method and shell balances.

Diffusion.TITLE: Diffusion from Spherical Particle
Diffusion.DESCRIPTION: Determine the production rate of a species diffusing away from a reactive spherical particle.

Diffusion.TITLE: Diffusion into a Solid
Diffusion.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the time for carbon to diffuse into a metal alloy at high temperature.

Diffusion.TITLE: Diffusion Limited Drug Delivery (Bio)
Diffusion.DESCRIPTION: Derives the differential equation for a diffusion limited drug delivery system.

Diffusion.TITLE: Diffusion through a Carbon Rod: Part 1
Diffusion.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the initial rate of carbon dioxide production due to the reaction of carbon with oxygen diffusing through a quiescent boundary layer of air. Part 1 of 2.

Diffusion.TITLE: Diffusion through a Carbon Rod: Part 2
Diffusion.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the time for a carbon rod to disappear due to the reaction of carbon with oxygen diffusing through a boundary layer. Part 2 of 2.

Diffusion.TITLE: Equimolar Counterdiffusion (EMD)
Diffusion.DESCRIPTION: Derives the equations to use in the case of equimolar counterdiffusion (EMD).

Diffusion.TITLE: Equimolar Counterdiffusion Example
Diffusion.DESCRIPTION: Calculates species' velocities and molar flow rates for a binary mixture undergoing equimolar counterdiffusion.

Diffusion.TITLE: Hydrogen Diffusion through Palladium
Diffusion.DESCRIPTION: Example on hydrogen diffusion through palladium.

Diffusion.TITLE: Mass Transfer in a Catalyst Sphere
Diffusion.DESCRIPTION: Uses a shell balance to determine the rate of product formed with respect to time for a spherical catalyst.

Diffusion.TITLE: Unimolecular Diffusion (UMD)
Diffusion.DESCRIPTION: Derives the flux equations for the unimolecular diffusion of A through a stagnant film of B.

Diffusion.TITLE: Unimolecular Diffusion Example
Diffusion.DESCRIPTION: Uses the unimolecular diffusion flux equations to solve for initial flux and time to evaporate a fluid from a beaker.

Diffusion.TITLE: Unsteady-State Diffusion
Diffusion.DESCRIPTION: Derives the differential equations for unsteady-state diffusion for a herbicide spill into the air and soil.

Convection.TITLE: Convective Mass Transfer
Convection.DESCRIPTION: A lead tank contains water. Lead is leaching into the water through convective transfer. Determine a relationship between concentration of lead and the dependent variables of the system.

Convection.TITLE: Convective Mass Transfer: Part 1 (Bio)
Convection.DESCRIPTION: Derives an equation for convective mass transfer using a mass balance on a differential element. Part 1 of 2.

Convection.TITLE: Convective Mass Transfer: Part 2 (Bio)
Convection.DESCRIPTION: Finds the exiting concentration of a chemical agent leaving a blood vessel. Part 2 of 2.

Data Analysis.TITLE: Aliasing - Sound (Simulation)
Data Analysis.DESCRIPTION: This demonstration illustrates aliasing of a wave visually and aurally.

Data Analysis.TITLE: Anova Visualization (Simulation)
Data Analysis.DESCRIPTION: This demonstration helps visualize how one-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) works for three samples (I = 3) each with ten measurements (J1 = J2 = J3 = 10).

Data Analysis.TITLE: Binomial Distribution
Data Analysis.DESCRIPTION: derives binomial distribution for data analysis and gives an example

Data Analysis.TITLE: Calculating Confidence Intervals
Data Analysis.DESCRIPTION: Explains the theory behind calculating confidence intervals.

Data Analysis.TITLE: Central Limit Theorem (Simulation)
Data Analysis.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use a simulation that explores the central limit theorem by changing the number of experiments and number of measurements taken

Data Analysis.TITLE: Geometric Distribution
Data Analysis.DESCRIPTION: derives geometric distribution for data analysis and gives an example

Data Analysis.TITLE: Hypergeometric Distribution
Data Analysis.DESCRIPTION: derives the hypergeometric distribution for data analysis and gives an example

Data Analysis.TITLE: Implementing an F-Test in MATLAB and Excel
Data Analysis.DESCRIPTION: Uses MATLAB and Excel to perform an F-test.

Data Analysis.TITLE: Meaning of Student's t-Distribution (Simulation)
Data Analysis.DESCRIPTION: Explains student's t-distribution using a simulation.

Data Analysis.TITLE: Negative Binomial Distribution
Data Analysis.DESCRIPTION: derives the negative binomial distribution for data analysis and gives an example

Data Analysis.TITLE: One-Way ANOVA in Excel
Data Analysis.DESCRIPTION: Uses Excel to perform a one-way ANOVA analysis test.

Data Analysis.TITLE: P-Value From Test Statistic (Simulation)
Data Analysis.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the test statistic simulation that shows how to determine the p-value from a test statistic.

Data Analysis.TITLE: Simple One-Way ANOVA in MATLAB
Data Analysis.DESCRIPTION: Performs a one-way ANOVA test using MATLAB.

Data Analysis.TITLE: Square Wave
Data Analysis.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use a simulation that demonstrates how to create a square wave from various sin waves

Data Analysis.TITLE: The Meaning of a One-Way ANOVA
Data Analysis.DESCRIPTION: Explains a one-way ANOVA analysis which tells you the likelihood that the population mean of at least one sample differs from the others.

Data Analysis.TITLE: The Meaning of a Two-Factor ANOVA
Data Analysis.DESCRIPTION: Explains a two-factor ANOVA which tells you the likelihood that one or both of your experimental factors makes a significant difference in your measured value.

Data Analysis.TITLE: The Meaning of an F-Test
Data Analysis.DESCRIPTION: Explains the meaning of an F-test and what the p-value from an f-test represents.

Data Analysis.TITLE: Two-sample T-Test and Type-1 Error
Data Analysis.DESCRIPTION: A conceptual discussion of a two-sample t-test and what it means to make a Type-I error, along with the meaning of the p-value that is generated by the test.

Data Analysis.TITLE: What does a 95% Confidence Interval Mean? Part 1
Data Analysis.DESCRIPTION: Discusses the meaning of a 95% confidence interval. Part 1 of 2.

Data Analysis.TITLE: What does a 95% Confidence Interval Mean? Part 2
Data Analysis.DESCRIPTION: Discusses the meaning of a 95% confidence interval using graphical interpretations. Part 2 of 2.

Regression.TITLE: Creating a Scatter Plot Using Regression Analysis
Regression.DESCRIPTION: Plots experimental and theoretical data using regression analysis.

Regression.TITLE: Linear Regression: Meaning of Confidence Intervals for the Slope & Intercept
Regression.DESCRIPTION: Explains the meaning of confidence intervals for the slope and intercept in linear regression.

Regression.TITLE: Linear Regression: Meaning of p-Values for the Slope & Intercept
Regression.DESCRIPTION: Explains the meaning of p-values for the slope and intercept in linear regression.

Regression.TITLE: Model Fitting and Regression in Matlab
Regression.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to model a curve and perform regression in Matlab.

Regression.TITLE: Multiple Regression in Excel
Regression.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to use multiple regression in Excel 2010.

Regression.TITLE: Non-Linear Regression Introduction
Regression.DESCRIPTION: Uses non-linear regression to obtain kinetic parameters from kinetic data obtained from an isothermal CSTR. POLYMATH is used to carry out the regression.

Regression.TITLE: Non-Linear Regression/POLYMATH
Regression.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use POLYMATH software to carry out non-linear regression to determine kinetic parameters from tabulated data. Uses the same data presented in the screencast titled Non-Linear Regression Introduction.

Regression.TITLE: Nonlinear Transformations (Simulation)
Regression.DESCRIPTION: This demonstration shows how transformations can be used to manipulate nonlinear equations into a form for linear regression analysis.

Regression.TITLE: Regression Fitting in Excel-1
Regression.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to set up regression calculations in Excel 2010 for a simple function.

Regression.TITLE: Regression Fitting in Excel-2
Regression.DESCRIPTION: Explains how to set up regression calculations in Excel 2010 for more complex functions than presented in part 1 of this series.

Regression.TITLE: Simple Linear Regression (Simulation)
Regression.DESCRIPTION: Describes how to use an interactive simulation to demonstrate simple linear regression with outliers.

What is Thermodynamics?.TITLE: Thermodynamics Introduction
What is Thermodynamics?.DESCRIPTION: An overview of chapter 1 of the Elliott and Lira thermodynamics textbook.

What is Thermodynamics?.TITLE: Three Intermolecular Potential Models (Simulation)
What is Thermodynamics?.DESCRIPTION: Describes how to use an interactive simulation that shows intermolecular potentials versus distance for two molecules (A and B) and a potential for their interaction (A-B). The simulation is located at: http://demonstrations.wolfram.com/ThreeIntermolecularPotentialModels/

Steam Tables.TITLE: Advanced Interpolation
Steam Tables.DESCRIPTION: Performs interpolation multiple times to calculate specific volume given pressure and temperature.

Steam Tables.TITLE: Heat Removal to Condense a Vapor Mixture
Steam Tables.DESCRIPTION: Describes the steps to condense a binary vapor mixture at its dew point to a liquid at its bubble point using the concept of state functions.

Steam Tables.TITLE: Linear Interpolation
Steam Tables.DESCRIPTION: Calculates saturated pressure by linear interpolation using information from the steam tables.

Steam Tables.TITLE: Properties of Liquid Water in Steam Tables
Steam Tables.DESCRIPTION: Determines the properties of liquid water when the pressure is greater than saturation pressure using the steam tables.

Steam Tables.TITLE: Quality of Steam: Mass and Volume Fractions
Steam Tables.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the difference between mass and volume fractions, as a function of quality, for vapor-liquid equilibrium of water.

Steam Tables.TITLE: Steam Tables: Calculating Quality
Steam Tables.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the quality of a two-phase water mixture in vapor-liquid equilibrium using steam tables.

Steam Tables.TITLE: Compare Steam Tables to Ideal Gas Law
Steam Tables.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the volume of a gas using the ideal gas law and compares to the volume at the same conditions from the steam tables.

Steam Tables.TITLE: Introduction to Steam Tables
Steam Tables.DESCRIPTION: Steam tables are used to solve two example problems: 1) density at critical point, 2), quality of liquid-vapor mixture.

Steam Tables.TITLE: Introduction to Steam Tables 2
Steam Tables.DESCRIPTION: Steam tables are used to solve two example problems: 1) throttle liquid water from high pressure, 2) heat liquid-vapor mixture at constant volume.

Steam Tables.TITLE: Quality of Steam
Steam Tables.DESCRIPTION: Defines vapor quality and compares mass percent and volume percent of steam.

Steam Tables.TITLE: Steam Tables: Constant Volume Process
Steam Tables.DESCRIPTION: Use steam tables to determine the final conditions when water vapor is cooled.

Steam Tables.TITLE: Steam Tables: Interpolation
Steam Tables.DESCRIPTION: Example problems that calculate enthalpy of steam by interpolation of steam tables.

Steam Tables.TITLE: Water Properties from Steam Tables
Steam Tables.DESCRIPTION: Use steam tables to determine properties of water.

Closed System Energy Balances.TITLE: Calculate Work for Reversible and Irreversible Expansion/Compression
Closed System Energy Balances.DESCRIPTION: Shows graphical on a pressure-volume diagram the areas that are proportional to work for reversible and irreversible expansions and compressions of a gas in a piston/cylinder.

Closed System Energy Balances.TITLE: Expansion in a Piston-Cylinder
Closed System Energy Balances.DESCRIPTION: Examines the expansion of water in a piston-cylinder device when heat is added to the system.

Closed System Energy Balances.TITLE: Flow Between Tanks Containing Water of Different Qualities (Interactive)
Closed System Energy Balances.DESCRIPTION: MCQ: A value connecting two tanks, one with water at 85% quality and one with water at 95% quality is opened. Which direction does steam flow? Interactive screencast.

Open System Energy Balances.TITLE: Compare Gas Flow Through Expansion Valve and Turbine (Interactive)

Open System Energy Balances.TITLE: Joule-Thomson Expansion (Simulation)

Open System Energy Balances.TITLE: Throttle High-Pressure Water (Simulation)

Entropy.TITLE: Enthalpy-Entropy Diagram (Simulation)

Ideal VLE (Raoult's Law).TITLE: Adiabatic Flash of Binary Liquid (Spreadsheet Solution)

The solution that is used in the Excel program was developed in a separate screencast.
