Reaction Equilibria.TITLE: Kinetics and Thermodynamics
Reaction Equilibria.DESCRIPTION: Discuss the differences between reaction kinetics and thermodynamics and describes how thermodynamics is important in kinetics and reactor design.

Reaction Equilibria.TITLE: Perturb Heterogeneous Equilibrium (Interactive)
Reaction Equilibria.DESCRIPTION: MCQ: When a solid is added to a system that is in chemical equilibrium, what happens to the equilibrium partial pressures? Interactive screencast.

Reaction Equilibria.TITLE: Reversible Reaction in an Adiabatic PFR (Simulation)
Reaction Equilibria.DESCRIPTION: Describes how to use an interactive simulation in which a reversible reaction takes place in an adiabatic plug flow reactor. The equilibrium conversion is calculated for either an exothermic or endothermic reaction. The feed temperature and the amount of inert in the feed can be changed. The simulation is located at: http://demonstrations.wolfram.com/ReversibleReactionInAnAdiabaticPlugFlowReactor/

Reaction Equilibria.TITLE: Which Reaction Reaches Equilibrium First? (Interactive)
Reaction Equilibria.DESCRIPTION: MCQ: Given the equilibrium constants for two reactions, what can be concluded about which reaction reaches equilibrium first or which has a higher equilibrium conversion? Interactive screencast.

Reaction Equilibria.TITLE: Chemical Equilibrium: Effect of an Inert
Reaction Equilibria.DESCRIPTION: Examine how adding an inert changes the equilibrium conversion of a gas-phase reaction for both isothermal and adiabatic cases.

Reaction Equilibria.TITLE: Diluent Effect on Equilibrium Conversion
Reaction Equilibria.DESCRIPTION: Explains how a diluent (an unreactive solvent) affects the equilibrium conversion in an adiabatic reactor.

Reaction Equilibria.TITLE: Gas Phase Chemical Equilibrium
Reaction Equilibria.DESCRIPTION: Determine the equilibrium conversion of a gas phase reaction with and without the presence of an inert.

Reaction Equilibria.TITLE: Inert Effect on Chemical Equilibrium
Reaction Equilibria.DESCRIPTION: Discusses the effect of adding an inert gas at constant temperature to a chemical reaction at equilibrium at either constant pressure or constant volume.

Reaction Equilibria.TITLE: Inert Effect on Equilibrium
Reaction Equilibria.DESCRIPTION: Calculate the effect of an inert on the equilibrium conversion.

Reaction Equilibria.TITLE: Gibbs Phase Rule: Reacting Systems
Reaction Equilibria.DESCRIPTION: Explains the Gibbs phase rule when chemical reactions take place.

Reaction Equilibria.TITLE: Description of the Reaction Coordinate
Reaction Equilibria.DESCRIPTION: Explains the energy versus reaction coordinate diagram. Relates the activation energies for the forward and reverse reactions of an exothermic reaction to the equilibrium constant dependence on temperature.

Reaction Equilibria.TITLE: Solid-Liquid Chemical Equilibrium
Reaction Equilibria.DESCRIPTION: An example of heterogeneous chemical equilibrium with both liquid and solid phases. Estimate the maximum temperature at which calcium (liquid) reduces thorium dioxide (solid).

Reaction Equilibria.TITLE: Standard State in Chemical Equilibrium
Reaction Equilibria.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates that changing the standard state from a gas to a liquid for water in the water gas shift reaction changes the equilibrium constant but not the equilibrium composition.

Reaction Equilibria.TITLE: Catalytic Selectivity and Equilibrium
Reaction Equilibria.DESCRIPTION: An overview of the benefit of catalysts in both reaction selectivity and equilibrium.

Reaction Equilibria.TITLE: Chemical Equilibrium and LeChatelier's Principle
Reaction Equilibria.DESCRIPTION: Uses an interactive Mathematica simulation to demonstrate the behavior for gas-phase equilibrium for ammonia formation from nitrogen and hydrogen. Demonstrates the behavior as change temperature or pressure or as add H2, H2, or NH3.

Reaction Equilibria.TITLE: Equilibrium Constant Introduction
Reaction Equilibria.DESCRIPTION: Explains the equilibrium constant for an ideal gas and for a liquid.

Reaction Equilibria.TITLE: Gas-Phase Reaction Equilibrium
Reaction Equilibria.DESCRIPTION: Apply chemical equilibrium to a gas-phase reaction and determine the effect of temperature on equilibrium conversion.

Reaction Equilibria.TITLE: LeChatelier's Principle Does Not Always Work
Reaction Equilibria.DESCRIPTION: Presents an example where LeChatelier's principle predicts the wrong direction for the equilibrium shift. The reaction is N2 + 3 H2 --> NH3  The number of moles at equilibrium are calculated using an interactive Mathematica simulation

Reaction Equilibria.TITLE: The Equilibrium Constant
Reaction Equilibria.DESCRIPTION: Explains why the equilibrium constant is dimensionless and why it is independent of pressure.

Reaction Equilibria.TITLE: Gas-Phase Equilibrium Conversion Part 1
Reaction Equilibria.DESCRIPTION: The equilibrium conversion for a gas-phase reaction at 80C is calculated by first calculating the equilibrium constant at 25C from the Gibbs free energy of formation, and then calculating the equilibrium constant at 80C using the van't Hoff equation. Part 1 of 2.

Reaction Equilibria.TITLE: Gas-Phase Equilibrium Conversion Part 2
Reaction Equilibria.DESCRIPTION: The equilibrium conversion for a gas phase reaction at 80C is calculated using the equilibrium constant determined in part 1. Part 2 of 2.

Reaction Equilibria.TITLE: Heat of Reaction (from Heat of Formation)
Reaction Equilibria.DESCRIPTION: Determine the heat of reaction at a higher temperature from the heat of reaction at 25 C.

Biosystems.TITLE: Protein Stability (BIO)
Biosystems.DESCRIPTION: The effect of a denaturant on the stability of a protein is determined using Gibbs Free Energy dependence on denaturant concentration.

Biosystems.TITLE: Unfolded Protein Equilibrium (BIO)
Biosystems.DESCRIPTION: Use the Gibbs free energy change to determine the fraction of protein unfolded at equilibrium.

Biosystems.TITLE: Equilibrium Protein Binding (BIO)
Biosystems.DESCRIPTION: Use equilibrium constants to determine the enthalpy and entropy of folding two proteins.

Thermal Effects.TITLE: Adiabatic Flame Temperature
Thermal Effects.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the adiabatic flame temperature when butane burns in pure oxygen.

Thermal Effects.TITLE: Adiabatic Reactor Temperature
Thermal Effects.DESCRIPTION: Calculate the adiabatic reactor temperature for a reversible reaction.

Thermal Effects.TITLE: Adiabatic Temperature
Thermal Effects.DESCRIPTION: Calculate the adiabatic temperature for a reactor with 30% conversion.

Thermal Effects.TITLE: Heat Removal from a Chemical Reactor
Thermal Effects.DESCRIPTION: Determine heat removal so that a chemical reactor is isothermal.

Spreadsheet Examples/Tutorials.TITLE: Adiabatic Compressor: Non-Ideal Gas
Spreadsheet Examples/Tutorials.DESCRIPTION: Uses the Peng-Robinson equation of state to calculate the exit temperature from an adiabatic compressor. The EOS spreadsheet that is used can be found on www.cheThermodynamics.net/software.

Spreadsheet Examples/Tutorials.TITLE: Determine Pressure using Peng-Robinson EOS Spreadsheet
Spreadsheet Examples/Tutorials.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the pressure, given the temperature, number of kg of propane, and volume of tank using the Peng-Robinson equation of state spreadsheet. The spreadsheet is available at: http://sourceforge.net/projects/chethermo/

Spreadsheet Examples/Tutorials.TITLE: Simpson's Rule/Excel
Spreadsheet Examples/Tutorials.DESCRIPTION: Use Simpson's rule in a spreadsheet to calculate the integral for a set of data.

Spreadsheet Examples/Tutorials.TITLE: Using "What If" Data Table in Excel
Spreadsheet Examples/Tutorials.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the What If tool in Excel to generate a Data Table for a spreadsheet that calculates values as a function of two variables. In this example, the spreadsheet calculates state properties for water -i.e., it calculates values in steam tables.

Spreadsheet Examples/Tutorials.TITLE: Isothermal Compression of a Non-Ideal Gas (Spreadsheet)
Spreadsheet Examples/Tutorials.DESCRIPTION: Uses equation of state spreadsheet to solve isothermal compression-part 2. See "Isothermal Compression of a Non-Ideal Gas." Spreadsheet can be downloaded from www.cheThermodynamics.net/software.

Spreadsheet Examples/Tutorials.TITLE: Calculate Fugacities for Mixtures Using an EOS Spreadsheet
Spreadsheet Examples/Tutorials.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use a spreadsheet for the Peng-Robinson equation of state for mixtures to determine fugacities and fugacity coefficients. Spreadsheet can be downloaded from http://www.chethermo.net/software.

Spreadsheet Examples/Tutorials.TITLE: Calculate VLE Using an EOS Spreadsheet
Spreadsheet Examples/Tutorials.DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use a spreadsheet for the Peng-Robinson equation of state for mixtures to determine vapor-liquid equilibrium. The example calculates the bubble point pressure and vapor compositions given temperature and liquid compositions.

Spreadsheet Examples/Tutorials.TITLE: Peng-Robinson EOS Spreadsheet 1
Spreadsheet Examples/Tutorials.DESCRIPTION: A tutorial on using a Peng-Robinson equation of state spreadsheet. Spreadsheet available for download at www.cheThermodynamics.net/software.

Spreadsheet Examples/Tutorials.TITLE: Peng-Robinson EOS Spreadsheet 2
Spreadsheet Examples/Tutorials.DESCRIPTION: A tutorial on using a Peng-Robinson equation of state spreadsheet for single-component equilibrium. Spreadsheet can be downloaded from www.cheThermodynamics.net/software.

Spreadsheet Examples/Tutorials.TITLE: Liquid-Liquid Equlibrium using UNIFAC
Spreadsheet Examples/Tutorials.DESCRIPTION: Tutorial on using an UNIFAC spreadsheet for liquid-liquid equilibrium calculations.

Spreadsheet Examples/Tutorials.TITLE: VLE Calculations with UNIFAC
Spreadsheet Examples/Tutorials.DESCRIPTION: Tutorial on a spreadsheet for VLE calculations using UNIFAC.

COSMOtherm.TITLE: COSMOtherm: Activity Coefficients & Excess Gibbs Free Energy
COSMOtherm.DESCRIPTION: A tutorial on using COSMOtherm to determine activity coefficients and use them to calculate the excess Gibbs free energy of a mixture.

COSMOtherm.TITLE: COSMOtherm: Boiling Temperatures and Bubble Points
COSMOtherm.DESCRIPTION: A tutorial on using Cosmotherm to determine the boiling points of a species and the bubble point of a mixture.

COSMOtherm.TITLE: COSMOtherm: Molecular Interactions Probability
COSMOtherm.DESCRIPTION: Tutorial on using COSMOtherm to determine molecular interaction probability in a binary mixture.

COSMOtherm.TITLE: COSMOtherm: Pxy Diagram
COSMOtherm.DESCRIPTION: A tutorial on using COSMOtherm to create a Pxy diagram for a binary mixture.

COSMOtherm.TITLE: COSMOtherm: Vapor Pressures
COSMOtherm.DESCRIPTION: A tutorial on using COSMOtherm to determine vapor pressures.

COSMOtherm.TITLE: COSMOtherm: Visualizing Molecular Interactions
COSMOtherm.DESCRIPTION: A tutorial on using COSMOtherm to create visual representations of molecular interactions.
